story:
Who We Are...

Prince Maxwell is a start-up based out of Charleston, West Virginia, created by Bianca Prince and Candice Maxwell. (That's how we got our name!)
Our company mission for the future is to work with small businesses, organizations and creative individuals that will help support and grow our local community, as well as the state of West Virginia. 
The easiest label to give Prince Maxwell would be that we are a public relations, consulting and solutions firm. However, we believe in thinking outside of the box, which often leads us to unique opportunities and diverse experiences. 

What We Need and Why...

Launching a new business is a challenge, but the future of growth in West Virginia is dependent on entrepreneurs to create new jobs.

To get our business off of the ground, we need to purchase our own domain name, pay back the money lent to us for our business license and establish our credibility in the community... Just for starters.  There are many hurdles on the way to becoming a successful business, especially in West Virginia, which take time and money. 


How We Will Use Your Donations...

Along with the larger items, like purchasing a domain name, there are many costs involved with starting and successfully running a small, local business. Some of the things we plan to use your gracious donations include: 

- Business License 
- Web Hosting
- Domain Name
- Business Cards
- Office Essentials
- Travel Expenses
- Business apps, like email, etc.

As you can imagine, these and other miscellaneous costs can add up quickly. These donations also go towards our dream of one day acquiring an office space, 

Giving Back!

10% of the funds raised will be donated to Charleston's Heart and Hand, a non-profit mission project. Our money will help them get much-needed doors for their new building!
Heart and Hand is a wonderful non-profit that has programs assisting with food, home repair, construction, utilities, rent, clothing and more.

What Your Donation Means To Us...

Prince Maxwell is not just a public relations firm. We believe in supporting local companies and individuals whose mission benefits our community. By supporting our dream of a firm you are supporting other awesome businesses and organizations in West Virginia, creating more jobs and general "good-doer-y."  

We are so grateful for your support in this endeavor. 


Can't Donate? You Can Still Help!

Even if you cannot donate to our campaign, you can still give us a super helpful hand by word of mouth, sharing us on social media and general good vibes. If the community believes in us, that is just as good as money. 

Being a start-up means that any amount of donations will further our progress. However, with any new business there will be challenges. The biggest risk is the question of sustainability. However, we are committed to making this business a success and excited to take this risk with you. 


           

Follow us on Facebook and Twitter!

story:
Zeke's Tree is Ready to Grow

Zeke's Tree was founded by us, DJ and Niki Faller, in 2014 and has grown into a small retail shop and website. We partner with artisan groups from conservation critical landscapes and create handmade products that celebrate and preserve biodiversity. Presently our partners work from Nicaragua, Peru, and Indonesia. We work out of Sioux City, Iowa. Zeke's Tree is self funded; we need additional funds to reach a larger ready market.   

    • Together we hold three degrees including Accounting, Landscape Architecture, and Sustainable Development in Latin America (International Relations). Neither of us are strangers to poverty, and both of us advanced in our work because of community encouragement and access to education. We have proven records in design, business, and community service. 
    • People are the dreamers, seers, and makers of bright tomorrows. We are creators. Within our toolbox is art and science - a powerful marriage. This campaign will generate the funds we need to advance our brand through strong, direct relationships.  
    • We want to save species, discover new ones, and support local communities as they develop a productive role in the landscape around them and further afield. We want nothing less and nothing more than a positive approach to creating beauty and change in the world.    

Help us reach the market

We have exciting product lines in development with our partner communities. We want to launch those items with panache and in person! This campaign will fund three trunk shows (Seattle, New York, and Houston) and update our website. We have been in business for a year and a half and conclude we need to reach beyond Sioux City. Our website (www.zekestree.com) is fully functional, but the content is outdated (the shop address is wrong, for example, and we no longer stock many of the items on the front page). We want to develop a website that focuses exclusively on our partner communities and the products they are making.

  • $2000 will be allocated toward each of the four marketing venues (website update, three trunk shows) 
  • Our perks are items made by partner communities over the past year. They are limited in number and will no longer be offered when they are depleted. 
  • If we don't reach our funding goal we will use the amount raised to reach each venue in this order: website update, Seattle, New York, Houston trunk shows.
Our Facebook page is a great place to see dated info about our work: 
https://www.facebook.com/pages/Zekes-Tree/48731...

The Impact

It's impossible to overstate the power of employment and creating beauty. Pride, dignity, understanding, a feeling of strong connection. The race to save species has never been more urgent. Not only are these handmade objects creating alternative sources of employment, but they are also gently teaching both the makers and the market that the work of our hands really does matter. 

We look for three main things in artisan partner communities. A strong desire to work on behalf of their local landscape, a conservation priority, and an existing skill set with little or no connection to the global market. Our three partner communities include: 

  • Loma Panda, a women's ceramic cooperative located in the Somoto area of Nicaragua. We are actively cultivating and seeking artisan groups along Nicaragua's eastern and western coasts. 
  • The Yanesha women's associations of Peru's Central Selva. The Yanesha are guardians of rare indigenous cotton species, species that naturally produce colors such as pink, green, brown and even black! We are excited to be working in partnership with the Yanesha under the auspices of Chirapaq to create and market new products made with these precious species.
  • Our newest collaboration is with Gunung Palung Orangutan Conservation Project, in Indonesia. We expect rich new stories and extraordinary designs to emerge from the people who live around Gunung Palung.

Risks & Challenges

Zeke's Tree is the flight of a lifelong dream and we will never give up. The biggest risk is that these hardworking artisans won't have the opportunity to reach an audience large enough to generate meaningful, sustainable work. We have stretched our personal funds to be able to continue at the current rate, but we do not have the market in Sioux City alone to take Zeke's Tree to the scale it requires. Our artisan partners are some of the most inspiring people we have met and they deserve to be the ones to strengthen their respective corners of the world. Our challenge is to find people who also want to reach and support them. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute please keep in touch. We may be coming to a city near you very soon!

  • We are excited about the future and hope you'll stay in contact through our Facebook page or newsletter!
  • Spread the word! We'd love to hear from groups or individuals with interest in our work, or who might be able to host a trunk show in a high traffic area. 

Welcome to the treetops!

story:
Company and project presentation

Efeito Verde (EV) is a business started in 2004 as a distributor of products mostly targeting market niches such as vegetarians, vegans, celiacs, and ecological and other concerned consumers. Our trademark Midzu, registered by EV, is already familiar to many consumers worldwide.

EV started small as a hobby for their founders. But thanks to dedicated partners, employees, and friends, EV grew, step by step, from a small room in a house to two rented stores and additional storage. EV currently occupies about 250 m2, which are already not enough for inventory, processing facilities, and office space.

EV purchased a nice plot of land and we have almost enough money to build a warehouse. Our scheduled opening is April 2016. That will not only free rent money, but above all, it will give more space and freedom to work and grow.

So why more funding?

The money left over after purchasing the land is not enough to build as much as needed for the next years.  We need the building to be as large as possible so that it will serve us for many years, even at the current growing rate. The larger the budget, the larger the building, and the better it will be equipped.

Why crowd funding and not bank funding?

We are a part of the community of concerned consumers. Instead of paying interest to someone else, we think it is much better to rely on the community we belong to and offer better service and prices in return to those who will help us grow.  We want to continue to offer healthy food. So this is also an opportunity for us to hear from you and to thank you for believing in this project and helping it grow.

What donors receive in exchange?

1) All donors will receive updates about the project by e-mail.

2) A wide selection of perks is available to all those who help, from small gifts to lifetime discounts. Here are some of the web sites where you can use the discounts you will receive:

Portugal: www.efeitoverde.com

Brazil: www.midzu.com.br

Spain: www.midzu.es

Italy: www.midzu.it

Other countries [English]: www.midzu.com

What happens if the amount raised is less than the target?

The warehouse will somehow be built and will possibly be finished by April 2016, the only questions remaining are the size and what equipments will be installed right away.

Whatever the amount raised, contributors will always receive their perks. Discounts will be granted right after you donate.

Thank you for anything you can contribute. We will also invite you to our opening ceremony probably in April 2016. You will be invited when we get the final date. Meanwhile, we appreciate all your contributions, be them financial, commercial or just spreading the word!
story_txt:
Company and project presentation
Efeito Verde (EV) is a business started in 2004 as
a distributor of products mostly targeting market niches such as
vegetarians, vegans, celiacs, and ecological and other concerned
consumers. Our trademark Midzu, registered by EV, is already familiar
to many consumers worldwide.

EV started small as a hobby for their founders.
But thanks to dedicated partners, employees, and friends, EV grew,
step by step, from a small room in a house to two rented stores and
additional storage.  EV currently occupies about 250 m2, which are
already not enough for inventory, processing facilities, and
office space.

EV purchased a nice plot of land and
we have almost enough money to build a warehouse.  Our scheduled
opening is April 2016.  That will not only free rent money, but above
all,  it will give more space and freedom to work and grow.

So why more funding?

The money left over after purchasing the land is not enough to build as much as needed for the next years.   We need the building
to be as large as possible so that it will serve us for many years, even at the current growing rate.
The larger the budget, the larger the building, and the better it
will be equipped.


Why crowd funding and not bank funding?

We are a part of the community of concerned consumers.  Instead of paying interest to someone else, we think it is much better to rely on the community we belong to and offer better service and prices in return to those who will help us grow.  We want
to continue to offer healthy food.  So this is also an opportunity
for us to hear from you and to thank you for believing in this
project and helping it grow.

project by e-mail.

sites where you can use the discounts you will receive:

2016.  You will be invited when we get the final date. Meanwhile, we

story:
Why Build CENTER?

In 2007, I shifted from teaching middle school language arts and social studies to high school ESL.  Over the next seven years, I worked closely with Julie Kasper in creating a department that was responsive to the changes in the Arizona State Legislature and our local school district and to the changing demographics in our student population.  Although our career paths have currently diverged a bit, our collaboration and innovation continue.  Here is her story and the story of CENTER:

Having taught ESL and ELD in our public schools for over 13 years, I realized that a shift was necessary - both for myself, for our educational system, and most importantly for all those it serves.  As School Coordinator for Refugee Resettlement in Tucson, I've had the unique opportunity to dialog and work with people from many different walks of life - all of whom contribute significantly to the educational experiences of refugee and immigrant youth from birth to young adulthood.  In response to the varied and pressing needs that have been shared with me and in celebration of the knowledge, skills, and beautiful dreams that fill our city, CENTER: A Finding Voice Space is being launched.  It builds on some of the Finding Voice Project work that took place at Catalina Magnet High School between 2006-2014, but rather than being housed at one school and serving only one student population, the idea is to build and develop something sustainable in collaboration with the larger Tucson community for all who wish to engage and all who can benefit from our work to transform the educational landscape for linguistically and culturally diverse learners.  This is an entirely new world for me - and an exciting journey to be on with you.  Imagine all refugee, immigrant, and globally-minded education stakeholders in Tucson connecting in one powerful, dynamic, and creative network.  That is who we will be and what CENTER will become.  Contribute today to this collective and collaborative adventure!   Thank you!!

What We Need & What You Get

As a start-up we are in need of just about everything, but because we are lean and flexible, we will make this happen on whatever scale is possible during our initial launch.  The more you give, the more we can develop and offer – but have no fear because this is happening and it’s going to be amazing thanks to people like you!

  • $25 contributes to costs for printing paper, toner, & other office supplies essential in any learning environment
  • $50 buys backpacks and school supplies for 2 newly arrived refugee students
  • $100 pays for a 5 gallon tub of paint to help us brighten up the space
  • $150 buys a modular, extendable table for the tutoring space
  • $200 will purchase 4-5 comfortable desk/table chairs for the tutoring space
  • $250 allows us to purchase an iPad mini or other tablet for use by tutors and mentors in their work with students (and by students themselves of course)
  • $300 helps us install computer drops, wi-fi, and other tech necessities
  • $500 covers the cost of monthly utilities (more or less)
  • $1000 buys a new, fully-equipped desktop computer for student, parent, and teacher use
  • $2000 allows us to have projection (2 projectors & screens for workshops, classes, celebrations, and more)
  • $3000 covers publication costs for a beautiful & important volume of student writing (annual)

Each dollar you give goes directly into the space, the programs, and the community we serve.  And for each $25 dollars you give, we’d like to recognize your contribution on our website and in our social media campaigns.  Give $100 or more and we’d love to also recognize you (or a loved one you name) in our annual report and in our annual publication.  Give $250 or more and we’ll put your name on a bronze plaque above one of the computer workstations.  Give $1000 and we’ll invite you to a Founding Members’ special event and tour of CENTER, as well as provide all the perks already listed.

The Impact

Your contribution will mean that:

  • Students new to our country, many of whom are learning English and trying to adjust to a very different and often challenging environment, will have a safe haven – a place they can relax, be themselves, nurture their talents and interests, and find support to help them thrive personally and academically.
  • Parents and family members of refugee and immigrant pK-12 students will have a place to go to learn more about the U.S. (and AZ) schooling system, to ask questions about the many school documents they receive, to learn about early childhood literacy and numeracy practices, to discover ways they can support their child to complete schoolwork, and to build connections with teachers and school staff in ways that are comfortable, positive, and enduring.
  • Teachers, administrators, and school staff will have a space for collaborative planning, to learn more about refugee resettlement and global realities, to hone their skills through professional development offerings to work more effectively with culturally and linguistically diverse learners, and to find the support, recognition, leadership opportunities, and community they need to do their best work in their schools and classrooms.
  • Refugee resettlement case managers and other agency staff will be able to provide newly arriving families with a calendar of educational events and supports that they can immediately take part in, as well as help their clients understand how and where to find help related to educational concerns.
  • Community partners will be able to connect with the wonderfully diverse residents of Tucson and develop new and exciting projects to enliven our city, help us all grow personally and professionally, and build a stronger foundation for our collective development and the future of our region.

Risks & Challenges

We are a small team, but mighty!  We have been working in the education and refugee resettlement fields for many years, and we have a lively, intelligent, and committed board to help us understand and overcome obstacles that arise.  This is a project we are building with the idea of systems change and sustainability in mind.  We are using a collective impact – or collaborative development – model.  All of these aspects of our organization and our work make us responsive, flexible, strong, and able to weather storms that may arise.

Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes funds are tight on the home-front.  We get that!  But don’t fret.  Because you have read this far, we know you want to help get this project off the ground.  Here are some other ways to help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign and CENTER.  Use the Indiegogo share tools or whatever social media (and traditional media) tools you love.
  • Host a dinner party and tell your friends/family about this project – encourage them to give if they are able.
  • Contact us for volunteer opportunities or to make donations of useful items for CENTER and for our community of learners.

story:
Lake Como CASETTA Renovation Project

Hi, my name is Erika, I'm Italo Australian and I love Lake Como. I have a lovely casetta - Italian for 'my cozy place', on Italian Lake Como village Azzano. I now live in Australia and I only visit Lake Como once a year - my casetta feels lonely! I'd like to put the apartment on Airbnb and share it with the rest of the world. Only problem is - it needs renovation. It's got major water stains on the ceiling, the electrical system is old, and the paint job is shocking - well, it's 110 years old!

Here's my idea: if you can support the project financially, once it's ready you can come and stay at my casetta - check out accommodation availability using the CASETTA Calendar. You can stay for one night or several nights, according to how much you contribute (see Crowdfunding Perks for more info).

If you cannot travel to Italy, but you are interested in language learning, I can offer you Italian classes online - I'm a qualified teacher with a PhD in language teaching  (my LinkedIn profile here). I'm happy to customize your learning experience based on your interests, needs, etc. I can also organize gift vouchers with online language classes - a different Christmas or birthday present for your friends or loved ones!

More information

Azzano village is located between the towns of Argegno and Menaggio, opposite Bellagio, on Lake Como (Italy). Azzano, short for Azzano di Mezzegra, is well served by public transport, with the bus C10 connection to Como's train station. The city of Como is located 40 km from Milan, city of EXPO 2015.

https://www.google.it/maps/place/Azzano+CO/@45.9676327,9.2933801,12z/data=!4m2!3m1!1s0x47842325940e06dd:0x737b56971cc0e4db?hl=en%20.

The apartment is located minutes away from the lake shore. It's a charming, old-school place. It's got a fully equipped kitchen/living area, with gas stove, fridge, TV and  a fireplace for a cozy atmophere. A spacious bedroom with breathtaking views, and a small bathroom with bath and a washing machine. It  sleeps up to 5 people in total: there's a queen size bed and 3 sofa beds (2 in the bedroom and 1 in the living area). Please note: the house is on the third floor, with no lift - unfortunately it has no access for wheelchairs.


Azzano  village is very small but has everything you need: a post office, a supermarket, a bakery, newsagents, cafes, restaurants and, of course, the local pub. The Lake Como area hosts several events and festivals related to sport, music and food - especially during the summer season. Check out Lake Como Events Portal  for more info on what's on when. The Lake Como area offers heaps of activities. While here, you can:
  • Visit the gorgeous villas like Villa Carlotta, Villa Balbianello, Villa Serbelloni, Villa Olmo - with their charming botanic gardens and museums; 
  • Visit the stunning town of Bellagio, only 15 minutes by ferry;
  • Hire a boat and enjoy the scenery from the water;
  • Sail or take sailing lessons; 
  • Hike on the mountain range that surrounds the lake; 
  • Trek on the Greenway del Lago pathway http://www.lakecomo.it/en
  • Enjoy the local food festivals
  • Try to catch a glimpse of George Clooney, who's chosen Villa Oleandra in Laglio (Lake Como) as a holiday residence;
...Or simply take a stroll on the lake promenade and have a drink at one of the many bars on the lakeside :-)

What We Need & What You Get

I'm seeking $ 9,000 in order to address some urgent renovation. This includes sanding the ceilings, fixing some water stains, painting over the whole house and fixing some bricks on the roof. I've already fixed the actual problem that caused leaking on the roof, now I just need to fix a small area near the fireplace exhaust. I also need to fix the electrical system and lay pipelines to install central heating (the house is not habitable in winter with the fireplace only - it needs a proper central heating system).

I am going to sub-contract a professional painter/builder, tradesman and an electrician to do the renovation.

If I raise more money than what I have asked for, I commit to using all money towards the renovation of the CASETTA. For example, I could renovate the bathroom and add a new shower. Thinking on an even bigger scale, the external facade of the building also needs painting - this would be expensive as it's a three-story building and would require scaffolding.  In short, with the $9,000 target I am going to address the most urgent jobs only - although many other jobs will be done if more money are raised.

Risks & Challenges

Funders need to realize that there is a calendar attached (CASETTA Lake Como Calendar), and that 'first in best dressed' law applies in terms of dates to book the apartment. You need to verify availability and contact me to confirm the dates. I cannot guarantee that you'll be booked for a particular period, until you receive written confirmation of your booking and the dates are displayed on the calendar.

The way I'll manage the bookings is simple, based on transparency and fairness.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you cannot come to Italy and are not into Italian online lessons, you can still support the project - I will mention your name on my Facebook page here and offer the Italian lessons as a gift voucher - this could be a different birthday or Christmas present for your loved ones!

    Please help me to spread the word and make this project as successful as possible... It's been over 5 years that my casetta is all alone in charming Lake Como. You can use Indiegogo share tools to share this project with the rest of the world!

story:
We are Wave of Action Peterborough and we help the homeless every week here in Peterborough.

Mel and Ian are 2 special guys who we are trying to get housed and off the streets permanently. Neither Mel or Ian take drugs or have a alcohol problem and if you was to meet these guys you would fall in love and just want to help them out.

Mel

One of the nicest men you could meet. Always grateful and never asks for anything extra. Sits in the allyway in the city centre.

He is epileptic and suffers from seizures which under those conditions doesn't deserve as a human being to be living on the streets. Safe accommodation and medical care is essential for him. He is a proud man who needs no fussing and always welcomes a sandwich and a drink.

Ryan

Ryan is 23 he's a real sweet guy came to Peterborough to escape the past he had which was through no fault of his own he is totally drug and alcohol free.  he suffers from autism and dyslexia and just over a week ago Peterborough City Hospital left this guy on the street at rock bottom wearing nothing but NHS issued pj's , due to having no local connection the city council won't help him which is why we are trying to help him find a nice accommodation  which he can share with Mel.

Please help us so we can give these guys the future they deserve, everybody deserves a roof over their head just wish we could help them all Let's give these guys a deposit for a nice place to live and basic essentials to start them on the right track.

Thank you & big love.

story:
The Project - Clay Oven Building

I am travelling to one of the poorest towns in Uganda called Tororo to build clay ovens as part of a SAFE Foundation charity project. We will work together with the community so that they can make, bake and sell their own bread and utilise these new skills to build further ovens in the future.

SAFE Foundation are committed to improving the quality of life in Tororo and it means a lot to me to be included in this project. As I am good at hand building, it feels right to lend these skills to help others.


About Me

I'm from Porthcawl and have studied, lived and worked in Cardiff for 7 years. Art and music are my passion. 

I participated in Live Below The Line as well as practiced my newly acquired face-painting skills at a local community fair for SAFE this year. I've also raised funds for Oxfam by staging an Oxjam event in Cardiff.


What I need and what you get
£1000 - This money will pay for return flights, transport, accommodation, food, training and materials for the project.
Even if it's just £1 that you can give, I'd be really grateful!! Every penny counts!

There are also some perks available for specific donation amounts if you fancy any of them. Check them out :)
Drawings by Georgia Thomas



Risks & Challenges

There's no doubt that it will be challenging to raise funds but I will be keeping people informed of my progress and work hard to show you that I mean it. 

If anyone wants help clearing a garden or windows washed, dogs walked (I'm great with dogs), snakes petted, etc., and would like to contribute a few pounds or more in return towards my part in this project, please let me know :)


More info...

If you'd like to learn more about this project or any of SAFE Foundation activities, click this link:
  • Tororo Project
  • The SAFE Foundation website
I would love you forever if you feel you could donate! If you can't, I still love you but I would be so grateful if you could please share this and help me spread the word. 
I plan to raise money in a variety of ways such as organising some small events/gatherings to offer something in return for your hard-earned cash!
Watch this space :)
story_txt:
The Project - Clay Oven Building

I am travelling to one of the poorest towns in Uganda called Tororo to build clay ovens as part of a SAFE Foundation charity project. We will work together with the community so that they can make, bake and sell their own bread and utilise these new skills to build further ovens in the future.
SAFE Foundation are committed to improving the quality of life in Tororo and it means a lot to me to be included in this project. As I am good at hand building, it feels right to lend these skills to help others.
About MeI'm from Porthcawl and have studied, lived and worked in Cardiff for 7 years. Art and music are my passion. 
I participated in Live Below The Line as well as practiced my newly acquired face-painting skills at a local community fair for SAFE this year. I've also raised funds for Oxfam by staging an Oxjam event in Cardiff.

£1000 - This money will pay for return flights, transport, accommodation, food, training and materials for the project.
Even if it's just £1 that you can give, I'd be really grateful!! Every penny counts!There are also some perks available for specific donation amounts if you fancy any of them. Check them out :)
Drawings by Georgia Thomas

Risks & Challenges
There's no doubt that it will be challenging to raise funds but I will be keeping people informed of my progress and work hard to show you that I mean it. 
If anyone wants help clearing a garden or windows washed, dogs walked (I'm great with dogs), snakes petted, etc., and would like to contribute a few pounds or more in return towards my part in this project, please let me know :)
More info...
If you'd like to learn more about this project or any of SAFE Foundation activities, click this link:



Tororo Project

The SAFE Foundation website



I would love you forever if you feel you could donate! If you can't, I still love you but I would be so grateful if you could please share this and help me spread the word. 

I plan to raise money in a variety of ways such as organising some small events/gatherings to offer something in return for your hard-earned cash!
Watch this space :)

story:
MyFlow.co : Better Than Bookmarking. Share Your Favorite Things or Don't.


Everyone finds amazing things on a daily basis. What do you do with that hilarious video you found? Or that article? Send it to the bookmark grave? Post to Twitter? To Facebook? What if you don't want to share with anyone? Then what?

Introducing...MyFlow.co


Embed anything from anywhere. A full text editor for blogging and journaling. Share things with your friends, or don't. It's up to you. 
We'll never track you. We'll never mine your data. Replace your bookmarks. Follow your friends. Like things. Dislike things. Comment on things.

An Independent Network 

We're funded by you. Not investors. Privacy comes first. We're not selling you out to anyone. You're in total control. Because we're independent we're prioritizing a few important things, like a comprehensive abuse and mental health department. Because you're a human. And you matter.

Let's Start From The Ground Up

Things are public only if you want to. Toggle items back and forth from public to private. 


Automatic archiving for public feeds is coming soon. Only have a few days or a few weeks of content public at a time!

Make Your Profile Yours


Pick colors to represent you. Get a slider that you can make your own.


React to things. 

Positively or Negatively.

How dare anyone try to say 'You can only like things, sorry'. Sometimes liking things is weird. How do you express sentiment on something sad? You like their sadness? #awkward

Express likes, dislikes, or if a face won't do, comment. It's as simple as that. 

# and @

Enjoy the features you're used to. #hashtag support for your shares. Click on a #hashtag to see related content.


Call out a user with @username callouts [coming real soon]. Alert them to a post or a comment.

Share Just About Anything

Want to share a video? Or an image? How about an article? Paste in a link and we'll handle the embed. 

Want to upload a photo? Bam! Upload a photo. Photo galleries are coming soon.

Everyday I'm hustlin'

New features are coming out all the time. We're looking to match the networks you're used to. Users should be able to chat with each other. So chat's coming down the pipe. 

Remember that party you went to with your #bestie? Mom probably doesn't need to see that picture. So group flow is coming. Share with a sub section of friends and no one else.

Okay. Cool idea. What now? 

MyFlow.co is open and functioning today. Make an account at myflow.co. Start following your friends. Start journaling. Start sharing. Start remembering. There's no invite system. There's no forced exclusivity. A network isn't fun unless you can talk to your friends. So start telling your friends!

Be aware though, it's just me right now.


Our servers might go down. Things might be unstable for a bit. But that's why we're funding. 

Speaking of Funding...

MyFlow.co is currently raising 25,000 dollars. Matt is the only employee right now. 

To switch back to first person mode, I've used nearly all of my available money to build what we have today. There is so much more to build. And I need support. I absolutely refuse to get venture funding to keep MyFlow.co growing. 

There are servers to keep alive, databases to feed, and rent to pay. The campaign is a flex-funding campaign, so any little bit helps. But there are stretch goals. This is also the strategic plan for MyFlow.co (competitors, take notes.)

Stretch Goals! 

50,000 - Faster iteration. 

I'll be able to hire another engineer to build a better and faster database system. We'll be able to get stable a lot quicker.

75,000 - MAKE IT PRETTY! 

We'll get some designers to give MyFlow.co a new look. Products deserve to look sexy. But looking sexy costs money.

100,000 - Dedicated Mobile Apps! 

Let's be real, dedicated iOS and Android apps are coming out eventually, if we hit 100k, we can push these apps out MUCH quicker.

250,000 - Curated content streams. 

MyFlow.co/music, MyFlow.co/film, MyFlow.co/art and more. We'll have dedicated feeds for the lean back consumers. Don't know what to follow? Want to discover awesome things? Curated streams will do that for you. We'll even approach the top curators out there, get them involved, and make sure curated streams are amazing. 

500,000 - Better Image Sharing 

We'll focus on making image sharing AMAZING, without the weird facial recognition.

1,000,000 - More than just images. 

We'll hire a few more engineers and focus on uploading more content than just images. Sound files? Maybe video? Woah.

2,000,000 - A Real Help Line

A comprehensive mental health, anti-harassment, and anti-bullying department. Sometimes we, as humans, just need someone to talk to. The internet can be a harsh place and everyone needs help sometimes. Eventually MyFlow.co will have a comprehensive crises line that people can use for free if they need help. Anti-harassment is so much more than blocking accounts. Social networks should do more to support their users. If we hit this goal. We'll be able to get that department running so much sooner.

Who's Behind MyFlow.co?

My name is Matt Watkajtys, I'm the founder of MyFlow.co - a brand new social sharing network that's designed to be privacy first and put you back in control. When I'm not building companies I work as an engineer. The last big startup I worked for was REDEF where I built out their custom content management system.

 I've put nearly everything I have into building an application that would allow me to share anything with the people I want to without being creepy.

MyFlow.co is designed with privacy in mind. Replace your bookmarks by remembering your favorite content. Share things with your friends. Never worry about data mining or data harvesting. MyFlow.co is a new social sharing network that puts you, your content, and your friends first.

Not convinced we need a new network?


They check your phone to see what apps you're using and how you're using them.

Their algorithms manipulate your emotions.

They scan your private messages to see what you share when you think you're secure.

Your friends or followers don't even get to see everything that you post.

They want to know when your birthday is to show you 'relevant content'. 

You can't hide from them. Facial recognition doesn't even need to see your face to auto-tag you. 

They slowly take away your ability to customize your profiles.

They selectively ban content that might make advertisers leery. #curvy

You're a product that's bought and sold. You're not a person, you're a monetizable asset. That's what this boils down to. That's the cost of free.

Some networks say 'F*** the status quo' only to become the status quo as they pull in 11 million dollars in venture capital funding.

Let's Do This Together

Sharing can be great again. Let's do it together. We'll build a great company. You get to have a say in what we build. You get to meet the team as we scale. You'll always know what's next. 

As a contributor, not only do you get to come in super cheap, but you'll always be part of MyFlow.co. We'll ask you for feedback. You'll always be part of our family. And if we can pull this off, we'll be the first 100% indepentently owned social network...ever.

story:
WHAT IS ARTDAY FOR CLEVELAND?
We're building a home for 'ArtDay.' What is ArtDay? YOU are ArtDay! Who and what you are is art, a permanent performance of your own body, self and ideas. What does that look like when it takes physical form? A lot of things, including body art, life drawing, photography and other body-friendly activity and for that we need a low-cost, accessible venue for the music, events, meetings, rehearsal and desk space, social and creative space and much more for a body-friendly, personally expressive, open and accepting group of people. As the name suggests, much of the focus will be on the arts as a form of personal and group expression, a 'body art spa,' if you will, ranging from the traditional and organized (such as the above mentioned body art and life drawing to theatre and film) to more free-form and individual methods (such as meditation). Our events will be private by invitation, many of which will be clothing optional and, of course, all our donors will be on the invitation list.


WHY DOES CLEVELAND NEED THIS? WHY DO I NEED THIS?
Our increasingly fearful and isolated culture is separating us from nature, from each other and from ourselves. One way to fight this is to get the body back in touch with that. Body-image issues affect us at every stage of development and at every level of society. We can reconnect through art and through mindfulness and to facilitate that we want to create a safe and open venue that can be easily reached and afforded by anyone. Naturism is, as the name suggests, natural. In Cleveland, there is a negative attitude toward the body that we would like to help change. By holding clothing optional art functions we hope to facilitate this change in attitude.

WHY SHOULD YOU DONATE AND WHERE IS THE MONEY GOING?
Cleveland naturists know  that two of the greatest challenges to body-friendly activities are access to facilities and the weather. This crowdfunded campaign is an effort to address both of these challenges simultaneously by creating an urban, enclosed safe venue for body-oriented exploration, either on a personal level through meditation, relaxation and socialization or at a group level through various art activities and larger projects.

We plan to either lease or purchase a facility in the Cleveland metroplex that is reasonably accessible by car, rail, bus or foot and that can accommodate year-round body-friendly activities by groups of people and individuals. We also plan on organizing a few get-to-know-you events, such as performances, classes and socials. The space will also be used for art displays and to create personal spaces that can be used on a rotating basis.

RISKS AND CHALLENGES
Creating and operating a space that's body-friendly and accessible involves risk, especially in today's litigious and politically divided culture. We will be building a team of dedicated volunteers drawn from the local naturist community. In addition, some of the funds raised will likely be used to satisfy the legal and regulatory needs of Cleveland ArtDay.

We plan to partner with body-friendly and artistic organizations both locally and nationally in order to avoid common pitfalls and uncommon issues that have already been found and negotiated. A significant part of the ArtDay plan is to publicize and fund the venue through print, video and Web media, thus gathering under the strong protections of free speech. Certain events and projects will yield products that will be sold, such as DVDs, books or prints. Donors will be given discounts for these, as well as for general admission.

HOW YOU CAN HELP US
Fund us!

Seriously, fund us. This is going to cost some serious money.

Further than that, volunteers are always welcome and encouraged, either as artists or organizers. If you have special skills or contacts we are always willing to listen; please send us an email. Most of all, when we are ready to open the doors, just be ready to join us! Art is what we all are, really, and we want to see you!

story:
Short Summary

Hello! 

We are Jess and Shivani of a new social enterprise (#SocEnt) called PATHFINDER. With PATHFINDER, we have set out to prove what we believe to be true around the world: each of us has the power to bring about positive, impactful change, and together, our potential is limitless!

PATHFINDER intends to create sustainable, positive impact by enabling promising local social entrepreneurs with the critical resources and support they need to realize innovative solutions to some of the world’s biggest problems.

Who We Are

We are Shivani Singh and Jessica van Thiel of India and Canada, respectively. We met in our travels a few years ago and we have since become good friends. We are global citizens in every sense, having grown up, studied, worked and lived in many countries. Not only do we share a great rapport and (let's be honest, an insatiable) passion for travel and international affairs, but perhaps most importantly, we share a commitment to making a difference and contributing to a better world in the most effective ways possible. And so we have worked long and hard in our individual lives, developing the skills and expertise we believe to be well suited and much needed for what we'd like to accomplish. Now, finally, we are here!

This campaign allows us to introduce ourselves and our message while raising the interest and funds we need to begin our work. We need to show our principles, theories and abilities in action. We need to achieve the kinds of results that you and others like you would like to see before placing your trust, your time and your resources in PATHFINDER. So we have decided to deploy our (new) model of engagement and all of our supporting theories to two excellent pilot projects.

Our Pilot Projects


What We Need & What You Get

We are starting with an initial target of $100,000 USD. This is the very least we must raise to be able to begin work on our two pilot projects, though, to be honest, the real amount we anticipate needing over 2016 is closer to $300,000 USD. If we are able to meet our greater fundraising goal for the year, we expect to be able to work entirely on PATHFINDER, which is ideal for all the participants. Here's how the money is intended to be used (we will follow publicly accepted, transparent and documented accounting practices):

  • 45% will directly be injected into the pilot organizations. So with 45%, you will see many new children being afforded a complete school education, the infrastructure and resources needed to support the education of these children and others in the future, and the supplies, infrastructure and resources needed to develop the rural women's soap franchise from scratch. Both organizations are expected to end the year at a substantially higher net worth and level of social success.
  • About 33% will be used to pay the consultants so that they are able to dedicate themselves to the work without expecting to be taken advantage of, without having to work for free, or without having to simultaneously work elsewhere so that they might home and feed themselves and their families. 
  • 12% will be earmarked for the development of PATHFINDER, including research, expansion, marketing, resources, and other activities that are necessary to develop the company so that we may engage more local social enterprises in more places and grow our reach aggressively.
  • 10% will be used for expenses that include (non-luxury, clean and safe) travels and accommodations to and at relevant locations. 

If we reach $100,000 with this effort, we can begin our work and continue to fundraise through available channels. If we reach our greater goal of $300,000 USD, we will be able to work through 2016 and set up two fantastic organizations for future successes. If however, we are unable to raise our initial or greater goal amounts, we will save the money until we are able to raise what we need to get to work. 

The Impact

We envision that at the end of 2016, we will have made great strides. The direct impact will be seen at the ‘grass roots’ level through our pilot projects. Supporting the education of the school children in Nepal, and the creation of jobs for rural women in India will be the tangible results seen right from the start.  

Aside from setting up and beginning two sustainable, scalable and profitable businesses where others have overlooked potential, we expect to have generated word, participation and credibility for PATHFINDER. 

Over time, impact will begin to be immeasurable as the potential for expansion and the scope of projects and partnerships is endless. 

Risks & Challenges

Raising funds is tough, period. Raising funds where it is unlikely to make a massive return on investment right away, or where there isn't a cool new gadget to grab, is much tougher. We are a social enterprise and "social entrepreneurship" is a relatively new, developing trend. Much work is yet to be done to discover the amazing benefits of running socially responsible and economically sustainable organizations. But we are confident that over time, our model will prove to be successful and demonstrating of enormous potential.

We expect to face many of the standard challenges of setting up and running, or supporting a new business. Not only are there the better known components of successful enterprising to conquer, such as management, marketing and demographics, but we expect to be in the thick of significant social problems as well. We expect to work with various local experts on finding and developing creative solutions that overcome a myriad of issues like political and economic instability, social injustice, and statelessness, all the while generating profits and social benefits. This however, is the environment that we best enjoy working with... one that is diverse and energetic and riddled with challenges to turn into plentiful opportunities.

And finally, we understand that it will likely take some time to be well known and respected. Generating international interest is no small effort and having a new model to deploy instead of an older, publicized one, will add to some guarded optimism. We are under no illusions, though. We understand quite well that what we have decided to do will not be easy or fast or often, even safe. We are prepared for a tough, long slog and we are, in fact, very excited about it all!

Other Ways You Can Help

Other key goals for this campaign are to spread the word and to invite people to work with us, in whatever capacity is most suitable and effective for each specific engagement. No enquiry is too small if you're looking for the opportunity to make an impact. Please, do write to us with your ideas and intentions. Do work with us. We do believe that every single person has the great capacity to bring about impactful change, and if we can deomnstrate how we can productively come together, we will consider our efforts successful. The more people we are able to reach and involve, the more powerful we have the potential to become, together. 

So please, do share the word with everyone you know!

Finally, and most importantly, we'd like to thank you for your time, attention and participation. Without you we are limited in our reach, and so, for you we are grateful.

Who We Are
We are Shivani Singh and Jessica van Thiel of India and Canada, respectively. We met in our travels a few years ago and we have since become good friends. We are global citizens in every sense, having grown up, studied, worked and lived in many countries. Not only do we share a great rapport and (let's be honest, an insatiable) passion for travel and international affairs, but perhaps most importantly, we share a commitment to making a difference and contributing to a better world in the most effective ways possible. And so we have worked long and hard in our individual lives, developing the skills and expertise we believe to be well suited and much needed for what we'd like to accomplish. Now, finally, we are here!
This campaign allows us to introduce ourselves and our message while raising the interest and funds we need to begin our work. We need to show our principles, theories and abilities in action. We need to achieve the kinds of results that you and others like you would like to see before placing your trust, your time and your resources in PATHFINDER. So we have decided to deploy our (new) model of engagement and all of our supporting theories to two excellent pilot projects.
Our Pilot Projects
   What We Need & What You Get We are starting with an initial target of $100,000 USD. This is the very least we must raise to be able to begin work on our two pilot projects, though, to be honest, the real amount we anticipate needing over 2016 is closer to $300,000 USD. If we are able to meet our greater fundraising goal for the year, we expect to be able to work entirely on PATHFINDER, which is ideal for all the participants. Here's how the money is intended to be used (we will follow publicly accepted, transparent and documented accounting practices):



45%
will directly be injected into the pilot organizations. So with 45%, you will
see many new children being afforded a complete school education, the
infrastructure and resources needed to support the education of these children
and others in the future, and the supplies, infrastructure and resources needed
to develop the rural women's soap franchise from scratch. Both organizations are expected to end the year at a substantially higher net worth and level of social success.

About 33% will be used to pay the consultants so that they are able to dedicate themselves to the work without expecting to be taken advantage of, without having to work for free, or without having to simultaneously work elsewhere so that they might home and feed themselves and their families. 
12% will be earmarked for the development of PATHFINDER, including research, expansion, marketing, resources, and other activities that are necessary to develop the company so that we may engage more local social enterprises in more places and grow our reach aggressively.
10% will be used for expenses that include (non-luxury, clean and safe) travels and accommodations to and at relevant locations. 





If we reach $100,000 with this effort, we can begin our work and continue to fundraise through available channels. If we reach our greater goal of $300,000 USD, we will be able to work through 2016 and set up two fantastic organizations for future successes. If however, we are unable to raise our initial or greater goal amounts, we will save the money until we are able to raise what we need to get to work.    The Impact 



We envision that at the end of 2016,
we will have made great strides. The direct impact will be seen at the ‘grass
roots’ level through our pilot projects. Supporting the education of the school
children in Nepal, and the creation of jobs for rural women in India will be the
tangible results seen right from the start.  
Aside from setting up and beginning
two sustainable, scalable and profitable businesses where others have
overlooked potential, we expect to have generated word, participation and
credibility for PATHFINDER. 
Over time, impact will begin to be immeasurable
as the potential for expansion and the scope of projects and partnerships is endless. 
    Risks & Challenges 

Raising funds is tough, period.
Raising funds where it is unlikely to make a massive return on investment right
away, or where there isn't a cool new gadget to grab, is much tougher. We are a
social enterprise and "social entrepreneurship" is a relatively new, developing trend. Much
work is yet to be done to discover the amazing benefits of running
socially responsible and economically sustainable organizations. But we are
confident that over time, our model will prove to be successful and demonstrating of enormous potential.
We expect to face many of the standard challenges of setting up and running, or supporting a new business. Not only are there the better known components of successful enterprising to conquer, such as management, marketing and demographics, but we expect to be in the thick of significant social problems as well. We expect to work with various local experts on finding and developing creative solutions that overcome a myriad of issues like political and economic instability, social injustice, and statelessness, all the while generating profits and social benefits. This however, is the environment that we best enjoy working with... one that is diverse and energetic and riddled with challenges to turn into plentiful opportunities.
And finally, we understand that it will likely take some time to be well known and respected. Generating international interest is no small effort and having a new model to deploy instead of an older, publicized one, will add to some guarded optimism. We are under no illusions, though. We understand quite well that what we have decided to do will not be easy or fast or often, even safe. We are prepared for a tough, long slog and we are, in fact, very excited about it all!
    Other Ways You Can Help 
Other key goals for this
campaign are to spread the word and to invite people to work with us, in whatever capacity is most suitable and effective for each
specific engagement. No enquiry is too small if you're looking for the
opportunity to make an impact. Please, do write to us with your ideas and
intentions. Do work with us. We do believe that every single person has the great
capacity to bring about impactful change, and if we can deomnstrate how we can productively come together, we will consider our efforts
successful. The more people we are able to reach and involve, the more
powerful we have the potential to become, together. 
So please, do share the word with
everyone you know!
Finally, and most importantly, we'd like to thank you for your time,
attention and participation. Without you we are limited in our reach, and so,
for you we are grateful.

story:
Fundacion Maestra Esperanza Delgado, Inc.,  is a non-profit organization based in Miami.  Founded by the President, Endrismil Matos, its primary purpose is to feed and clothe 500 poor and hungry people in two small cities, one in the Dominican Republic and the other in El Salvador.  Ms. Matos, a Dominicana, has passionately run this organization for over twenty years, incorporating it in 2013.  She sacrifices much in her life as the majority of these donations come from her own personal resources.

Let's help Ms. Matos continue on her passionate journey as she provides food, clothing, and hope for the young and the elderly so desperately in need.

Constanza, Dominican Republic

Perquin, Morazan, El Salvador

Our goal is to raise $1000.00 dollars, primarily for food.  The smallest donation goes a long, long way.  For example: 

5 US dollars in El Salvador buys:  

  1. 2 pounds of flour for tortillas
  2. 2 pounds of  rice
  3. 1 pound of beans
  4. 2 eggs
  5. 1 pound of sugar
  6. 16 ounces of cooking oil
10 US dollars in the Dominican Republic buys:
  1. 2 pounds of rice
  2. 1 pound of beans
  3. 2 pounds of sugar
  4. 16 ounces of cooking oil
  5. 1 pound of tomato paste
  6. 1 pound of spaghetti
  7. 1 box of laundry detergent

Every dollar is appreciated!  All donations will be used to buy food for  these beautiful people, regardless of the amount raised.

Help provide hope for those that need it the most.

Your donations will assure  recipients  that there are people in the world that care for them and they are not forgotten.  Your donations will help sustain them, mentally and physically.  Your gifts represent answered prayers.  Prayers from mothers and fathers  in these areas that need and have no idea where their next meal may come from.  Prayers from the children with hunger pangs as they attempt to study each day in school.  

Risks & Challenges

Raising money is not easy.  People are often skeptical when it comes to giving someone their hard-earned money.  That's totally understandable in this world today.   Rest assured, every dime donated here will go to the intended recipients, under the auspices of Ms Matos.  With over 20 years of helping others from her heart, she realizes this is her purpose from the Man above,  helping others.  Your donations go a long way with her in doing God's work.

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize that not everyone can contribute but there are so many others ways to help.  Spread the word!  Share on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and more!  Help us be a blessing to others!

story:
Short Summary

There are really two stories here: the first is the story of the William Pring House, and the second is the story of our business, the Hamilton Guesthouse. 

THE PRING

William Pring was the customs surveyor for Hamilton in the 1850s - he and his large family moved frequently between Hamilton and Montreal, and it seems that he decided to invest in a large and impressive property on Mary Street, within walking distance of the Customs House. Maybe he intended to settle down for good, but it wasn’t to be - he had moved on to Port Colbourne by the early 1860s, and by 1871 his widow, Henrietta, had sold the property. 

Between 1855 and today, the Pring House has changed ownership many times. Unlike many of the lovely architectural treasures in Hamilton, it has not had a great deal of continuity in its ownership and this has, unfortunately, led to much of its story being lost or obscured. From single-family residence to triplex, and several different business ventures, these stones have seen it all. 

We bought the house in 2012. 

THE HAMILTON GUESTHOUSE

The Hamilton Guesthouse opened in September, 2010, in a skinny Victorian 3-bedroom house on Victoria Avenue North. We weren’t sure if a backpackers’ hostel would work in Hamilton - there weren’t any here, after all, unlike Toronto and Niagara Falls, and several other nearby cities - so we started small. By February, we were regularly sold out. 

People are coming to Hamilton, for business and pleasure, from all over the world. We were (and are!) absolutely thrilled to welcome them here to our friendly, informal hostel. But it was clear that we needed to move closer to downtown and get ourselves a larger property. We spent much of 2011 searching for the ideal location, inspecting and exploring, until we saw a FOR SALE sign in the front yard of the Pring. 

Despite several competing offers, we were extraordinarily lucky to purchase the property, and we took possession in June, 2012. Our first guests (a group of ballerinas from Italy) arrived in July, and we have been here ever since. 

What We Need & What You Get

In a house this old, with a history of so many different owners, it’s inevitable that there will be some fascinating (and occasionally terrifying) renovations. In the past three years, we’ve uncovered some truly creative plumbing, some interesting wall repairs, and many other things that we should write a book about! 

OUR HOPES

There are many things that need our attention, but the most pressing is the electrical work. It’s not uncommon for our guests to trip a breaker, especially when we’re trying to run extra heating or cooling. We have three goals:

1. A new electrical service - an upgrade to 200Amp if necessary. - UPDATE: Horizon Utilities has arranged to move our electrical supply and upgrade our service.

2. Partial re-wiring of the house to remove malfunctioning and non-functioning switches, outlets and lights.

3. Addition of hard-wired emergency lighting and exit signs for guest safety. 

YOUR REWARDS

We are extremely lucky to be able to offer several great perks. 

$10 - A Hamilton Guesthouse pen, in an assortment of colours 

$20 - Our personal thanks - a glossy postcard mailed to you. 

$25 - “Adopt a light-switch” - your name on a plaque next to a switch or outlet.

$50 - Limited-run print of The William Pring House by Ellen Irving 

$100 - A full season admission to Things at the Pring’s Sublime Saturday Series.

$100 - Private use of the Empire room for your party or event. 

$250 - One night in the Henrietta room and a voucher for dinner at a local restaurant.

The Impact

HAMILTON NEEDS A HOSTEL

We believe that Hamilton’s reputation is enhanced by our business. Backpackers’ hostels are an ancient tradition, and they are increasingly popular for travellers throughout the world. Hostels allow guests to mingle in a way that is impossible in a standard hotel, and at a price point that makes it accessible to more people. Without this form of accommodation, Hamilton lacks the variety of choices available to tourists in other cities, and might miss out on visitors otherwise unable to travel.

THE HOSTEL NEEDS THE PRING

Having our home in the William Pring House means that travellers coming to Hamilton get to experience the history of the city first-hand. They can almost imagine what it would have been like to live here 160 years ago, and the changes that this old house has seen. We take our position as caretakers of this house very seriously, and have made it our mission to maintain it and treat it with the love and respect it deserves.

THE PRING NEEDS YOU

We’re often asked about how much financial support we receive to maintain this heritage property. Are we paid a stipend, is there some sort of grant? The answer is no: no grant, no money. The Hamilton Guesthouse is self-supporting, for the most part. Sometimes a major repair will require us to ask for help - and that’s what we’re doing now. 

Risks & Challenges

Of course, it could happen that our electricians start to work on the Pring and quickly discover that the amount of work is more than they’d anticipated. It happens - who knows what’s closed up in these walls? If we end up facing a situation where there is much more wrong than we’d budgeted for, we have a few options before us:

  • We could prioritize the most important work and leave the rest for another time.
  • We could negotiate with our contractors to do labour (or other tasks for which we don’t need qualifications) for them, thus lowering the costs. 
  • We could focus on just one part of the building and arrange to do the rest later. 
After five years of running a small business, we have trouble-shooting down to a fine art! We’re not afraid to put in the long hours, get our hands dirty, and do everything we can to make it work. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know what it’s like to have no money to give - obviously, or we wouldn’t be asking! The fact that you’ve given us this much of your time means so much to us, and we sincerely appreciate your support. 

If you would like to share our campaign on your favourite social media, we would be extremely grateful. If you would like to share it in any other ways, we would be equally grateful! 

And if you know anyone who’s travelling to Hamilton, by all means give them our number - helping us to help ourselves is a wonderful gift.

story:
Short Summary

We are planning to bring high speed internet to the residents of Olympic Valley (Squaw Valley). We plan to offer speeds that go from 50Mbps up to 500Mbps with packages that adapt to your needs and enough data to do everything you want.

For nearly 20 years, Oasis Broadband has provided reliable, secure broadband internet, data and voice services to underserved remote homes, businesses and vacation properties in small towns and rural communities like Truckee, Tahoe, Colfax and their surrounding areas. We provide the best connectivity and digital services in the area because we are a locally owned and operated company. We understand your needs because they're our needs too. 

We want to provide the best internet service with the best customer service in California to more communities at a faster pace, which is why we are now launching a new Indiegogo campaign to pre-book our newest high speed network in Squaw Valley.

Only those who sign up for service through the Indiegogo campaign will receive these priority installations and other promotions.

What We Need & What You Get

We are offering 4 different options on this presale stage:​

  • Early Bird 50 Mbps Subscriber: This will give you the chance to be one of the first 50 customers to get their service installed and get a free month of 50 mbps service.
  • Early Bird 100 Mbps Subscriber: This will give you the chance to be one of the first 30 customers to get their service installed and get a free month of 100 mbps service.
  • Early Bird 250 Mbps Subscriber: This will give you the chance to be one of the first 15 customers to get their service installed and get a free month of 250 mbps service.
  • Early Bird 500 Mbps Subscriber: This will give you the chance to be one of the first 5 customers to get their service installed and get a free month of 500 mbps service.

Our goal is to get 50 early bird subscribers. The more subscribers we get the faster this project can happen. Please note that purchasing a perk will give the customer a preferential installation slot and a free month of service. When the time comes for installation there will be an TBD installation fee that will depend upon whether the customer chooses a 1, 2 or 3 year contract. All speeds are symmetric, i.e. a 100 Mbps plan will have 100 Mbps up and down speeds.

Service Options

Although our Gigabit class network is amazing it will be limited to selected areas due to technical reasons of range and geometry that are beyond our control. For all other areas we can also offer high-speed plans with up to a 100Mbps download and 30Mbps upload with the same reliability.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please feel free to share this information with your friends and neighbors and help us bring them high speed internet as well!
