story:
At this troubled time please help us to bring a Piece of Jordan to the UK this August at the amazing Greenbelt Music, Faith and Arts Festival

What is A Piece of Jordan?

A Piece of Jordan wants you to know the real Jordan, the Jordan where people of all faiths live together, a Jordan that welcomes visitors from all walks of life and ensures they feel at home. With the unrest in the Middle East and the media coverage of the area, Jordan often gets painted with the same brush. We want to help change that.We want to challenge the stereotypes of the region and encourage people to visit Jordan - a land surrounded by sadness , but one that continues to show its strength, love and hospitality, striving for a better existence.

We have now been offered a stall at Greenbelt - a music, faith and arts festival in the UK, which has been running for over 40 years. Greenbelt has always represented diversity and equality and we are honored to have been accepted to exhibit our handicrafts and promote our country.

At Greenbelt we hope to have a beautiful range of Jordanian inspired handicrafts, all made in Petra using fair trade principals, created and produced by local artists and women’s groups.

We are working hard to engage with tourists who come to the area, taking them into the local community to eat, shop, harvest, cook and laugh with local families - experiencing Jordan through the eyes of local people. 

At home we encourage our tourists to buy local and we are working on a number of community projects including a children's book series about the sites of Jordan titled, 'Laila and Habib - Adventures in Jordan' which will eventually help fund Petra's first children’s center and library.

Who I am...

Almost 11 years ago I came to Jordan as a tourist. Little did I know that a year later I would be leaving my home in Birmingham, UK to move my life to Jordan, get married and start on a wonderful adventure. From the word go I was often asked the question "Is it safe?"  When people ask me this question, I want them to come and meet the people I know! The people who have accepted me into their hearts despite at times us being so different. Jordan is not only phenomenal in its beauty but also it's culture, the people and their warm, unconditional hospitality.

What now?

To support out work, we need to work at promoting Jordan outside of the region, to reach a  wider audience, give our talented artisans a new outlet for their products and let the stories of Jordan shine.

For towns like Petra, which for so long flourished from tourism, the dramatic drop of visitors to the region, means times are tough. Our handicrafts offer a new type of employment, create opportunities and the encourage creativity.

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help! As a small community project the costs of doing the stall, shipping the products and getting a member of staff over to the UK to represent A Piece of Jordan and ones we are not yet in the position to cover all of.

How much do we need?

Well, we are currently in talks with the local authority who are keen to support us in some way. The total costs are below but we are only trying to raise a third of the funds through this crowdfunding campaign. 

Shipping - the space we have been offered is 4m by 4m.  In order to be able to ship enough products we are estimating the freight cost to be between 700-1000 GBP. Although we are working at getting this sponsored.

Stall - the stall costs 580 GBP and includes passes for two members of staff (one of whom will be a volunteer from the UK)

Stock - 1000 GBP - this will include products from other local charitable societies

Travel Expenses - 800 GBP - this will cover flights for one member of staff and a rented van for the weekend of the festival. 

If we do not reach our goal and have to change our plans the money raised will go towards employing more local artists so we can continue to build up our stock and create our pieces of Jordan.

The Impact

 Jordan's beauty and warmth must be celebrated, for it tells the tales of people in a land often scarred by stories of its neighbours. By participating in this crowdfunding campaign you are helping to challenge stereotypes, show the world what Jordan really has to offer and contribute to a project that is creating new and exciting opportunities for both visitors and locals.

Other Ways You Can Help

Whilst money helps, there is lots more you can do, if you are unable to contribute financially but love what we are trying to do we would love you to get in touch - share the campaign, our website and tell more people to visit Jordan.
story_txt:
At this troubled time please help us to bring a Piece of Jordan to the UK this August at the amazing Greenbelt Music, Faith and Arts Festival
What is A Piece of Jordan? 
A Piece of Jordan wants you to know the real Jordan, the Jordan where people of all faiths live together, a Jordan that welcomes visitors from all walks of life and ensures they feel at home. With the unrest in the Middle East and the media coverage of the area, Jordan often gets painted with the same brush. We want to help change that.We want to challenge the stereotypes of the region and encourage people to visit Jordan - a land surrounded by sadness , but one that continues to show its strength, love and hospitality, striving for a better existence.
We have now been offered a stall at Greenbelt - a music, faith and arts festival in the UK, which has been running for over 40 years. Greenbelt has always represented diversity and equality and we are honored to have been accepted to exhibit our handicrafts and promote our country.
At Greenbelt we hope to have a beautiful range of Jordanian inspired handicrafts, all made in Petra using fair trade principals, created and produced by local artists and women’s groups.
We are working hard to engage with tourists who come to the area, taking them into the local community to eat, shop, harvest, cook and laugh with local families - experiencing Jordan through the eyes of local people. 
At home we encourage our tourists to buy local and we are working on a number of community projects including a children's book series about the sites of Jordan titled, 'Laila and Habib - Adventures in Jordan' which will eventually help fund Petra's first children’s center and library.
Who I am...
Almost 11 years ago I came to Jordan as a tourist. Little did I know that a year later I would be leaving my home in Birmingham, UK to move my life to Jordan, get married and start on a wonderful adventure. From the word go I was often asked the question "Is it safe?"  When people ask me this question, I want them to come and meet the people I know! The people who have accepted me into their hearts despite at times us being so different. Jordan is not only phenomenal in its beauty but also it's culture, the people and their warm, unconditional hospitality.
What now?
To support out work, we need to work at promoting Jordan outside of the region, to reach a  wider audience, give our talented artisans a new outlet for their products and let the stories of Jordan shine.
For towns like Petra, which for so long flourished from tourism, the dramatic drop of visitors to the region, means times are tough. Our handicrafts offer a new type of employment, create opportunities and the encourage creativity.
What We Need & What You Get
We need your help! As a small community project the costs of doing the stall, shipping the products and getting a member of staff over to the UK to represent A Piece of Jordan and ones we are not yet in the position to cover all of.
How much do we need?
Well, we are currently in talks with the local authority who are keen to support us in some way. The total costs are below but we are only trying to raise a third of the funds through this crowdfunding campaign. 
Shipping - the space we have been offered is 4m by 4m.  In order to be able to ship enough products we are estimating the freight cost to be between 700-1000 GBP. Although we are working at getting this sponsored.
Stall - the stall costs 580 GBP and includes passes for two members of staff (one of whom will be a volunteer from the UK)
Stock - 1000 GBP - this will include products from other local charitable societies
Travel Expenses - 800 GBP - this will cover flights for one member of staff and a rented van for the weekend of the festival. 
If we do not reach our goal and have to change our plans the money raised will go towards employing more local artists so we can continue to build up our stock and create our pieces of Jordan.
The Impact
 Jordan's beauty and warmth must be celebrated, for it tells the tales of people in a land often scarred by stories of its neighbours. By participating in this crowdfunding campaign you are helping to challenge stereotypes, show the world what Jordan really has to offer and contribute to a project that is creating new and exciting opportunities for both visitors and locals.
Other Ways You Can Help
Whilst money helps, there is lots more you can do, if you are unable to contribute financially but love what we are trying to do we would love you to get in touch - share the campaign, our website and tell more people to visit Jordan.

story:
Why We Need Your Help

TASTE Kitchen & Table in Fairfax is an artisanal bakery cafe devoted to... 

  • Serving delicious and nourishing food & beverages
  • Providing a rewarding place to learn & work
  • Creating an inviting space to enjoy food & community

This campaign allows us to bring our unique TASTE environment to a second location in downtown San Rafael. In the two years since we opened TASTE in Fairfax, customers have asked us to bring our yummy fare (including vegan, vegetarian and gluten free options) to other venues. We've since provided the Marin JCC's Plaza J Cafe with our baked goods and signature salads, and we also offer a full catering menu to businesses, non-profits, schools, and other groups and individual customers in Marin, as well as cooking and baking classes and special events.

Opening another cafe gives us the opportunity to provide the full TASTE experience to our customers.

How Your $ Will Be Spent

Copperfield's Bookstore cafe in San Rafael is ready for a TASTE makeover. In order to bring the same quality artisanal food, and the great service we are known for, we need to make the following purchases:

  • Cold Case
  • Sandwich Prep Station 
  • Refrigerator
  • Panini Grill
  • Warmers
  • Interior & Exterior Signage
  • Delivery Vehicle

Why Fund TASTE?

In 2014, we were able to open TASTE Fairfax because of our successful Kickstarter Campaign. Since then, we've seen how much it means to our community to have a homegrown bakery and coffee house where people feel known and appreciated. And how much they want to support local businesses like TASTE. With your help we're creating another warm place to gather and feel at home in downtown San Rafael.

There are lots of places to get a cup of coffee in Marin. But there are only a few TRUE artisan bakeries. And there's only one TASTE...until now! Our loyal customers are a big reason why we trust that San Rafael will benefit greatly from what we have to offer. 

Partnering with Copperfield's Bookstore means that we have a built-in base of book lovers. Who doesn't love a great cup of coffee or tea with a good book? Our new location harkens back to a time when people slowed down to savor these simple pleasures. That's what TASTE is all about! And, there are a number of large companies relocating to downtown San Rafael. They'll be looking for a great place to enjoy breakfast or lunch...and we'll be there.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can donate money. But that doesn't mean you can't contribute! Please share the TASTE campaign with your social network - online and in person - and help us to spread the word. We hope you'll come in to say "hi," as we love to make new friends and are happy to hear what you think about what we have to offer. Thank you!

story:
Clearly Tahoe is a recreational and tourism company based out of the Lake Tahoe area. We're going to specialize in unique kayak tours, hikes and other outdoor related activities. 

We've been working extremely hard to get everything up and going. Our website should be up within a few days and we'll be able to start pre-bookings at that time!

We've designed some promotional items such as stickers, hats and dry bags that will be available for pre-sale to help fund additional marketing expenses. We want to thank everyone who is able to help up get us off the ground and hope you all have the opportunity to join us on one of our unique tours!

For more information on what Clearly Tahoe is all about -- contact Kelsey or Geoff personally by email or phone! We'll be happy to answer any questions or provide additional details! 

 

Some future promotional items include: 
"Clearly Tahoe" 4x6in Vinyl Gloss Stickers
"Clearly Tahoe" Embroidered 110 Snapback Hats
"Clearly Tahoe" Water Bottles
"Explore More, Paddle Often" Vinyl Glass Stickers
"Explore More, Paddle Often" Waterproof Dry Bags
"Explore More, Paddle Often" Women's Tank Tops
"Explore More, Paddle Often" Waterproof Dry Bags
"Explore More, Paddle Often" T-Shirts
"Keep Tahoe Clear" 4x6 Vinyl Gloss Stickers

All of these promotional items will be available for sale to customers in 2017. Certain tour packages will include a waterproof "Explore More" dry bag. All tours will include a "Clearly Tahoe" sticker. 

The funds raised from these pre-purchased items will help fund future marketing costs such as the promotional products, trailer-logos, flyers, web advertisement and published ads. 

Gift certificates will also be available for purchase on our website.

story:
Short Summary

 

Michael and I stared Stregare Cheesecake Company in the spring of 2012 after a rigorous 2011 holiday baking schedule fulfilling cheesecake orders for friends, family and co-workers.  We had been searching for an outlet for our passion to create high quality delicious food for our community and we realized there was a need and potential market for quality cheesecake, made with local ingredients and available custom made to order.

We started working with wedding clients in 2013 and expanded our flavor offerings and size options significantly in just a few short years.  Our product is unique and our customization service is perhaps the most unique thing that I have seen on the market.  Although we typically do some of our most memorable custom work for brides and grooms, we can make a cake special for any occasion.

We have had a great time getting to serve brides and grooms, moms and dads, graduates, co-workers and everyone in between.  We feel that no two orders are the same because everyone is different.  Although we do enjoy creating unique custom cakes there is one thing that never changes and that is the consistent quality of our product.

In 2015 we purchased 5 acres in Bastrop, TX and started raising our own chickens.  I'm proud to say that as of December of 2015 we have been able to supply our whole operation with our very own chicken eggs!  We also take every opportunity to source local fresh ingredients when we can, especially when it comes to fruits, berries and nuts for our cakes.  We're just picky like that!

When we purchased our land in 2015 we dreamed of someday converting one of the storage buildings into our very own commercial kitchen space.  We never thought we’d need that space so desperately, so fast!  We have added new wholesale and retail clients and are projected to run out of room in our current rental kitchen space before the end of this year as a busy Fall and holiday season loom ever closer.

With our own kitchen space, we intend to grow beyond the Austin market and expand into the Dallas, San Antonio and Houston markets as well.  We receive calls from individuals and companies all over the U.S. asking if we ship.  With our own dedicated kitchen space, we will have the room and equipment needed to ship out of state and intend to open up our shipping options throughout the US.

 

What We Need

 

Michael and I are excited to take this company to the next level!  In order to build our own commercial kitchen on our property we will need to finish-out one of our storage buildings.  This unit is a metal building with about 1400 sq feet of space, a dirt floor and electric.  The money raised in this campaign will go to the following finish-out needs:

Concrete floor ($5,000) – Poured and graded with plumbing/drains installed

Septic system ($10,000) – The kitchen will need its own septic system to meet health code requirements for Bastrop County.

Plumbing & Electrical ($9,000)

Ceiling and inside wall finish out ($19,000) – A ceiling will be created and inside walls will need to be framed up, insulated, sheet rock and FRP installed.

HVAC system ($4,000) – Energy efficient units to help control and maintain temperature and humidity will be installed.

If we do not quite reach our goal in this campaign, we will apply the funds in the order of items listed above, with the concrete floor being the first thing we need to facilitate.  Depending on what we lack in funds we will either run an additional campaign to acquire more funds or seek a home improvement/home equity loan for the remainder of the funding.  Because the building is on residential property, the finish-out construction is not eligible for a commercial loan.

 

 

What You Get

 

We have developed some great perks to reward our supporters and will have most of them available just in time for the holidays!  We have come up with some great t-shirt concepts that will help you show your support as well as calendars, magnets and other useful every-day items.  For those wishing to try our cakes, you can do so at a certain donation level – however, those shipments will have to wait until we have the kitchen project completed.

The Impact

 

A dedicated commercial kitchen space will provide more room for equipment and prep space needed to increase our production and expand our product line. 

We are currently an online only store and require at least 24 hours notice for all orders.  However, we are partnering with local establishments in Austin (and soon hopefully in other cities) to provide a place where our customers can pick up their orders at a time convenient to them as opposed to only having a delivery option.  At this time, we can only offer limited delivery to our customers in and around the greater Austin area. 

We are also looking to expand our product line from delicious cheesecakes and cookies to more traditional pastries which would offer our customers more options.  We plan to partner with Amazon, Favor, Drop Off and other companies offering similar services for expanded delivery options once we are established in a dedicated kitchen space where we can expand our production capacity.

Our business has doubled in gross sales every year and year 4 is looking great so far.  You can currently find our cakes at Piney Creek Chophouse and The View in Bastrop, and River City Market and Il Forte in Austin.  Once we have the kitchen capacity to expand our production we will solicit partnerships with more Austin establishments and seek similar alliances in the DFW, Houston and San Antonio markets.

We are also very excited to have more space for needed equipment such as a blast freezer and freezer space which will allow us to freeze and ship our cakes across the country.  This is not something we can do in our current rental kitchen space.

Risks & Challenges

 

This endeavor to create our own commercial kitchen is a huge undertaking and one that we know will be very challenging – but ultimately the best thing for our company’s future.  We are not asking for help with equipment purchases as we own most of what we need and are looking to apply for a loan through PeopleFund for the remainder.  Being a 100% woman owned business our company can take advantage of some great offers made to minority business owners such as 3% APR and lower percent closing fees on loans to small businesses.  If we raise more money beyond what is needed for the construction of the kitchen then we will most certainly put it towards any additional equipment we need.

We know that the market is ever changing and evolving and we are at the mercy of our customers when it comes to maintaining income, so we are pursuing more wholesale business to stabilize our cash flow.  It is our strong belief that having the kitchen as a working part of our residential homestead will allow us to maintain better control over this investment no matter what the market may bring.

Other Ways You Can Help

 

We know that not everyone that wants to help can contribute financially – and that’s OK!  We want your help anyway!  If you can spread the word about our campaign that helps!  If you can help us connect with retail and wholesale partners that may be interested in our products and services – that helps!  If you can offer services that may help us get up and running (plumbing, electric etc.) we are more than happy to talk to you about helping.  Any help you can give means the world to us!

story: My family has been involved in growing and selling plants since 1911. My great grandmother had a greenhouse around the corner from us on Kenmore St. I came to live here with my grandmother and my Uncle Jim Martin when I was 4.  Uncle Jim and his mom had a glass greenhouse here at 3614 W. Western Ave. for a several years before I was born. Then 40 years ago it was taken down and 2 large greenhouses were built here. Then 26 years ago he retired and I took over. Business has grown, we bought the 2 lots next door in 2008. We put up a homemade greenhouse there. When it gets cold in the spring we have to either move all the plants into the greenhouses and brick building and cover what we can't get in. The present walkways are narrow and uneven. Check out is the same place that people come in and we often have crowds there. Customers would get wet selecting some plants whenever it rained. With the 2 new ghs. we want to build next door there would be wide cement walkways ADA compliant so wheelchairs can navigate. Checkout would be roomier and easy to swiftly go thru utilizing carts.  All the plants would be inside, all the time. No more 120 degrees inside. We would be able to control the temperature for comfortable shopping. A greenhouse for the modern times with customer comfort in mind.

story:
We need your support now more than ever Yogurtland Moreno Valley

March 22, 2020 we made a critical decision to temporarily suspend operations and do our part to help flatten the curve.

Now, more than ever, small businesses need your support. People are losing their jobs and families are being affected - we hope you keep this in mind over the coming weeks and months, and show up in whatever way you can to support the small businesses and people around you.

We want you all to know, that we love you and thank you for your loyalty and support during this time. 

Here's how to get your favorite treats

  • Order at the front door, wait in your car while we swirl it up--we'll text you once its ready.
  • Or text ahead and we will have your order ready for you to pick up. Text us at (909) 413-2428
  • Show us your confirmation email to redeem your offer.

We will be opening Friday, April 17th, 2020. Our hours will be Monday thru Thursday 1 pm - 8pm. Friday thru Sunday 12 pm - 8pm. 

Health & Safety

To protect you-our guests, team and community; we will be wearing gloves, masks, and a protective cashier shield as an added of layer of protection.  We will have markers to help maintain social distancing. All orders will be made with the utmost level of hygiene by our team members. Your health and safety is our highest priority.

More ways to help 

  • Share on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter...and tag us #YogurtlandMorenoValley.
  • Spread the word to your friends, family, co-workers to join the campaign. Everyone LOVES Yogurtland Moreno Valley!
  • Most importantly use the Indiegogo share tools!

Sweetest regards,

Yogurtland Moreno Valley Swirlologists

Sweetest regards,
Yogurtland Moreno Valley Swirlologists

story:
Cheers To Good Health!

 

As you may already know, Twain’s closed it's doors on Monday, March 16th to protect you, our staff and the greater population from the COVID-19 pandemic. This was the most difficult decision we have ever made, but it is one that we felt was necessary for the common good, and to ensure our ability to eat, drink and laugh in the future at Twain’s.

We have created this campaign as a way for you to make plans to join us for some food and fun on the other side of this crisis. We are offering a number of *perks* at a discount, from simple gift cards to a party with friends, as well as a few unique experiences that you can purchase now and redeem once we are open again. Your support in this way will help insure that we can re-open quickly when the time is right. 

We have always felt blessed to be a part of Decatur’s community. Thank you for all of your support, it has been nearly 25 years and we plan to come back soon to celebrate that milestone.

ABOVE ALL…please stay healthy…listen to the experts and stay home. The welfare of our community is at stake and you are the most important piece. Be well, and take care of each other (at a safe distance). It will take many more sacrifices by each of us to get to the end of this crisis safely. We look forward to raising a glass at that time.

Thank you again!

Ethan and Uri Wurtzel

story:
What We Want To Do

We are looking for support to help fund a portable building structure for our high-quality Yorkshire- terrier Business. This building will go onsite locally as the result of a global pandemic [CO-VID 19] has forced us to shut the business down. With this new facility, we will be able to provide training, emotional support registration, stud -services, pet adoption and grooming.

Who Are We

Originally formed in 2017, Yorkies of Austin is designed to breed pure healthy ESA and Service trained dogs in Austin Texas and surrounding areas. The concept and real-life scenario and how these pups aid in assisting the community captivated social media, with their Facebook page sharing likes and testimonials of how beautiful the unique puppies are. Only a few months later, they had their own YouTube channel, with training videos. They would soon be featured in magazines such as “Home & Golf” and music videos in addition to being shown in dog shows and festivals throughout Texas.

 

Our Mission

Our mission is to raise healthy and exotic purebreds of dogs and to provide reasonable pricing, qualified and highly effective dog services and other dog-related products to a wide range of clients in Austin, Texas.

What We Do

We raise healthy APRI, AKC, ACA registered pure – breed Yorkshire terriers for Emotional Support and Service Animals, and show. We offer stud services through An I to promote a healthier environment when breeding. Our dogs when restricted are kept in condos and have a fun-loving play area in the yard. They are groomed regularly in addition to being bathed in between their grooming sessions.

About The Owner

Jacqueline Harrington is a talented musician, singer-songwriter, entrepreneur, and a loving soul. She works hard every day to teach people how to improve the quality of living and achieve their dreams. During her life, Jackie has been through highs and lows, so she understands how challenging life can sometimes be. However, her positive attitude and determination help her to find creative and effective solutions to overcome every obstacle that comes her way.

Jacqueline's life had changed when she became a licensed dog breeder and started raising Yorkshire Terriers. Becoming a pet owner improved both her mental and physical state, so she dedicated a part of her life to show people that dogs, especially Yorkies, can provide the support that they are looking for.

Today, Jackie's Yorkies feature in her music videos, play around the garden, bring joy, and, most importantly, help everyone around to live with a smile. Knowing how much dogs have changed her life, Jacqueline works hard to introduce people to positive sides of becoming a pet owner. She also takes time to educate her customers on how to provide love to dogs and raise them properly.

Budget Breakdown

  • Building Shell     $8, 000 already paid
  • Electrical wiring $4,000
  • Dry Wall                $3500
  • Insulation             $4100
  • Building Permit  $579
  • Plumbing             $2,200
  • Shower                 $250
  • Light fixtures      $1,200
  • Grooming table $379
  • Toliet                     $119
  • Sink                       $350
  • Faucett                 $322
  • Air Conditioner  $250

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share the campaign and spread the word!

story:
My project would not be just for me, but for all the FRIENDS fans all around the world.

I am a huge fan of Friends, and It has been my dream since the show first started to be able to have a CENTRAL PERK replica to go there with my friends and make memories with some great coffee.

And now I decided to stop waiting for somebody else to do that, I want to open an exact Central Perk replica in my city.

This idea came to me when totally by accident, I found the exact sofa from the show, old, orange and perfect. Then I told to my self: Hey, you have the biggest and most important thing for the cafe, just find the rest. And little by little I was able to find so many things that look exactly like in the show.

Even Gunther :D I met this guy on the street and I started laughing like crazy and said to my friends, hey there is a man just like Gunther. I went over there to him, and we became good friends and he would be more then happy to serve people in my cafe. Just like in Friends:)

The cafe would be like just like the real one, something like this:

 And It would have all: The stage for bad singers that would have to sing Smelly cat and all the other Phoebe songs, the waitress training (Like Rachel and Joey did), the big mugs, Big TV screen with Friends show always on and many other things that were crucial for 10 seasons of this favorite show...

And of course the exact menu :)

It is my dream to build this amazing place but I need more money to do so. I hope that with your help I can make this epic cafe come to life so everybody can enjoy it.

All the money I raise over the amount I made as minimal I will invest in this business and the most important thing: I will put the names of 100 biggest donors on a huge Thank you board so that everybody can see the names of the people who helped this amazing dream to come to life. So in some way I want all of you to be a part of this. This is not just for me, it is for all of us!

Help make the new generations of FRIENDS !!!

story:
"Welcome to the fitness app for your debt and finances." 

~theChangeJar team

"Utilizing micro-transactions and smartphones, theChangejar empowers its users to pay off debt quickly and effectively. After evaluating the individual user's finances, theChangejar uses a personalized daily amount the user can afford to spend towards debt each day. Then it sets up those daily payments towards the payoff, all the while avoiding compounding interest! This process can save users, on average, $1,500 in interest on individual debts. All while accelerating payoff time by 60% on average. "

Everyone has experienced the weight of debt and theChangejar is an expression of the wisdom of Albert Einstein for smartphone users:

“Compound interest is the eighth wonder of the world. He who understands it, earns it ... he who doesn't ... pays it.” ~Albert Einstein

What that means to  you, our contribution base, is simply this; we are providing a one time opportunity to have early or unlimited access to our easy to use financial planning and micro-transaction system.  

After this we will be implementing normal app cost structures for our operation's and R&D budget in which you will continue to benefit from at no additional cost. 

Below are some reading materials and introductory articles.

Conquering Debt with a phone (White paper) 

Daily calculator example

Our Story

The Team

About the App

Current App Storyboard *coming soon*

App Video's *coming soon*


What a contribution means to us at 

Your contributions help prepare us for a final push to the banks.  We want to give you the best chance at paying off your debt with as little impact to your pocketbook as possible. Thankfully our app framework, as you saw above, is already near completion. Helping fund our campaign furthers our efforts and establishes theChangejar as a method the banks will accept towards a debt reduction strategy. Initial funding will be utilized in 6 areas:

  • Auto sync of details associated with accounts & debts
  • Credit score API integration
  • Connecting banks for cheaper transfer of funds costs (potential reduction of ACH fees)
  • Creation of a larger awareness campaign
  • Additional innovations such as variable rates and more advanced money growth methods
  • Hiring of staff for full time work at improving the look/feel/ usability of the app

The Impact

Every contribution emphsises  to the staff at Xclr8tech  the importance of theChangejar to help those around us out of debt. Your donation regardless of size  secures further conversations with banks to acknowledge the need for such advancements in technology to benefit everyone.  After all if banks can accrue interest daily (including weekends) we should be allowed to pay daily as well. 

We want everyone to be debt free and to feel the success of having done it on their own. Our app was designed with that exact purpose in mind. Providing individuals a sense of real accomplishment and self worth while mastering the art of personal finance. 

Our hope is to decrease the tension and to reduce, or eliminate, the arguments that happen between family about debt and finances.


The Initial Case Study


The initial results of the full alpha app test resulted in our staff seeing a significant reduction in what was owed on our own debts. After we saw our own success, we tested its stability against the size of the entire US Personal debt economy.  We reviewed the national data and realized that after taking household averages from the 2014 US census our conclusion was simple:

If every household spent $50 a day towards their debt, this country's population would be debt free just under 5 years. Which, on average, each household has the potential to afford. 

We gathered the estimated totals of three types of personal debt from the national database (listed below) and plugged them into our app. With the app, we calculated that the nation would save a total of $7 trillion in interest paid to the banking industry over that period of five years. Yeah, $7 trillion.

Below are the numbers we gathered and used to calculate this:

  • Credit Card Debts - $890,900,000,000
  • Student loans -       $1,190,000,000,000
  • Mortgages -             $8,170,000,000,000
Our goal is to make debt disappear, and then help those that use our app to never again let it get this critical. Because we make the payments daily, we alleviate the capitalizing compound interest on these debts thus stopping the growth almost in its tracks. 

Risks & Challenges

Everyone is afraid of talking about debt, or about personal finances. That should not be the case. We shouldn't be afraid of debt. We should face it openly and take a step to make the difference, but we also understand that with any new idea there is always a risk. In our case though, we see that risk as minimal.

The factors that are in our favor are as follows:

The CEO Kris Kitchens is a veteran (USMC) and has continuously challenged our team to overcome the constraints we are handed and deliver above and beyond. His desire to see this project through has helped us overcome obstacles such as early app deployment, utilization of the cloud, and setting us up as a corporation(Xclr8Tech). Kris works tirelessly as we all do, to ensure the success of our dreams: a company that puts forth products that uplift the population we are surrounded by.  

Each of our backgrounds which you will find here on our bio page has prepared us to bring the best we have to offer forward. 

Please keep in mind that none of us are super wealthy, we do not hold positions of significance in our everyday jobs but what we share most in common with everyone reading this is debt and the desire to make it stop. That has been our driving force and that is where theChangejar came from.

If you are unable to contribute, what should you do?

Simple, communicate this opportunity to others, repost, (Like) our app page on Facebook, or repin it on Pinterest. The strongest thing anyone can do is spread the word, it saves Kris a lot of time talking to complete strangers about the app.
In short we all should do the opposite of what everyone typically does, and talk about debt. Share this story you read here and your experience. You never know, you could help someone and not even realize it.
Your going to enjoy being debt free.
Thank you for your support and consideration,

theChangejar  development team
Kris Kitchens, Mike Licciardello, David Broers, Jeremiah Porter
And our wonderful (peanut gallery)
Rachael Mcdevitt, Christen Kitchens, Judy Rhodes, Savahna Broers, Vanessa Porter, Raymond Licciardello, Timothy Tanner.
 and our Families!

story:
The Refugee and Immigrant Advisory Council 

has been helping newcomers adjust to their life in Newfoundland for over 30 years! We do this through ESL classes, legal advice, personal advice, immigration tutoring, paperwork help, social events, and anything else that new Canadians might need, to help them fully participate in their new community. All of our classes and services are free!


RIAC does not get any consistent funding, and pays for all operations with donations, fundraising initiatives, and applying for grants. This is the first time that RIAC has ever tried crowd-funding. Let's see how it goes!

We have a staff of three plus two full-time volunteers, and over 100 part-time and casual volunteers. We are currently operating on the third floor of 204 Water Street, which contains our office spaces, and our ESL classroom. We often host forums, large sessions, and social events, for which we often have to rent external spaces to accommodate our 400 members. We have been happily in our space for over 16 years but have been steadily outgrowing it. This fall, we want to branch out and grow, to serve not only newcomers but the entire St. John's Metro Community! 

What's the Plan?

THIS IS A ONE IN A LIFE TIME OPPORTUNITY! The second floor of our building has become vacant, and we want to occupy it!  Along with our already-established Social Justice Center on the third floor, this initiative will nearly double our space, and infinitely affect the kind, quantity and quality of service that we can provide to our members. To help make this idea sustainable we are going to rent out these new spaces to the entire St. John's Community, providing some much-needed, affordable community spaces: a Conference Room, a Community Room, and a Child-Minding Centre! and we will get some income and more exposure of our work.

The conference room will allow us to hold forums, larger information sessions, and more classes on our own turf, saving us a lot of money in venue rental fees, equipment, transportation and catering costs.

The community room will allow us to hold social events and fun activities for our after school program set to start in September 2016. 

The most impact for our members will come from the Child-Minding Centre, which newcomer parents can use for free, to come to our classes, information sessions, advice programs, and training activities. Many newcomers don't have extended family or funds for babysitters, and therefore not easy avail of our services, which can lead to isolation, missing growth opportunities, solving day to day problems, be informed and more. Having a child-minding centre will break down barriers, and provide amazing new opportunities for newcomer parents. The child-minding centre can also be used by any member of the community who is renting another of our community spaces for an event. Everyone wins!

Having these spaces that can be used, not just by newcomers, but the whole community will help us to build a welcoming, participatory and multicultural community that can be celebrated by all! This extra space will mean that we won't just serve refugees and immigrants in this city, but we can open our doors and our hands for start-ups, community groups, arts activities, public forums, and even other not-for-profits. Also, there is a real need for these affordable spaces downtown, and we can't wait to meet the interesting people who would like to use them.

What We Need:

We are raising money to get this amazing initiative started! We need to renovate the second floor: knock out walls and put up others, rip out old carpet and put in a new floor, paint the walls, purchase new tables, chairs, whiteboards and a projector, and toys and supplies for the child-minding center. We also need to paint and beautify the outside of our building, and put up a new sign, to draw people into our new community spaces. We need to create a permanent position for a promoter and service provider. We will need the money to rent the space while it is being renovated, and not generating revenue. We will also be using funds to create promotional materials and advertising so that we can spread the word about these beautiful, new, affordable spaces that will be available for anyone in the metro area!

The Impact

There is a real lack of affordable community space in St. John's right now, and this initiative can strengthen our community at a time when the provincial budget has us all a little squeezed! Contributing to this initiative isn't just investing in RIAC, it's investing in other small not-for-profits, charities, and start-ups that can use our spaces for rates that won't break the bank! Investing in RIAC is investing in parents, children, artists, grassroots movements, and in people just like you and me! You can be a big part in creating an involved, multi-cultural, inclusive, inviting, and creative community. How great is that?


Risks & Challenges

As with any expansion, there are going to be hurdles! We will eventually need to hire a new staff member to manage this new space. We will need permits and blessings from our landlord and from our downstairs neighbors every step of the way. We will need community partners, supporters, and friends to lift us up while we scramble to get all of this done, but we KNOW we can do it!

When RIAC started 30 years ago, it was a tiny one table "office" at the back of a craft store. Moving into our own office space was just as daunting. Hiring more staff is always daunting. Facing huge influxes of refugees in times of crisis has been daunting too! However, we have overcome every hurdle, grown and persevered. We are more active now in the community than we ever have been, and our potlucks and our ESL classes are so full of people that we are almost out of room! To grow is not even a choice, it is inevitable. We are simply trying to grow in the most gracious, economical, and healthy way possible: Incorporating our whole community, and opening our doors to the city at large!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help financially, you can still help our campaign!

- Share this link on facebook

-Follow us at facebook.com/riac.ca

-Sign up to volunteer, or learn more about us at riac.ca

-Spread the word to anyone that will listen!

We have a staff of three plus two full-time volunteers, and over 100 part-time and casual volunteers. We are currently operating on the third floor of 204 Water Street, which contains our office spaces, and our ESL classroom. We often host forums, large sessions, and social events, for which we often have to rent external spaces to accommodate our 400 members. We have been happily in our space for over 16 years but have been steadily outgrowing it. This fall, we want to branch out and grow, to serve not only newcomers but the entire St. John's Metro Community! 

What's the Plan?
THIS IS A ONE IN A LIFE TIME OPPORTUNITY! The second floor of our building has become vacant, and we want to occupy it!  Along with our already-established Social Justice Center on the third floor, this initiative will nearly double our space, and infinitely affect the kind, quantity and quality of service that we can provide to our members. To help make this idea sustainable we are going to rent out these new spaces to the entire St. John's Community, providing some much-needed, affordable community spaces: a Conference Room, a Community Room, and a Child-Minding Centre! and we will get some income and more exposure of our work.

The conference room will allow us to hold forums, larger information sessions, and more classes on our own turf, saving us a lot of money in venue rental fees, equipment, transportation and catering costs.

The community room will allow us to hold social events and fun activities for our after school program set to start in September 2016. 

The most impact for our members will come from the Child-Minding Centre, which newcomer parents can use for free, to come to our classes, information sessions, advice programs, and training activities. Many newcomers don't have extended family or funds for babysitters, and therefore not easy avail of our services, which can lead to isolation, missing growth opportunities, solving day to day problems, be informed and more. Having a child-minding centre will break down barriers, and provide amazing new opportunities for newcomer parents. The child-minding centre can also be used by any member of the community who is renting another of our community spaces for an event. Everyone wins!


Having these spaces that can be used, not just by newcomers, but the whole community will help us to build a welcoming, participatory and multicultural community that can be celebrated by all! This extra space will mean that we won't just serve refugees and immigrants in this city, but we can open our doors and our hands for start-ups, community groups, arts activities, public forums, and even other not-for-profits. Also, there is a real need for these affordable spaces downtown, and we can't wait to meet the interesting people who would like to use them.
   What We Need:

We are raising money to get this amazing initiative started! We need to renovate the second floor: knock out walls and put up others, rip out old carpet and put in a new floor, paint the walls, purchase new tables, chairs, whiteboards and a projector, and toys and supplies for the child-minding center. We also need to paint and beautify the outside of our building, and put up a new sign, to draw people into our new community spaces. We need to create a permanent position for a promoter and service provider. We will need the money to rent the space while it is being renovated, and not generating revenue. We will also be using funds to create promotional materials and advertising so that we can spread the word about these beautiful, new, affordable spaces that will be available for anyone in the metro area!

    The Impact There is a real lack of affordable community space in St. John's right now, and this initiative can strengthen our community at a time when the provincial budget has us all a little squeezed! Contributing to this initiative isn't just investing in RIAC, it's investing in other small not-for-profits, charities, and start-ups that can use our spaces for rates that won't break the bank! Investing in RIAC is investing in parents, children, artists, grassroots movements, and in people just like you and me! You can be a big part in creating an involved, multi-cultural, inclusive, inviting, and creative community. How great is that?
   Risks & Challenges As with any expansion, there are going to be hurdles! We will eventually need to hire a new staff member to manage this new space. We will need permits and blessings from our landlord and from our downstairs neighbors every step of the way. We will need community partners, supporters, and friends to lift us up while we scramble to get all of this done, but we KNOW we can do it!
When RIAC started 30 years ago, it was a tiny one table "office" at the back of a craft store. Moving into our own office space was just as daunting. Hiring more staff is always daunting. Facing huge influxes of refugees in times of crisis has been daunting too! However, we have overcome every hurdle, grown and persevered. We are more active now in the community than we ever have been, and our potlucks and our ESL classes are so full of people that we are almost out of room! To grow is not even a choice, it is inevitable. We are simply trying to grow in the most gracious, economical, and healthy way possible: Incorporating our whole community, and opening our doors to the city at large!

    Other Ways You Can Help If you can't help financially, you can still help our campaign!
- Share this link on facebook
-Follow us at facebook.com/riac.ca
-Sign up to volunteer, or learn more about us at riac.ca
-Spread the word to anyone that will listen!

story:
We want to take our food movement to the Afro Latino Festival in NYC. 

Help us with your support to raise funds to take a little of the Panamanian Afro Cuisine to New York City. 

It's important for us to keep our culture alive and share with the world. As a young group of entrepreneurs, this is important to us because venture is a weapon of mass construction for our future.

We need to cover expenses such as transportation, accommodation, Temporary Food Service Establishment Permit, cooking material, among others.

Lend us a hand!

story:
WHAT IN TARNATION?!

More like WHO?!

Dirty Job Brewing is a small craft brewery started by 3 partners (Derek, Lashawn, and Justin) that all come from various backgrounds in education, business, manufacturing, and construction. The brewery is in Historic Downtown Mansfield, TX. As part of the revitalization movement of Historic Downtown Mansfield, we are set to open our doors on Main St. and help solidify the movement's foundation. This is our dream. To bring a new level of craft beer brewing to North Texas and use as many locally-sourced ingredients as possible! We know it is hard work and we are ready to get this Dirty Job done! We love North Texas and we love craft beer. We want to give back to both communities with quality products and a warm hospitality in our taproom. We are extremely thankful to all who have believed in us all the way and look forward to giving back! IT'S A DIRTY JOB AND YOU CAN HELP BREW IT!

We will have our taproom and brewery separated in the building so we can brew freely any time of day and still be open to the public from 4p - 12am Tuesday through Friday and 12pm - 12am Saturday. Located near many wonderful developments such as Mellow Mushroom Pizza, a future Twisted Root Burger, Steven's Garden Grill, Big D BBQ, and many more; the one thing Mansfield is under served in is craft beer! You can help us end that!

FREE BEER!!!

We have crossed a multitude of barriers so far, but encountered a few unexpected hurdles as well. We are seeking $20,000 and decided to have this campaign to bolster our opening capital and have a larger brewhouse as well as more fermentation ability. We chose to roll with a 7bbl system which is approximately 217 gallon capacity as this will allow us to brew in larger batches and keep pace with demand. We will be able to have new brews out faster while also be able to distribute to some DFW locations regularly. We will also be using our 1.5bbl (46.5 gallons) "Research and Dirtvelopement" system to frequently create new and experimental brews in smaller batches.

To show our appreciation for your support, we want to give back with crazy cool stuff like naming a keg! You can track that keg from our website and know where it is and what it is pouring! “Hey guys! Big Beertha is over at Big D BBQ pouring the IPAin’t! Let’s go grab a pint!”

You can also get FREE BEER FOR LIFE! Just check out the list of awesome get-backs you can be rewarded with!

If we do not reach our goal or reach more than our goal, all funds will be used accordingly to our stated intent.

Sniffle sniffle

Your support is sincerely appreciated. We have a track record of making award-winning beer and supporting our community. Your support is going to help not only help us achieve our dream but the dream of many Mansfield residents and business owners of having Mansfield’s very own craft brewery on the map!

We are humbled by your commitment to help and commit ourselves to you in return by promising you the absolute best beer you can get from our hands!

Well here is my money but what else can I do to help?!

Even if you can’t contribute with dolla dolla bills y’all, you can still help us promote this campaign to others!

Please share on Facebook, Twitter and don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share links!

 

THANK YOU AND WE WILL SEE YA SOON!

story:
Hello Dreamers

My name  Marcus Davis C.E.O of The Avant Garde of Arts  Christopher Marc I’ve been a writer, director, producer choreographer, magazine designer and dreamer consultant for 12 years. The Avant Garde of Arts, Christopher Marc is a dreamer’s society. Our mission is to up lift communities by bringing together the lower and middle classes through nonprofit organizations, artists from all genres, small businesses/entrepreneurs, and Individuals in need. This movement is important to us in bringing people out of debt.  By coming together and giving simple, correct steps to help achieve their dreams and not be financially in debt. With your help we will help dreamers go to school by raising funding and having our own department for grants to be written to support these individuals. This will allow performing artist, visual artists, photographers, dancers, and etc. This will help pave the way for artists to be able to put on their own productions for free. Members will be able generate income through travel, concert tickets, and much more.

We are looking to raise $1000.00 in funding to help build our dreamers society and allow our dreamers to have a chance of their dreams to come true. We are excited about this campaign to help artists of all genres as well as those in need of guidance and support.  We have added some new perks that are really exciting and will allow supporters to take full advantage of becoming a member.  Some of these perks include discounts on travel, concerts, apparel and art events.  If for some reason we do not reach our goal, 50% of the funds will be distributed to those who helped promote the campaign to help develop their cause, the rest of the funds will go into our dreamers society in helping our community come together and keep the arts and dreams alive in our city and other communities .any kind of donation either time or small amount  is appreciated to help build up the society.

story:
Short Summary

Local friends, Thai food aficionados, the health conscious and anyone hungry for a great meal will enjoy the fresh authentic culinary experience and expedited service they offer.

However, offering a fresh and flavorful menu that features lunch specials and dinner offerings is not all Thai on the Fly has in store! They will also be featuring extensive catering services for both large companies as well as intimate neighborhood gatherings. 

Thai on the Fly is committed to running a successful business while at the same time making sure to give back to its local community (the owners live in Littleton themselves). Thai on the Fly's guiding principle is rooted in the belief that to be truly successful they must measure their “double bottom line”. Observing how the business is doing financially, along with socially and locally, will be a top priority for the Thai on the Fly owners!

Through participation in Thai on the Fly's Indiegogo campaign, you will receive awesome perks worth well more than your initial contribution. You will also be involved from day one with a great restaurant that serves authentic, fast, fresh and flavorful food. Please join Chris and Niddy in getting the doors to Thai on the Fly open for business!

The Management Team

Thai on the Fly will be jointly owned by Chris Parsons and Niddy Saengsrichan. Already previous restaurant owners in Thailand, the happy couple bring to the table a wealth of business and culinary experience.

Chris...
Though once a Disney entertainer, Chris has spent an extensive part of his career as an educator, most recently teaching Performing Arts just outside of the Boston area. He was the Co-Owner and General Manager of a Thai restaurant in Pattaya, Thailand and has worked in many capacities in several different culinary establishments. His strong sense of marketing and business savvy will ensure the success of Thai on the Fly.

Niddy...
Professionally trained at The Chiang Mai Institute of Culinary Arts, Niddy is a lifelong Thai cuisine expert. Having been born and raised in northern Thailand, he brings to the table an authenticity and passion for truly authentic Thai cuisine. Having worked as a Chef for the past couple of years at another local Thai restaurant, Niddy is keenly aware of what it takes to run a successful kitchen.

What They Need

They anticipate start-up expenses of approximately $130,000. Through Indiegogo, they intend to raise $20,000 for initial expenses (kitchen build-out and equipment, furnishing, first lease payments, etc.) In addition, they are utilizing their own savings, personal loans, and business credit cards to help them finance this incredible venture.

Location

Thai on the Fly is centrally located in the Acorn Plaza at 439 Littleton Street in Westford, Massachusetts. There is ample free parking and easy access from both Route 2A and 495.

Menu

Thai on the Fly's authentic menu is first and foremost - delicious! The menu is inspired by various traditional recipes handed down from Niddy's family in northern Thailand. Here is a taste of some of what they will offer ...
* Tom Yum Soup (spicy and sour)
* Tom Ka Soup (spicy coconut)
* Spicy Chicken Drummies
* Fresh Springrolls
* Moo Ping (Pork Skewers)
* Pad Thai
* Pad Si Ew
* Various Curries
* Khao Phat (Thai Fried Rice)
* Khao Niao (Sticky Rice) and Jasmine Rice
Plus, be on the lookout for Niddy's original "Garuda Special" - a dish you won't want to miss!

Atmosphere

The atmosphere of the lobby at Thai on the Fly is sure to stimulate all your senses and make you feel like you stepped into Thailand. It offers a traditional yet cozy ambiance with original Thai artwork, bamboo, and Buddhist and Hindu statues. These warm and inviting surroundings will only be outdone by Chris & Niddy's friendly and community-focused service.

Marketing Strategy

Utilizing social media avenues, Thai on the Fly will engage with customers through many social apps including but not limited to Facebook. Captivating local interest by advertising through postal mailers, as well as utilizing Groupon coupons and restaurant loyalty cards, Thai on the Fly hopes to become Middlesex County's favorite Thai takeout! 

Commitments

Thai on the Fly is committed to providing truly authentic Thai cuisine, without any fusion of other Asian influences. Thai on the Fly will support its local community by providing jobs to the area. 

They guarantee fast, fresh and flavorful food and will always ensure that each and every customer is satisfied with their dining experience.

story:
About Baby Bat Beauty

My name is Amanda Wolfson and I started this company almost a year ago while I was a senior at Drexel University as a fun way to express my creativity by helping other people express theirs through makeup! The lack of affordable cruelty-free makeup had many of my friends frustrated which sparked the idea to sell my creations. Our cosmetics and beauty products are all handmade with love for a price that won't break the bank. By using high-end cruelty free, and often vegan ingredients, in a few short months we have turned this little company into something great. Now we need your help to put Baby Bat Beauty on the map - literally! We need custom packaging to help upgrade our look. It will help us comply with international laws so we can be sold in stores across the world! Not only that, custom packaging helps us compete with the larger chemical-ridden brands that are widely available today!

 

Manufacturers require us to purchase a large bulk quantity of each item which significantly increases the upfront investment. For many small businesses like ours, this can be one major hurdle which prevents us from competing with the big brands.

The Impact

We believe strongly in the quality of each of our ingredients as well as the quality of our products. We also believe that animal testing is inhumane, and yet many makeup brands still continue this practice. We've developed quality, handmade products that are all cruelty-free and PETA certified. Most of our products are also 100% vegan. The result? Our products are higher quality than brands you can find at Sephora, and yet cost as much as drugstore brands.

We don't use fillers and harsh chemicals to cheapen our products like other brands! All of our beauty products are formulated without talc, mineral oil, petrolatum, parabens, phthalates, SLS, gluten, and most of our products are also vegan. This is great for anyone with sensitive skin or those who have allergies to many common ingredients in mainstream makeup products.

Risks & Challenges

Dealing with overseas manufacturers is a lengthy process. We are hoping the packaging will arrive to us around mid-summer but we cannot be 100% sure. So one of our challenges will be this lengthy process.  However, we already have the prototypes and all the designs are ready so we are ready to hit the ground running as soon as our packaging arrives!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't support us financially, there are other ways to support! Sharing us on your social media and telling your friends is also a huge help! We appreciate everyone's support and dedication.

story:
Welcome to Live at Marvins Garden

We want to build a grassroots venue in #yeg to support the growth and vibrant community of live arts and culture. 

We (Mark Bellows & Ryan Brodziak from The Local Omnivore and Steve Derpack of JCL Productions) are teaming up to show the rest of Canada what Edmonton is really made of when it comes to the live arts and culture scene. 

Picture this: An intimate 150 person venue serving the whole range of live arts & culture by offering a fresh and functional space for events including:

  • Live musical performances from all genres 
  • DJ dance parties
  • Theatre & dance productions
  • Comedy shows
  • Film screenings 
  • Poetry slams, literary events
  • Conferences & workshops

The bonus is, we will also endeavour to preserve history, repurpose and recycle as many materials as we can when we build the space. 

[Original Drawing of Potential Layout for Marvins Garden] 

We want the vibe to be welcoming, open-minded, and respectful. Our focus will be on ensuring artists feel their creativity flourishing. We believe in fair wages and are mindful of the unique differences in this industry our staff face. Basically, we want to create a place for all. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $190,000 in order to build and start the operations for Marvins Garden. The funds raised will be used for: 

  • Permits, Fees, & Leases
  • Building & Construction Materials
  • Start-Up Operations 

[Budget - In Cost-Savings Graphic Design Version] 

In order to raise this amount, we've come up with some really unique, and exciting rewards with promoting the future community in mind. 

Rewards like a VIP weekend at the Edmonton Music Awards and custom paintings created in homage to your favourite music album. Plus, one-of-a-kind swag and recognition on our backer wall of fame. 

[Examples of some of the posters available in the rewards. Yes, that's Connor McDavid - the piece is called "Connor McPortrait" and it was painted by local artist Lauren Hunter.] 

What Marvins Garden Means to the Community

We want to build Marvins Garden in order to:

  • Create a healthy urban ecology;
  • Serve as an innovation hub and incubation space for artists; and to
  • Support the growth of Edmonton's live arts & culture scene

Every artist who has "made it," did so because of community venues like what we hope to build. The positive impact locally, nationally, and globally is priceless. 

We believe we can build and run a successful venue because we have done this before. Mark and Ryan built The Local Omnivore brick and mortar location by hand, and have been at the helm since the company started in 2012. Steve has been running his own successful entertainment agency for more than twelve years now. 

We believe we can do this, and need everyone in this amazing city to jump on board with us. 

[Concept Drawing for Marvins Garden Logo] 

Risks & Challenges

There are always risks & challenges associated with starting a business, the first hurdle is finding the capital to build the space and having all the necessary building and operating permits in place. We believe we can overcome this with your help and because of our experience building and opening businesses in Edmonton. 

We will also consult and collaborate with technical experts all along the way. We want this space to be perfect and suit the needs of the live arts community and its consumers. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We get it if you can't buy rewards at this time, but there are many other ways you can support us, such as:

  • Helping us get the word out and making lots of noise about the campaign and the space;
  • Using all the share tools available on our Indiegogo page and other platforms.

Thank you so much for all of your support. We can't wait to see you all #liveatmarvinsgarden. 

Sincerely, 

Ryan, Mark, and Steve

[From L to R: Steve, Ryan, Mark]
story_txt:
Welcome to Live at Marvins Garden
We want to build a grassroots venue in #yeg to support the growth and vibrant community of live arts and culture. 
We (Mark Bellows & Ryan Brodziak from The Local Omnivore and Steve Derpack of JCL Productions) are teaming up to show the rest of Canada what Edmonton is really made of when it comes to the live arts and culture scene. 
Picture this: An intimate 150 person venue serving the whole range of live arts & culture by offering a fresh and functional space for events including:

Live musical performances from all genres 
DJ dance parties
Theatre & dance productions
Comedy shows
Film screenings 
Poetry slams, literary events
Conferences & workshops

The bonus is, we will also endeavour to preserve history, repurpose and recycle as many materials as we can when we build the space. 

[Original Drawing of Potential Layout for Marvins Garden] 
We want the vibe to be welcoming, open-minded, and respectful. Our focus will be on ensuring artists feel their creativity flourishing. We believe in fair wages and are mindful of the unique differences in this industry our staff face. Basically, we want to create a place for all. 

What We Need & What You Get
We need $190,000 in order to build and start the operations for Marvins Garden. The funds raised will be used for: 

Permits, Fees, & Leases
Building & Construction Materials
Start-Up Operations 


[Budget - In Cost-Savings Graphic Design Version] 
In order to raise this amount, we've come up with some really unique, and exciting rewards with promoting the future community in mind. 
Rewards like a VIP weekend at the Edmonton Music Awards and custom paintings created in homage to your favourite music album. Plus, one-of-a-kind swag and recognition on our backer wall of fame. 


[Examples of some of the posters available in the rewards. Yes, that's Connor McDavid - the piece is called "Connor McPortrait" and it was painted by local artist Lauren Hunter.] 
What Marvins Garden Means to the Community
We want to build Marvins Garden in order to:

Create a healthy urban ecology;
Serve as an innovation hub and incubation space for artists; and to
Support the growth of Edmonton's live arts & culture scene

Every artist who has "made it," did so because of community venues like what we hope to build. The positive impact locally, nationally, and globally is priceless. 
We believe we can build and run a successful venue because we have done this before. Mark and Ryan built The Local Omnivore brick and mortar location by hand, and have been at the helm since the company started in 2012. Steve has been running his own successful entertainment agency for more than twelve years now. 
We believe we can do this, and need everyone in this amazing city to jump on board with us. 

[Concept Drawing for Marvins Garden Logo] 

Risks & Challenges
There are always risks & challenges associated with starting a business, the first hurdle is finding the capital to build the space and having all the necessary building and operating permits in place. We believe we can overcome this with your help and because of our experience building and opening businesses in Edmonton. 
We will also consult and collaborate with technical experts all along the way. We want this space to be perfect and suit the needs of the live arts community and its consumers. 

Other Ways You Can Help
We get it if you can't buy rewards at this time, but there are many other ways you can support us, such as:

Helping us get the word out and making lots of noise about the campaign and the space;
Using all the share tools available on our Indiegogo page and other platforms.

Thank you so much for all of your support. We can't wait to see you all #liveatmarvinsgarden. Sincerely, Ryan, Mark, and Steve[From L to R: Steve, Ryan, Mark]

story:
We know how much our children love to create…and now it just got easier.

My Story

I am Prue Burnstein, Sydney designer and lover of all things handmade. I have worked in the fashion industry for nearly 20 years and have always loved designing children’s wear or art for their walls.  With two children of my own, I am more aware than ever the importance for children to explore the creative world around them; to explore and challenge what they see. I am endlessly inspired by the creativity of kids and I have always wanted to provide a beautiful, creative space for their imaginations to roam.

Based in the Inner West of Sydney, Paper Rock Scissors Art Studio is a new art space for children of all ages. Paper Rock Scissors Art Studios will provide an inspiring, thought provoking environment for children to explore their ideas, learn new techniques and work together on fun art-y projects. I am planning to offer so many amazing classes and events- the schedule is already packed!  I have finally found the home for my new studio and I need a little help to get things going.

Classes will run after school, weekends and school holidays.  Each class will be different with new techniques being explored and all art materials provided.

And, for the parents that work full time and feel guilty that they can never pick up their children from school to get them to these fun things (ME!!!)… they can finally relax… the Paper Rock Scissors Art VAN can pick children up from the local schools.   

This chapter for Paper Rock Scissors Art Studios begins in Term 1 of the school year 2018. Exciting (for me), fun(for them) and something for us all to look forward to.

I am launching my new adventure here on Indiegogo where your contributions will help me with all the costs associated with opening a new business, enable me to fix up and create the new space, help furnish and stock the studio, and run the van.

I am hoping to raise $10,000 and there are so many great perks available! Essentially you are just pre-paying for items you will use: open studio visits, any of the classes, and art supplies.   And if you aren't local to the area, you are helping provide an awesome space in our neighbourhood for children to make art and learn new skills. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot donate at this time, please share this campaign with your friends and family! Indiegogo has easy to use sharing tools that makes it easy to share our campaign with others. Also, just spread the word about our studio and come visit! Sign up for classes, weekends or holidays events- or just drop-in and make some art during weekend studio hours.

I want the studio to be a bustle of creativity and community building!

 

Thank you!

Thank you so much for supporting my campaign and making this new adventure possible!

story:
Behind the project

As an aspiring type designer with a background in interface design and development this is a project I am passionate about

  • This project was born out of the type design community's need
  • I have personally had type designers contacting me about developing functionality like this
  • Once produced, it will be freely available to the type design community

Funding the development

The project is advancing, but so far without funding

  • This project needs more development time than I can afford to spend in my spare time
  • Funding even part of the development time (and cost) will allow me to progress more quickly
  • If you are in need of this type of a plugin for showcasing type designs, get involved and influence development

The Impact

Your contribution matters to me:

  • Without it I can not take the time to focus on this project
  • You will in turn be giving back to the type design community
  • Support the idea of free software by supporting a Wordpress plugin that can be used by anybody

Risks & Challenges

As only developer currently working on this, the project progresses or stalls with how much time I can financially afford to put into it.

  • Without enough funding this will remain a pet project without enough attention
  • Reaching the goal allows me to spend enough time to ship a tested and well functioning plugin
  • With additional funding the features and customisation options will increase
  • This is a continuous development project: With time and feedback from users new version will come

Other Ways You Can Help

Feedback on the interface and overall direction of the plugin is most welcome. Feel free to join the development group to influence the development, provide feedback on beta versions and stay informed on the latest progress.

story:
Tubeteika - The Silk Road Project

What do you know about Central Asia? Have you heard about Uzbekistan? Would you visit Chechnya or do you think it is a total madness to go there?

WE DO. 

We are visiting places where no one would go to, we are dealing with issues no one would be dealing with. We are already half way through our project. We have already visited the Russian Caucasus, Chechnya, Georgia, Azerbaijan, Uzbekistan and Kazahstan. Soon we will finish our project by visiting Kyrgyzstan. 

WHY ARE WE DOING THIS?

CONNECT PEOPLE OF WEST AND EAST

Europe and Central Asia are so close and yet so far from each other. We want to discover our common values and learn about our true differences. We want to help understand these regions. 

DISPROVE STEREOTYPES

We want to disprove stereotypes about the people of these regions. We want to show what actually cover these harsh lands. We will show the life of everyday people in Central Asia, who you can't see on TV and you do not read about in the news.

LEARN ABOUT TRADITIONS

Traditions play important role in our life, but it is so easy to forget them in this fast-paced world. We want to capture and share centuries-old local traditions. We have already visited an old bakery in Georgia, learned how to make Khinkali, and now we are learning about the wedding traditions of Azerbaijan.

WHAT WILL WE PRODUCE?

A PHOTO DOCUMENTARY 

Adam is a photographer - he knows how to use a camera. I am Ukrainian - I know Russian, the language of locals. Together we can get as close as possible to local communities. We want to capture the superstitions and traditions that make up the everyday lives of the locals - and we will investigate the darker side of society, such as the issue of bride kidnappings.

A LOCAL PHOTO PROJECT - "LOCAL LIFE FROM INSIDE"

As well as taking our own photos, we will ask local people in Uzbekistan, Kazakhstan and Kyrgyzstan to capture the important elements of their life using disposable cameras (provided by us). We hope these photos will show the beauty of these countries through locals' eyes.

A BLOG - "TUBETEIKA.BLOG.HU"

As we travel, we’re documenting our trip in Hungarian on our blog. Later, we’ll translate these experiences into English to give even more people a new view of these cultures.

What we need

We need your local insights

If you are staying in any of the countries mentioned and are willing to host us, please contact us. Also if you can give us any connection with locals, or recommend any information which can help our project, please let us know. We appreciate it, and will be really grateful.

We need your financial support

We’ve covered all of our expenses so far from our own savings, but to finish our project to the highest standard possible we’d like your support. The visas, insurance and travel costs took a lot of money and because of strict registration rules in Uzbekistan we cannot use Couchsurfing in this country. Instead, we are forced to stay in hostels or hotels which are permitted to register foreigners, and which are typically more expensive.

FOLLOW US ON FACEBOOK DURING AND AFTER OUR JOURNEY! 

http://facebook.com/tubeteika

http://tubeteika.blog.hu

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
Short Summary

My friends,
I'm having a blast making funny & entertaining ham radio videos and I want to continue to bring you guys the best product reviews and cool stuff for your hobby. I'm committed to bringing you the highest production value most entertaining show on the internet. My only issue is... I'm running out of money. So instead on begging for money, I've decided to design this cool t-shirt and sell em' to help offset the production costs of the show.  
So how about supporting the cause, helping keep the channel going and showing the world that we can "Make Ham Radio Great Again".   

Here's the Deal: 

  • I'm looking to cover the costs of the shirt up front.
  • Together, we'll make this channel grow & spread the word about our hobby.
  • Everything I make on this deal goes back into the operation. I've literally spent thousands of dollars on equipment & products to produce this show. I know you work hard for your money and every dollar is valuable. 
  • Know that your contribution is helping to grow the channel, grow the ham radio hobby & keep you entertained & informed about the cool stuff there is out there without boring the crap out of you. 

Thanks & 73,

 Bob K6UDA
