story:
Who is Idiom Brewing Co. and what are we about?

Idiom Brewing Co. is Frederick, Maryland's newest addition to the rapidly growing craft beer scene, started by an avid brewer with a plan to produce handcrafted recipes that depart from typical approaches to the styles.  We've worked hard honing our skills and have invested all of our spare time and energy toward making this dream a reality.  We have a few lease options currently at our disposal, which we hope to finalize by the end of September.  We are currently working with a local bank on a SBA loan and hope to have that approved in the near future as well.

 

Our goal is simple --

We want to bring people from all walks together, to enjoy themselves and each other. Whether you seek out explosively juicy IPA’s; are adventurous and looking to try boozy, sour or complex flavors; or just because you’re looking to enjoy traditionally styled beer.

 

Handcrafted beer is considerably more than the sum of its parts, and today's consumer is much more discerning and engaged in their selections.  Idiom Brewing Co. believes that brewing is a form of expression.  Our 'Expressions in Beer' will allow us to create new flavors, and new experiences, for our customers.  We strive to innovate by utilizing new and/or experimental hops, local ingredients, and unique flavor profiles in an attempt to stretch the limits of our imagination, and that of our customer's palette.  We hope our customers leave the brewery with a new found appreciation and knowledge for what possibilities still exist for craft beer.

 

Opening a brewery comes with a hefty price tag. Because we have done this all on our own (up to this point) through our savings, we are left with a longer list of items than we have cash to support.  We know that many of you are passionate about beer (and us) and will consider becoming a supporter of this campaign.  

 

We are a brewery with the intention of being a platform for advocacy, collaboration and community re-investment.  Your contributions will not only validate our mission, but your desire for more options and more flavor.  Ultimately your contribution will also help us realize our goal of being a local contender in Frederick, MD.

 

We have been blessed to have some awesome friends and family that have helped us along the way, but we need additional support, from you, to make this dream a reality.

 

To find out more about us, our philosophy and a little about our beer, visit http://www.idiombrewing.com.

 

What We Need & What You Get!

Idiom Brewing Co. hopes to increase its working capital to allow for the addition of 6 x 3.5 barrel stainless steel fermenters, and 6 x 3.5 barrel stainless steel serving tanks, to service our location in Frederick, MD.  Idiom Brewing Co. also requires additional funds for transfer pumps, a glycol cooling system and licensing. Any contributions above and beyond our goal, are extremely appreciated.

  • Idiom Brewing Co. requires an additional $35,700 in funding to acquire additional equipment to streamline production and offer quality products to our local customers.
  • Funds contributed from this campaign will first be used to purchase additional 3.5 barrel fermenters (approx. 6) and 3.5 barrel serving tanks (approx. 6) for our location in Frederick, MD.  Any additional funds collected from this campaign will be used to offset licensing costs, a glycol chilling system and transfer pumps.   

 

 

As a result of your contributions, you'll receive some pretty interesting, and rewarding, perks!

 

Some of those perks are in the form of physical items, such as stickers (for your car, mirror, guitar case, beer fridge or anything you feel needs a little decoration):

 

To t-shirts (to show your love for us and what we do):

 

Or growlers (to carry that sweet nectar home with you):

 

And glassware (to enjoy the nectar once you get there):

 

While some will be from the fruits of our labor (*vouchers* for growler fills):

 

Or membership in clubs that grant you reduced prices on future purchases (wallet sized membership card that can be used to open bottles too):

All items in 'Perk Packages' will be shipped, minus Growlers and Pint Glasses.  These will either need to be picked up at the Brewery or special arrangements made for shipping them (due to size and possibility of damage).

 

The Impact:

Your contributions will not only impact the ability for Idiom Brewing Co. to become a profitable business, but you'll also impact the local craft beer scene.  We plan to introduce some new twists on existing styles, as well as pioneer the creation of new styles or flavors.

  • Idiom Brewing Co. believes that creativity shows no boundaries, and that our only limits are those set by our imaginations.
  • We have been innovating new recipes for the better part of a decade, incorporating new hops, and new flavors, to provide unique experiences.
  • Idiom Brewing Co. will collaborate with other local breweries, distilleries and businesses to build a customer base not only for ourselves, but for other community businesses too.

 

Risks & Challenges:

There are always hurdles in business. Whether it be licensing, Local, State or Federal Government regulations, regional competition from big Corporations or the perception of the customer, there are always challenges. We believe, however, that challenges are meant to be overcome and that we have the skills and drive to do so.

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

Some people just can't contribute money, but that doesn't mean they can't help...

  • If you are unable to contribute financially, don't fret. Spread the word! We need all of the support we can get. Whether via word of mouth or referrals from friends, every little bit helps!
  • Consider contributing skills/resources to our build-out! We will need skilled/licensed plumbers, electricians, carpenters and the like to help out. Anywhere we can get quality product, for less than expected cost (or FREE), is a boon to our business.

 

Just as much as local customers need more options, we need the help of local customers.  As such, please reach out to us with ANY ideas regarding our business, or this campaign, no matter how small or large. We are willing to listen!

Some people just can't contribute money, but that doesn't mean they can't help...

If you are unable to contribute financially, don't fret. Spread the word! We need all of the support we can get. Whether via word of mouth or referrals from friends, every little bit helps!
Consider contributing skills/resources to our build-out! We will need skilled/licensed plumbers, electricians, carpenters and the like to help out. Anywhere we can get quality product, for less than expected cost (or FREE), is a boon to our business.

 
Just as much as local customers need more options, we need the help of local customers.  As such, please reach out to us with ANY ideas regarding our business, or this campaign, no matter how small or large. We are willing to listen!

story:
The goal of this project is to scale production of Laza's Hibiscus Tea business, a product that we have already seen tremendous uptake for. Her tea is sold in 26 locations across Toronto and Southwestern Ontario. The product was popular enough to sell through the first batch of 10,000 drinks, and now we are building partnerships with grocery story chains to truly grow Laza's business. With your support, we can make this business sustainable and showcase Guelph ingenuity across Canada!

Laza's Hibiscus tea is made from the dried calyces of the hibiscus flower. The calyces themselves are known to contain high levels of antioxidants – an essential part of a healthy diet. They help to rid our bodies of free radicals (destructive molecules that can damage our cells and DNA) and can protect us against chronic disease, such as heart disease, rheumatoid arthritis, diabetes and cancer.

We know that dietary changes are an effective way to help manage high blood pressure, and hibiscus tea has also been reported to have a lowering effect on high blood pressure. It’s a natural and tasty way to put these changes in motion. Studies have shown that drinking as little as 2 to 3 cups of hibiscus tea each day can lower your blood pressure levels, working as effectively as some anti-hypertensive prescription medications (without the potential side effects).

Laza Food and Beverages is a community-based business. The business was founded in Guelph, and founder Melku Gebrekristos is a common fixture at Laza's store in the Ward, along with the farmer's market, Guelph Jazz Festival, corporate events, and other Guelph events throughout the year.

This is why we're asking the community to support the next step in her growth. Our multifaceted expansion plan involves growth specifically with our line of refreshing and healthy specialty drinks.

Our next steps include:

- Expanding reach in the general and grocery store market through improving our marketing materials and sales strategy

- Increasing storage space and distribution channels to meet increasing demand. This includes new storage space in the current Laza location in the Ward

- Producing locally and sustainably, including environmentally-friendly labels and production methods. We are also speaking with Guelph Solar about the possibility of using solar panels to offset our energy use as we expand the business

- And, if enough money is raised - purchasing a truck to distribute product and serve as a drink truck at events. The goal would be to purchase a small commercial drink truck (think Nissan NV food truck) to distribute drinks to partner locations, and serve drinks directly to customers - for instance at construction sites or other work locations.

You can read Laza's story here: https://lazafandb.com/about/

Thank you so much for your time and your support! We really can't do it without you!

story:
THE STORY

My  name is Carlos. 2 years ago I travelled as a volunteer to Kenya, Africa. For 2 months I lived in Muhuru Bay Village near Victoria lake with the Suba and Luo tribes. I lived in orphanages doing Inter-cultural activities with orphan children, HIV/AIDS education and awareness campaigns, community projects and water projects. When I arrived to my home in Mexico I was so motivated to make a real change to the lives of the orphans there that I built a school named Shining Star to increase the orphanage and be able to accept more and more orphans everyday.  At the same time I used to work as a volunteer coordinating with some friends a NGO called Mexico Sonrie (www.mexicosonrie.org.mx) to improve the quality of life of low-income sick children and low-income communities in Queretaro, Mexico through activities that contribute to the common good.

   

           (Me with the children in Kenya, Africa and the children in Queretaro, Mexico)

Now, after two years of giving the orphans a safe home, far from the war zones, hunger and droughts and trying to make better the lives of the Mexican children its time to give them something else; a new kind of gift; one that they can actually use and take with them everyday…well at least for 5 years.

THE SHOE

The Shoe That Grows is a patented design of an innovative shoe that adjusts and expands (the shoe comes in three sizes: youth small, youth large, and adult). These shoes are intended and designed for children living in extreme poverty that otherwise would not have access to shoes or only access to shoes in poor condition that will quickly be outgrown.

            (Actual photo of our children in Kenya (the ones that have any kind of shoe)

But having a shoe that grows five sizes doesn't matter unless the shoe is ultra-durable; The Shoe is made with the highest quality materials: compressed rubber (similar to that of a car tire), anti-bacterial synthetic, and high grade, tactical Velcro. Easy to clean (for toe-tally clean feet) and easy to use (and it grows with the toes).

     

THE PROBLEM

The lack of shoes makes our children suffer from soil-transmitted diseases and parasites (they live in areas that do not have adequate sanitation and healthcare) and serious injuries that make them more difficult to walk several miles to go to school everyday for example.

 

WHAT ARE WE GOING TO DO WITH YOUR HELP?

In Shining Star orphanage in Kenya there are living today 808 children (is the only school/orphanage of the entire village). In our low-income communities in the city of Queretaro, Mexico we have 303 children.

EACH PAIR COSTS 15USD + EXPORTATION FEE FOR EACH 50 PAIRS

HOW?

We can pack 50 pairs into a duffle weighing less than 50 pounds. After having the shoes we will export them from USA to Mexico and Kenya inside those duffels paying an exportation fee for each 50 pairs.

REWARDS

Some NGOs, s worldwide have joined our cause, leaving us to offer great rewards to travel and continue helping people around the world. KHAYUL (www.khayul.com) is a volunteering agency that will help you plan your trip, vaccines, lodging and medicines, everything to have the best experience of your life helping other people worldwide. Join to our cause and you can get great discounts on the trips that KHAYUL offers from May 2017 to August 2017 to Thailand or India.

Experience the feeling of helping those most in need by donating shoes and traveling at the same time!

REMEMBER!

YOU CAN HELP US SPREADING THE WORD AND SHARING OUR CAUSE ON FACEBOOK, TWITTER OR INSTAGRAM!

BE THAT GUY!

(Photo of a kid that just received a new pair of shoes during Second World War)

story:
Independent News Foundation

I want to start a non-profit foundation in support of The Independent's journalistic efforts and journalism as a whole, through creation of a paid internship and a scholarship fund. I have a passion for working with young people, and I envision high school and college student interns, getting on-the-job training in news and feature writing, news and feature photography, sports writing and photography, graphic design and layout, editing, interviewing and writing skills—not to mention professional interaction and training in how to have a job and meet responsibilities.

Scholarships would be awarded once a year to high school students in the area The Independent covers, which includes six high schools altogether, two of them at charter schools. The scholarship would be for students interested in studying journalism, with a preference given for students pursuing print journalism. After the initial set-up, we would immediately begin fundraising efforts in the community to keep the foundation moving forward.

Take Flight: Job Readiness

I also have done initial planning for a job readiness program called Take Flight. The program will consist of an 8-week training, with a weekly session. Sessions will include job interview skills, resume writing, and basic computer skills. Other weeks would include a stylist working with local thrift stores to come up with suitable clothes for job-seeking; other volunteers would do a haircut and makeover. My idea is to make it fun. Having a person work one-on-one as a stylist, and by having thrift stores donate the clothing, we can demonstrate what can be done on a shoestring. By the same token, a makeover and haircut will give local hairdressers and makeup artists the chance to show off their skills and help a neighbor out at the same time. The program would involve lots of community members, and from my initial overtures, the response has been exceptionally positive. We would end the program with presentation of laptop computers so the participants can effectively look for jobs, and a ceremony to recognize the work they've done. Local business owners would help with interviewing skills and other job training.

I want to start this program because as my opportunities have expanded, I've grown by leaps and bounds through mentoring. I want to pay that forward into the community. Those people who have given so generously of their time over the years have helped me immeasurably. It would mean a lot to me to be able to bring that kind of possibility into someone else's life. My dream is to make it an annual program.

Biz Buzz = B2B Support

I have another idea I call Biz Buzz, which The Independent is already implementing. This is something I want to grow. Biz Buzz is business-to-business support on social media, and through marketing in general. The area I live in is rural, with many business owners not quite current with the digital age, and others who are doing a great job. I'd like to bring us all together, in a concerted regional effort to support each other's marketing efforts, and to more effectively promote all of our businesses. The Independent is currently working in cooperation with three chambers of commerce and informal business coalitions on this very idea, which includes digital, print, and “shop locally” themed posters. To take it to the next level would require hiring somebody part-time to manage the social media work.

About Me

The thumbnail sketch of my life is that I've come from nothing, through dreaming big and working hard, to owning a small community newspaper. I got into journalism through apprenticeship, and I love that this is still a profession where that is a viable path to working as a journalist. With our buyout getting close to completion, I am the only one of the original four employees who remains in ownership of Independent News, LLC.

Running a small community newspaper means I do it all, from reporting and editing to layout and graphic design, to circulation, to delivery, to advertising sales and management. I do all of this because owning and running The Independent is my dream job. I love what I do and am passionate about it. I work hard, and I'm proud of what we produce. Our ambitious aim is to become an even greater asset to the community through more and better coverage.

The Independent faces significant hurdles. Our computer equipment is laughable. Antiquated. We have a monitor the size of a mini fridge and our production team spends way too much time waiting for the computers to catch up. Computers in themselves are not that expensive, but the software we need to run the business is very expensive. Our existing computers are so old, the programs they run are not compatible with newer machines.

I have a story I've told myself my whole life: “I got this. I don't need anybody's help. I can do it. I don't want charity. I want to handle it, I want to take care of it, I don't need help.” I'm proud, I'm independent, and I'm stubborn. But I've come to realize that I need some help. Many of the pieces of the puzzle are in place, but I can't go forward by myself. I'm asking for your help, and I'm grateful for every dollar donated.

Many of the pieces of the puzzle are in place, but I can't go forward by myself. I'm asking for your help, and I'm grateful for every dollar donated.

story:
NuLife                                      Website      Facebook      Instagram
 
NuLife is a nonprofit sewing enterprise that NuLife is a non-profit sewing academy that has two dimensions: training and small business entrepreneurship using sewing skills and sewing machine repair and tune up training classes as its platform and developing innovative, local design talents. The business model will train all aspects of entrepreneurship including management, hiring, employment development, accounting, payroll, product development, sales both in store retail and online, branding, marketing, and shipping. Trainees will be encouraged to dream and come up with their own product. Trains and plans  to employ men,  women and teens in the Lancaster City area who are not only in need of a source of income, but  job skills training in a safe, comfortable and creative workplace within walking distance of where they live.
NuLife offers a program for the community that works to promote life skills to teens that may not have received on their own. We focus on teaching these skills through repurposing discarded materials, fabric, clothing, into beautiful creations. Once created, the program members learn how to sell their creations, the revenue that is received from the re purposed fashion goes back into our community. The graduates of our program who are interested in starting their own business are offered a small $500 donation to put towards their own efforts in building a business, or to continue creating fashion at NuLife.
 
We combine two important skills, sustainability and community service, in order to give back to the Lancaster community. We pride ourselves in our dedication to the community that we were raised in.
 
For more information on NuLife's contribution to the community click here. 
 

 

We organize community events to further our contribution to our neighbors and loved ones. In the past we have held a fashion show, and plan to host another, see the important dates below.

 
One of our goals for our organization has been to open a retail space to provide a more substantial income for our hardworking trainees to be able to sell the items/products that they are making. Our dream is finally coming true!
 
Nimble Thimble
Another opportunity to re purpose the Lancaster community has presented itself to us!
NuLife is working to revitalize Lancaster City's Nimble Thimble in the heart of Lancaster's Central Market.
This was made possible by forming a relationship with Mort, the store owner. The perfect opportunity arose from this relationship; a space for NuLife to open a sewing classroom for advanced sewers, a place to sell its works of art, and a space for a repair shop and training so Mort can continue his expertise and pass on his gift to others before he retires. The business model will also move our dream of training in all aspects of entrepreneurship to a greater level with a hands on  experience right in the retail shop.  
Students at Millersville University are helping in the transition, learn more from the LNP article here.
 
NuLife @ Nimble Thimble will have its Grand Opening this spring, Friday, May 5th!
 
The donations raised here will go towards efforts for the resources to educate, inspire, and provide life skills for the Lancaster City community.
 

Important Dates

Grand Opening: Friday, May 5th 10 AM - 8 PM

  • Ribbon Cutting Ceremony 5:30 PM

Address & Hours

45 N Market St, Lancaster, PA 17603

Located in Hardware Lofts building

Tuesday/Friday/Saturday 10 AM - 4 PM

First Friday 10 AM - 8 PM

Visit

Website      Facebook      Instagram

 

NuLife’s is the in-house fashion label run by the charity Handz On! Under a 501©3 nonprofit fiscal agent (Jump Street Inc.) located in Harrisburg Pa.

story:
Türkçe metin için lütfen aşağı kaydırınız!

Who we are..

The seeds of Tangala is cultivated in 2008 at the foot of Taurus Mountain range, in a little farming village called Yaka -Tlos near Fethiye. Since 2009 we make livestock farming. We produce artisan cheeses from our herd’s milk since 2012. 

Tangala Farm started in 2008 with a small vegetable garden and 2 goats. Today, Tangala is a project platform for sustainable rural living and local artisan productions.

Why we recommend Tangala Cheeses

Cheese is a fermented milk product which is the most easily digestable form of minerals, vitamins, calcium, protein and fats of milk. The seasonal changes in the forest determines the diet of our goats hence the variety of our cheeses. We value our local variety of ecological system. Our goats are fed in foresty and mountainous terrains picking the best seasonal bushes, grass, nuts of trees and flowers.

Why is the campaign important for us and what we offer;

Surprise! Tangala Farm Shop will be open at the Ancient Lycian City, Tlos in April 2017 . This campaign is important for us to help spread our word around and reach to more people. 

What we offer with this campaign;

- 1 kg of cheese option (choose from the perks)
- 6month membership option (choose from the perks)
- Annual membership option (choose from the perks)

- Christmas Package (choose from the perks)

or simply "back it" and make your own option!

Please check the gallery section to review our offers from pictures.

You can use indiegogo social media tools to share this campaign with your friends,

thank you!

Our contact address : buket.ulukut@tangala.org

 

 “Tangala Cheeses – We support artisan production”

Tangazola

Tangazola, our blue cheese is named after the traditional Gorgonzola. Aged and treated minimum 3 months under special conditions. This semihard and aged blue mouldy cheese is produced all year around.

Tangazola is a must-have for cheese trays, a mysterious companion to mushroom and pasta dishes and can be served on top of small bread slices as a surprisingly delicious appetizer.

 

Tangala Fresh Cheeses (Amber/Mera/Tangatin)

Tangala fresh and soft cheeses are aged minimum 4-6 weeks under special conditions. Produced all year around except during hot summer months.

You can serve our fresh cheeses with vegetable dishes, salads and appetizers. Our soft cheeses are good accompanying with wine and can be served in cheese plates. They get gooey in room temperature and can be slightly heated in oven.

Amber - Tangala Camambert 

Mera - Tangala Brie

Tangatin - Tangala Crottin

 

“Tangala Aged Cheeses – We support artisan production”

Tangala Heckberry Cheese

Our hackberry cheese is produced only during spring and summer. Our goats eat hackberry, staphylea and sandalwood leaves in spring and fruits in summer. It is a hard natural rinded goat cheese that is aged for minimum 3 months.

This cheese takes its name from hackberry shrub. What makes our hackberry cheese special is the sweet flavor of the fruits that gives its distinctive flavor to the milk.

Heckberry cheese can be used in sandwiches, served with red wine or cooked with mushrooms and fresh vegitables. Is also very tasty when grated on pastas!

 

Tangala Oak Cheese

Oak cheese is produced during autumn and winter. It is a hard cheese with aged bloomy rind.

The special character of this cheese comes from the acorns of oak trees and bushes that our goats eat during autumn and winter. This fatty nut gives the milk a characteristic flavor and aroma.

Our oak cheese can be served in cheese trays and is a very good companion for pasta dishes.

 

 

60 gün süre ile açık olacak kampanyamız üzerinden Tangala Mandıra Ürünlerine kolayca ve güvenle ulaşabilirsiniz. 
Peynir çeşitlerimiz ile ilgili detaylı bilgi edinebilir ve online alışveriş yapabilirsiniz.

Biz Kimiz..

Muğla’nın Seydikemer bölgesindeki Toros dağlarının eteğinde, Yakaköyü’nde yerleşik  olan çiftliğimiz 2008 yılında küçük bir sebze bahçesi ve 2 keçi ile başladı. 2009 yılından beri hayvancılık ve 2012 yılından bu yana peynir üretimi yapmaktayız. Bugün Tangala sürdürülebilir kırsal yaşam araştırmaları ve yerel artizan üretimler yapmaktadır.

İlk çiftlik dükkanımızın açılışını Yakaköyü sınırları içerisindeki Tlos antik şehrinde 2017 Nisan ayında gerçekleştirmeyi planlıyoruz.

Neden Tangala Peynirlerini Tavsiye Ediyoruz?

Peynir, sütün içinde barındırdığı mineral, vitamin, kalsiyum, protein ve yağların en sindirilebilir halidir. Ormandaki mevsimsel değişiklikler keçilerimizin diyetini böylece Tangala’da ürettiğimiz peynirlerin de çeşitliliğini belirler. Yaşadığımız bölgedeki ekolojik çeşitliliği önemsiyoruz. Keçilerimiz ormanlık ve dağlık alanlarda yayılarak sezonun en güzel otlarını, çalılarını, orman yemişlerini ve çiçekleri yiyerek besleniyorlar.

Bu kampanya bizim için neden önemli ve size neler sunuyor?

Süpriz! Tangala Çiftlik Dükkanı Nisan 2017'de TLOS antik şehirinde açılıyor. Bu ve benzeri kampanyalarla sesimizi duyurmak ve daha fazla kişiye ulaşabilmek bizim için önemli. Bölgedeki kültür turizmine de katkısı olacağını düşündüğümüz çiftlik dükkanımızı kiraladık ve çalışmalara başladık.

Bu kampanyada sunduklarımız;

- 1 kg peynir seçeneği (yan taraftaki perk'lerden seçebilirsiniz)
- 6aylık peynir aboneliği (yan taraftaki perk'lerden seçebilirsiniz)
- Yıllık peynir aboneliği (yan taraftaki perk'lerden seçebilirsiniz)

-Yılbaşı Paketi (yan taraftaki perk'lerden seçebilirsiniz)

yada sadece yukarıdaki "back it" tuşuna basarak kendi seçeneğinizi oluşturabilirsiniz!

Tekliflerimizi fotoğraflar ile beraber görmek için lütfen "gallery" bölümünü ziyaret edin.

Projemizi arkadaşlarınızla paylaşmak için kampanya sayfasının aşağıdaki sosyal medya araçlarını kullabilirsiniz.

Teşekkürler!

iletişim adresimiz : buket.ulukut@tangala.org

 

 “Tangala Peynirleri-Artizan üretimi destekler”

Tangazola

Tangozola adını meşhur Gorgonzola Peynirinden alır. Özel olgunlaştırma koşullarında en az 90 gün olgunlaştırılan yarı sert ve küflü bir peynirdir. Tangozolayı tüm yıl boyunca üretmekteyiz.

Tangazola hem peynir tabaklarının vazgeçilmezi, mantar ve makarna gibi yemekler için gizemli bir sos hem de kanepelerde şaşırtıcı bir lezzettir.

 

Tangala Taze Peynirleri (Amber/Mera/Tangatin)

Taze peynirlerimiz özel koşullarda en az 4-6 hafta olgunlaştırılır. Sıcak yaz ayları hariç tüm yıl boyunca Tangala Tazeleri ile buluşabilirsiniz. Tangala Taze peynirlerini şarapla , peynir tabağında, oda sıcaklığında bekletilmiş ya da fırınlanmış olarak servis edilebilirsiniz.

Amber - Tangala Camambert

Mera - Tangala Brie

Tangatin - Tangala Crottin

 

Tangala Eskitilmiş Peynirler 

Çitlembik

% 100 çiğ keçi sütü ile üretilen çitlembik özel koşullarda en az 90 gün olgunlaştırılır. Sadece ilkbahar ve yaz aylarında ürettiğimiz yarı sert ve az yağlı bir peynirdir. İlkbaharda keçilerimiz ormanda çitlembik, tespih, sandal ve siğilcan gibi çalı ve ağaçların en taze sürgünlerini, çiçeklerini ve yaz sonunda da meyvelerini yerler. Bu dönemde yaptığımız eski kaşarın adının çitlembik olmasının sebebi süte kattığı lezzettir.

Çitlembik kaşarını peynir tabağında sunabileceğiniz gibi özel sandviçlerde, rendeleyerek mantar eşliğinde ve taze yaz sebzeleriyle de kullanabilirsiniz.

 

Pelit

100% çiğ keçi sütü ile üretilen ve özel koşullarda  en az 90 gün olgunlaştırılan sert ve tam yağlı bir peynirdir. Sonbahar-kış aylarında ürettiğimiz bu eski kaşarın özelliği keçilerimizin bu mevsimlerde ormanda yediği piynar pelitleridir. Çok yağlı olan bu meyvenin süte kattığı yağ asitleri ve mineraller sayesinde pelit kaşarın tadı vazgeçilmezler arasındadır.
story_txt: Türkçe metin için lütfen aşağı kaydırınız!Who we are..The seeds of Tangala is cultivated in 2008 at the foot of Taurus Mountain range, in a little farming village called Yaka -Tlos near Fethiye. Since 2009 we make livestock farming. We produce artisan cheeses from our herd’s milk since 2012. Tangala Farm started in 2008 with a small vegetable garden and 2 goats. Today, Tangala is a project platform for sustainable rural living and local artisan productions.Why we recommend Tangala CheesesCheese is a fermented milk product which is the most easily digestable form of minerals, vitamins, calcium, protein and fats of milk. The seasonal changes in the forest determines the diet of our goats hence the variety of our cheeses. We value our local variety of ecological system. Our goats are fed in foresty and mountainous terrains picking the best seasonal bushes, grass, nuts of trees and flowers.Why is the campaign important for us and what we offer;Surprise! Tangala Farm Shop will be open at the Ancient Lycian City, Tlos in April 2017 . This campaign is important for us to help spread our word around and reach to more people. What we offer with this campaign;- 1 kg of cheese option (choose from the perks)- 6month membership option (choose from the perks)- Annual membership option (choose from the perks)- Christmas Package (choose from the perks)or simply "back it" and make your own option!Please check the gallery section to review our offers from pictures.You can use indiegogo social media tools to share this campaign with your friends,thank you!Our contact address : buket.ulukut@tangala.org  “Tangala Cheeses – We support artisan production”TangazolaTangazola, our blue cheese is named after the traditional Gorgonzola. Aged and treated minimum 3 months under special conditions. This semihard and aged blue mouldy cheese is produced all year around.Tangazola is a must-have for cheese trays, a mysterious companion to mushroom and pasta dishes and can be served on top of small bread slices as a surprisingly delicious appetizer. Tangala Fresh Cheeses (Amber/Mera/Tangatin)Tangala fresh and soft cheeses are aged minimum 4-6 weeks under special conditions. Produced all year around except during hot summer months.You can serve our fresh cheeses with vegetable dishes, salads and appetizers. Our soft cheeses are good accompanying with wine and can be served in cheese plates. They get gooey in room temperature and can be slightly heated in oven.Amber - Tangala Camambert Mera - Tangala BrieTangatin - Tangala Crottin “Tangala Aged Cheeses – We support artisan production”Tangala Heckberry CheeseOur hackberry cheese is produced only during spring and summer. Our goats eat hackberry, staphylea and sandalwood leaves in spring and fruits in summer. It is a hard natural rinded goat cheese that is aged for minimum 3 months.This cheese takes its name from hackberry shrub. What makes our hackberry cheese special is the sweet flavor of the fruits that gives its distinctive flavor to the milk.Heckberry cheese can be used in sandwiches, served with red wine or cooked with mushrooms and fresh vegitables. Is also very tasty when grated on pastas! Tangala Oak CheeseOak cheese is produced during autumn and winter. It is a hard cheese with aged bloomy rind.The special character of this cheese comes from the acorns of oak trees and bushes that our goats eat during autumn and winter. This fatty nut gives the milk a characteristic flavor and aroma.Our oak cheese can be served in cheese trays and is a very good companion for pasta dishes.  60 gün süre ile açık olacak kampanyamız üzerinden Tangala Mandıra Ürünlerine kolayca ve güvenle ulaşabilirsiniz. Peynir çeşitlerimiz ile ilgili detaylı bilgi edinebilir ve online alışveriş yapabilirsiniz.Biz Kimiz..Muğla’nın Seydikemer bölgesindeki Toros dağlarının eteğinde, Yakaköyü’nde yerleşik  olan çiftliğimiz 2008 yılında küçük bir sebze bahçesi ve 2 keçi ile başladı. 2009 yılından beri hayvancılık ve 2012 yılından bu yana peynir üretimi yapmaktayız. Bugün Tangala sürdürülebilir kırsal yaşam araştırmaları ve yerel artizan üretimler yapmaktadır.İlk çiftlik dükkanımızın açılışını Yakaköyü sınırları içerisindeki Tlos antik şehrinde 2017 Nisan ayında gerçekleştirmeyi planlıyoruz.Neden Tangala Peynirlerini Tavsiye Ediyoruz?Peynir, sütün içinde barındırdığı mineral, vitamin, kalsiyum, protein ve yağların en sindirilebilir halidir. story:
Maker Playhouse

 

Maker Playhouse is the brain child of Mario Cuellar, parent and long time educator and recent co-founder  Ramiro Maldonado, a long term community advocate, fundraising consultant,  and civil servant.  

Maker Playhouse was born from a simple need, where to take our families to have clean, safe, family friendly fun. It has been our personal experience and research that most family fun centers leave much to be desired from. Un-kept areas, greasy food, and strong bodily odors are the norm. In most cases most “family fun centers” have very little in common for everyone in the family. This leads to many bored parents, at best and to mad and angry parents at worst.

When was the last time you went to a mainstream fun center to play in their "coin" machines and wondered, after 10-15 min,  "What the heck am I doing here? as you tried to keep your brain from running away- that is if the smell didn't kick you in the face as soon as you walked in. 

Fast forward in time and welcome Maker Playhouse. 

 

As parents we all work very hard and many times that means long hours. This means that the time we get to spend with our family and children is precious and valuable.  It is important that the time we do spend with our family is meaningful and fulfilling. Thus- Maker Playhouse’s goal is to create a unique family destination where we combine the wonder of discovery with the fun of play. Our vision is to bring families together through play and play teach.

Our mission is to create a wholesome family experience where families can come back again and again.

Maker Playhouse is transforming today’s family entertainment  center to feature state of the art STEM learning play areas, dynamic play equipment, obstacle adventures and maker education workshops in its own custom Maker Space.  In addition we are looking to enhance the parent experience by offering parent centric workshops geared towards learning more about STEM in general, while their children attend their own workshops.  

----------------------------------------

Who we are:

Mario Cuellar

 Executive, Coordinator and STEM Program Developer (Native Spanish Speaker )
~ A Strong Thinker and Visionary who has utilized hands-on education as a roadmap to academic success in his community. Developed and Pioneered new educational programs and resources for teachers and students alike. ~

Mario Cuellar has 8+ years of full-time experience in K-12 formal and Informal public programs education in major museums of the Bay Area including The California Academy of Sciences and The Tech Museum of Innovation. Recently he has worked, specifically, in after-school and expanded learning programs through the Federal 21st Century Community Learning Centers and California ASES grants. He has worked extensively at the school site, and district level at Ravenswood City School District in East Palo Alto. At Ravenswood he was the co-creator of the award winning “Ravenswood Maker space Initiative" and has since become the framework for all other STEM  Areas in local schools.

Ramiro Maldonado

Executive, Bridge maker, and Negotiator

Ramiro Maldonado was born and raised in Texas. He received his Master’s in Public Administration from the University of Texas and his BA in Political Science and General Business from the St. Mary’s University (San Antonio).  Ramiro always knew he wanted to support individuals in reaching their full potential, and has devoted his career to organizations that serve at-risk youths and individuals.  Ramiro has over 10 years experience working in nonprofit development within various organizations from Walden House and Huckleberry, and is currently Director of Development at Peninsula Conflict Resolution Center in San Mateo.

Funding:

What your funding will let us do is gauge and decide many important points:

  • The number of Maker Playhouses to open in our first year.
  • Where in the Bay Area it would be best need.
  • Show real world traction to our investors.
  • Create Value and choice to all those who will visit us.

The Impact

According to the Committee on Economic Development, the May 2016 jobs report indicated that there are currently 5.8 million job openings (CNNMONEY), which is a symptom of a growing problem in the US: employers can’t find skilled workers for jobs in a number of sectors. Much of this can be attributed to increasing disparity known as the job skills gap. This gap is a critical issue that the country faces as vacant jobs can cost companies hundreds of dollars a day in lost profits and can negatively drive America’s economic growth.

When we look at Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math (STEM) jobs specifically, economic projections point to a need for 1 million more STEM professionals than the US will produce at the current rate over the next decade, according to the President’s Council of Advisors on Science and Technology. STEM jobs alone have grown 17 percent, which is much faster than the nearly 10 percent growth rate in all other areas. Yet the civic infrastructure is not there to support this growth.

One of the most important factors that limits the United States’ ability to stay ahead of the STEM curve is the lack of introduction to these educational areas at an early age. More school districts are providing laptops as resources for their students. Laptops or iPads are great in terms of exposure to technology and a step in the right direction.  However, the use of this technology is not enough to meet the future workplace skills that students need.

This is not the fault of teachers who hope to positively impact the lives of their students through more effective learning tools. Teachers continue to do their job, but education has not embraced the notion of teaching students about technology itself. Students use technology as consumers, but not as innovative developers through their formal education experience.  The need for this at an institutional level is increasingly important, and schools simply do not have sufficient time, flexibility, or resources to offer these types of curricula.

Looking at countries that are leading the way in technological innovation, we find students spend a greater amount of time in education outside of school – traditionally in a tutoring or enrichment capacity. The amount of time that a student spends weekly on their  educational enrichment activities is significantly greater around the world compared to the US. This may be associated with a cultural influence which is directly correlated to the rising importance of education needs in different industries, but can also be attributed to increased importance placed on science and technology solutions provided to students.

In the United States we are in the midst of a STEM revolution. STEM is at the forefront of educators and policymakers around the country. This is now also becoming increasingly important among parents as they begin to see the paradigm shift in the economy that continues to favor individuals seeking STEM jobs versus their counterparts.

STEM is finally being integrated in schools, but not early nor extensively enough. 38 percent of students who start college with a STEM major do not graduate with one, which is reflected by the fact that 69 percent of high school graduates are not prepared for college-level math or science, according to the National Math and Science Initiative. This is alarming and can be traced back to students not receiving the appropriate supports and interventions they need in early grades.

An increasing number of institutions are beginning to immerse students in STEM at younger ages. This exposure is being facilitated outside of school hours and during school vacations, which enables students to understand whether or not they are interested in further pursuing a particular STEM career. Institutions like Zaniac introduce students to skills like computer programming and 3-D printing as early as Kindergarten, and push the envelope through the eighth grade to teach more advanced subjects, such as thermodynamics, physics, orbital mechanics, and more. Such exposure helps promote students’ immersion in science and technology while building their confidence about STEM at a young age.

Creating a positive learning environment that empowers students in STEM is critical to preparing the next generation for the future. The current lack of infrastructure around this educational priority is disconcerting when we recognize the individual and economic benefits of addressing these issues. The necessity for STEM to be introduced at an early age has never been more important. Action needs to be taken on behalf of parents, educators, and business leaders to make sure this comes to fruition.

Risks & Challenges  

It is a challenge to keep pace with the rapidly decreasing technology innovation cycles in order to provide society the tools needed for security, healthcare, energy, water, and overall environmental sustainability. It is yet another challenge to ensure that quality of life standards are improved for an ever increasing world population that would otherwise remain marginalized in their basic societal needs. This reality requires that we drive STEM education toward more inclusive platforms that integrate: (1) inter-disciplinarity; (2) global mindset; (3) environmental awareness; (4) K-12 outreach; and (4) the active use of technology in education and professional development of educators to breach the generational gap between younger students and an older generation of educators, or what Marc Prensky calls the breach between digital natives and digital immigrants.

According to Prensky (2001), “our students have changed radically.Today’s students are no longer the people our educational system was designed to teach”.

Digital natives think and process information differently, and innovation in curricula must go beyond situating a course in a distance learning platform to a paradigm shift in the creation and transfer of knowledge itself.

In other words, we must think about this in strategic rather than tactical terms, and will require that colleges invest heavily in e-learning projects. Those scholars dedicated to researching technology and pedagogy have been talking about this phenomenon for over a decade, yet the progress made in e-learning in STEM curricula has been modest at best.

The recent onset of MOOCs (massive, online, open courses), a disruptive technology, may force higher education to make more dramatic changes with respect to learning paradigm. The MOOCs phenomenon is not only advancing the notion of open access and the democratization of knowledge, it is integrating a level of creativity in the conceptualization of learning that should help drive innovation in curricular content and delivery in higher-education in the next 2-3 years.

To summarize, organizations dedicated to STEM education should double their efforts in bringing awareness and instilling a sense of urgency with respect to how rapidly the world is changing. Our everyday life is becoming more globalized, and mono-disciplinary approaches are no longer able to provide solutions for the complexity of society’s problems. The role of science, technology and engineering in the development of human culture should be emphasized more in K-12 education, and we must create attractors to recruit more young people, especially women, into STEM careers.

All of these challenges must be supported by substantial, strategic investments in how we create and deliver knowledge to a new generation of digital natives that think and process knowledge differently than a traditionally older generation of educators.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Pass our information to your family, friends, co-workers and everyone you know.
  • Sign up for our newsletter.
  • Like us on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter.

When we look at Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math (STEM) jobs specifically, economic projections point to a need for 1 million more STEM professionals than the US will produce at the current rate over the next decade, according to the President’s Council of Advisors on Science and Technology. STEM jobs alone have grown 17 percent, which is much faster than the nearly 10 percent growth rate in all other areas. Yet the civic infrastructure is not there to support this growth.
One of the most important factors that limits the United States’ ability to stay ahead of the STEM curve is the lack of introduction to these educational areas at an early age. More school districts are providing laptops as resources for their students. Laptops or iPads are great in terms of exposure to technology and a step in the right direction.  However, the use of this technology is not enough to meet the future workplace skills that students need.
This is not the fault of teachers who hope to positively impact the lives of their students through more effective learning tools. Teachers continue to do their job, but education has not embraced the notion of teaching students about technology itself. Students use technology as consumers, but not as innovative developers through their formal education experience.  The need for this at an institutional level is increasingly important, and schools simply do not have sufficient time, flexibility, or resources to offer these types of curricula.
Looking at countries that are leading the way in technological innovation, we find students spend a greater amount of time in education outside of school – traditionally in a tutoring or enrichment capacity. The amount of time that a student spends weekly on their  educational enrichment activities is significantly greater around the world compared to the US. This may be associated with a cultural influence which is directly correlated to the rising importance of education needs in different industries, but can also be attributed to increased importance placed on science and technology solutions provided to students.
In the United States we are in the midst of a STEM revolution. STEM is at the forefront of educators and policymakers around the country. This is now also becoming increasingly important among parents as they begin to see the paradigm shift in the economy that continues to favor individuals seeking STEM jobs versus their counterparts.
STEM is finally being integrated in schools, but not early nor extensively enough. 38 percent of students who start college with a STEM major do not graduate with one, which is reflected by the fact that 69 percent of high school graduates are not prepared for college-level math or science, according to the National Math and Science Initiative. This is alarming and can be traced back to students not receiving the appropriate supports and interventions they need in early grades.
An increasing number of institutions are beginning to immerse students in STEM at younger ages. This exposure is being facilitated outside of school hours and during school vacations, which enables students to understand whether or not they are interested in further pursuing a particular STEM career. Institutions like Zaniac introduce students to skills like computer programming and 3-D printing as early as Kindergarten, and push the envelope through the eighth grade to teach more advanced subjects, such as thermodynamics, physics, orbital mechanics, and more. Such exposure helps promote students’ immersion in science and technology while building their confidence about STEM at a young age.
Creating a positive learning environment that empowers students in STEM is critical to preparing the next generation for the future. The current lack of infrastructure around this educational priority is disconcerting when we recognize the individual and economic benefits of addressing these issues. The necessity for STEM to be introduced at an early age has never been more important. Action needs to be taken on behalf of parents, educators, and business leaders to make sure this comes to fruition.

Risks & Challenges  
It is a challenge to keep pace with the rapidly decreasing technology innovation cycles in order to provide society the tools needed for security, healthcare, energy, water, and overall environmental sustainability. It is yet another challenge to ensure that quality of life standards are improved for an ever increasing world population that would otherwise remain marginalized in their basic societal needs. This reality requires that we drive STEM education toward more inclusive platforms that integrate: (1) inter-disciplinarity; (2) global mindset; (3) environmental awareness; (4) K-12 outreach; and (4) the active use of technology in education and professional development of educators to breach the generational gap between younger students and an older generation of educators, or what Marc Prensky calls the breach between digital natives and digital immigrants.
According to Prensky (2001), “our students have changed radically.Today’s students are no longer the people our educational system was designed to teach”.
Digital natives think and process information differently, and innovation in curricula must go beyond situating a course in a distance learning platform to a paradigm shift in the creation and transfer of knowledge itself.
In other words, we must think about this in strategic rather than tactical terms, and will require that colleges invest heavily in e-learning projects. Those scholars dedicated to researching technology and pedagogy have been talking about this phenomenon for over a decade, yet the progress made in e-learning in STEM curricula has been modest at best.
The recent onset of MOOCs (massive, online, open courses), a disruptive technology, may force higher education to make more dramatic changes with respect to learning paradigm. The MOOCs phenomenon is not only advancing the notion of open access and the democratization of knowledge, it is integrating a level of creativity in the conceptualization of learning that should help drive innovation in curricular content and delivery in higher-education in the next 2-3 years.
To summarize, organizations dedicated to STEM education should double their efforts in bringing awareness and instilling a sense of urgency with respect to how rapidly the world is changing. Our everyday life is becoming more globalized, and mono-disciplinary approaches are no longer able to provide solutions for the complexity of society’s problems. The role of science, technology and engineering in the development of human culture should be emphasized more in K-12 education, and we must create attractors to recruit more young people, especially women, into STEM careers.
All of these challenges must be supported by substantial, strategic investments in how we create and deliver knowledge to a new generation of digital natives that think and process knowledge differently than a traditionally older generation of educators.

Other Ways You Can Help

Pass our information to your family, friends, co-workers and everyone you know.
Sign up for our newsletter.
Like us on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter.

story:
The Book People Story

Through Book People, Ruth Erb has been sharing her passion for books with the Richmond community and the rest of the world for the past 37 years. Every day brings new opportunities to brighten customers' lives with the perfect book, a beautifully illustrated fairy tale for a young child, or a favorite novel which has been out of print for years.

Book People has something for everyone. Students find a wide selection of beautiful art books which even a starving artist can afford, and collectors find rare antiques. Book People gives the community an opportunity to meet local authors, and regularly hosts public fun events such as a monthly German Scrabble game.

As Ruth considers retirement, we want to ensure that Book People remains a community gathering spot where a passion for books continues to be shared. As Ruth would say, we want to be able to "stay in passion" for another 37 years.

We need your help to make Ruth's dream a reality. The minimum needed to renovate the shop is $50,000.

That money will be used for renovations, including:

  • Removing the original carpet and restoring the wood floors.
  • Making electrical improvements, especially improving the lighting!
  • New paint inside and out.
  • Restroom improvements.
  • Replacement shelving units (stronger ones)!
  • A sales counter
  • A point of sale system.
  • Underwriting operating expenses during the time the store is closed for renovations (see below) and bridging the first three to four months of operations when we reopen.

These improvements are really the bare minimum needed to keep our doors open, which is why your contribution is so greatly appreciated.

Indiegogo provides services to earn their cut: 8% of funds raised, 30 cents per contribution (includes platform and credit card fees), and cost of perks and shipping them to contributors.

Christmas shoppers looking for a meaningful gift that will benefit the community can donate to the campaign honoring a special someone. We will notify the honoree of the contribution made in their name. Then, if the campaign ends successfully, they will receive the contribution perk, like a ceramic mug or a T-shirt featuring the Book People Logo.

You can also help by spreading the word!

  • Use Indiegogo's share tools, use the hashtag (#bookpeoplerva) and tag us!
  • We're on Facebook @ Book People Richmond and on Twitter and Instagram @(bookpeoplerva).
  • Call your friends and family and tell them about the awesome perks they can receive for supporting independent book sellers and literacy. Then hound them relentlessly like a small child on a sugar rush who has to have that new book NOW!

 

A huge “Thank You!” for helping  keep Ruth's Passion alive!

Have more questions?

Just ask us at: bookpeople@mindspring.com

Or call us at 804.288.4346

story:
Bonjour, 

Je me nomme Sarah Philantrope. J'ai d'abord exercé à titre de professeur puis de directrice artistique dans un centre de loisirs à Montréal-Nord pendant quelques années, avant d'ouvrir mon entreprise en enseignement du théâtre et de la danse en 2007.
Aimant beaucoup la communauté de Montréal-Nord et soucieuse d'offrir un enseignement de qualité je m'efforce d'offrir des cours à la population en considérant leur budget. 
En fondant l'école Petits Pas j'avais le désir d'enseigner les arts de la scène aux enfants et adolescents dans un climat familial et amical. Notre école se veut différente car nous offrons des cours de théâtre et de danse où pour le spectacle annuel le tout est regroupé sous un même thème; la danse et le théâtre s'entremêlant au fil des scènes. J'ai à coeur d'offrir un endroit où les jeunes pourront se retrouver afin de partager des activités lucratives les menant à se dépasser et à être fier d'eux. 


Depuis quelques temps déjà nous regardons à améliorer la qualité de notre emplacement. Nous sommes rendu au point où il nous faut relocaliser nos locaux afin d'offrir un environnement plus sain aux élèves et professeurs.


L'argent amasser servira à mettre en place nos nouveaux studios:
- plancher de danse
- murs miroir
- divisions de l'emplacement
- climatisation
- enseigne extérieure
Toutes ces améliorations permettront à des jeunes de milieux moins favorisés d'aller de l'avant et de suivre leurs rêves.
Merci!

story:
Short Summary

BeBonobo connects people who have unused stuff with the people who need it in the same town or city. It provides individuals and businesses a free online platform to list unwanted and search for any types of wanted items. BeBonobo saves your money, reduces waste, saves resources from being exploited and greenifies the environment.

Use of Funds
The funds of $25,000 will be used for:
  • Android app development
  • Operational cost
  • Incorporation
  • Marketing campaigns

Other Ways You Can Help

Please, guys, if you really think that our project will be helpful to you and to the environment but you can't make direct contribution, then use Indiegogo share tools and share our campaign with your friends, so that there might be other people who could contribute if they know what we are doing.

story:
My name is John Teo. I am the founder and creator of the idea behind the Oasistlife Water System. My purpose for creating Oasistlife Water System with 10nm is to set a platform for a giving social enterprise which is what we are now. More than 750 million people in the world living without clean drinking water. I want to let everyone to use my technology and my platform to help them with not just immediate clean drinking water but also the better drinking water quality that anyone would want to have for themselves. Oasist Water System can produce  the best drinking water quality in a portable bottle with its (world first!) 10nm membrane.  Yes, the water quality has passed the WHO and the higher Singapore Water Quality Standards.

OUR CAUSE 

This 10nm pore size membrane ultrafiltration water bottle is created for disaster use but its well designed for daily use. This bottle is created as a clean water giving solution.  Clean virus free quality water is key for social betterment of the needy. I pre invested the bottle to this high standard (currently the old 10nm portable filtration bottle) so everyone can participate to change the lives of millions NOW!  This is because I see sufferings in people who are in dire need for clean drinking water are still suffering despite all good efforts by well meaning NGOs world wide. Many reasons for that but usually boils down to the following reasons:

  1. Well meaning clean water projects take too long to implement - suffering continues till projects implemented 
  2. Centralised water solutions neglected those in remote and inaccessible areas. 
  3. So many communities are considered "too small" an impact to require an effective solution despite the efforts of many small NGOs doing their best. 

Effective immediate solutions is the key! 

We can bring down the costs of each litre of drinking water to very low with excellent time to the needs of the people through our Oasist Water System Solution! And we are making it FREE to the needy in this project.


OASISTLIFE GIVING PROJECTS






OASIST SOLUTION

Best Solution : Collect + (Pump to Drink) with 10nm (0.01 micron) Ultrafiltration membrane Technology for THE RURAL AREA


With Oasist Water System, water is collected from any fresh water source and pump to drink immediately. No more contamination and instant implementation for the benefits of the needy.  Time constraint is removed and disaster and remote and inaccessible are able to get the water using our solution.



Our Team




PRODUCT SPECIFICATION



HOW OASIST WORK - Technology

Muddy water


Polluted water


Calligraphy Ink

 OUTDOOR ACTIVITIES 

YOUR DAILY USE


Help Us, and Help Yourself!

How it works: Simply log in to Indiegogo to get your personal tracking URL, then press the share buttons or share your unique URL (below the main video at the top of the page). Spread the word about us with your friends all over the Internet and you'll earn refunds quickly! You can even track your own progress by visiting your Indiegogo "My Profile" page and clicking on "Referrals."



Delivery Schedule



FREE eBook for our supporters

http://www.lulu.com/shop/john-teo/reflections-of-a-social-entrepreneur/ebook/product-22453773.html

story:
My friend Sebastian Ibanez wants to give the blind community a fair chance at dignified work in Mesa Arizona. Despite being born blind, and going deaf in one ear at age 11, Sebastian has never let his disabilities get in the way of his future. Sebastian is a college educated American citizen and father of three. His dream is to empower other disabled parents from disadvantaged communities in Arizona to find dignified work at in his fledgling small business selling brooms and mops. If you believe in the American dream, and that it can be realized by anyone in this country, here is your opportunity to make it a reality. Sebastian is raising $1000 to purchase additional products, empower new blind sales associates, and grow his business this winter.

For more information on Sebastian Ibanez check out his story on ABC15.

What we need and what you will receive

We are happy to take questions, and want to be transparent about the business.
Since June 2015, Sebastian has successfully sold 300 items a month at $10 each. Subtracting the overhead, Sebastian makes $2.50 per item sold.

He often builds cleaning kits for children himself, which have been some of his most popular products. Sebastian anticipates that with Halloween and the other holidays coming up, these products will do exceptionally well.  As such, your support will go towards purchasing the following:

300 x Miniature brooms ($1 dollar each)*
300 x Miniature mops ($1 dollar each)*
300 x Miniature dustpans ($1 dollar each)*
300 x Small buckets ($1 dollar each)*

*This figure includes transportation expenses.

Sebastian has already been able to save $200 for the holiday season, your support would help him to cover the remaining costs. With these additional resources Sebastian will be able to increase his sales during the holiday season, bring on additional blind sales associates, and expand his reach to new communities.

We will post weekly updates for the duration of this campaign, and send an update at the end of November so that you can see and learn about how you helped support Sebastian and the American dream. 

Campaign challenges and how you can support

Sebastian understands the risks and challenges of running a blind owned and operated small business. He hopes that he can count on your support, since it is vital to the continued survival of his business.

If you are unable to support Sebastian's campaign with a modest financial contribution, he hopes that you will share his families story with your community via email, or social media. This really helps him.

For more information on Sebastian Ibanez broom and mop sales, check out our videos:

En Espanol
in English (and spanish)

To contact Sebastian Ibanez directly please visit this page.

Thank you for your time and consideration, and for taking the time out of your busy day to support this campaign.

story:
Did you survive all that super "professional" video production?

Do you like robots?
Do you like drinks?
Do you like cool gadgets?
Do you like CNC machined aluminium?
Do you like a perfect anodized finish?
Do you like open source projects?
Do you like Indiegogo campaigns?

Of course you do!




State of the project

The hardware, electronics, and code are 90% developed, the only work remaining are small tweaks and improvements to the design related to easier assembly and code cleanup.


Finances

I've developed the Alkobot in my own spare time and with my own funds over the course of the last nine months, so it's only a matter of ordering raw materials and components rather than financing a development team.

However, production and purchases have to be made in bulk in order to make the project financially viable, thus the need for the Indiegogo campaign.


Project time table

Since development is 90% done as mentioned above, raw materials and component ordering will commence as soon as the funds arrive which happens two weeks after the campaign ends.

Production will begin as soon as the materials arrive and I manufacture CNC work holding fixtures for series production which will be completed before the end of December. Units will then be produced at the pace of 3 days per unit.

The six early bird units will be produced as the first batch and shipped out as soon as they are done in order to speed up early bird delivery.

All other units will be produced as a second batch, and shipped in bulk at the end of the production run.


Open source

I imagined Alkobot as an open source project so all design files will be released. Alkobot is powered by the powerful 96MHz Teensy 3.1, and the code is written in Arduino IDE with the TeensyDuino plug-in making it 100% Arduino compatible for very easy learning/hacking/modding.

The code will be released as soon as the campaign ends, while the detailed hardware drawings will be released three months after the campaign ends.


The 100$ perk

For those of you who want to contribute with a bigger donation, but can't quite stretch their wallet for the  main perk, I've prepared a special little something.

A RaspberryPi/BeagleBone case!

No more sliding around the desk, scratching of the woodwork and shorting of the bottom pins on a random screw rolling around. The case is CNC milled out of aluminum, anodized black, and equipped with stainless steel bolts, plastic PCB stand-offs and anti-slip rubber feet, as well as bolt holes for hard mounting. RaspberryPi board not included!


Risks and challenges

As someone who has spent eight years in large scale industrial production, I can tell you there is absolutely no limit to the amount of things that can go wrong, and cause unexpected delays.

Therefore no project can be 100% problem/delay free. That being said, this project falls in the category of extremely safe! Most crowdfunding problems come from two things.

The first is massive delays due to the fact that development always takes at least two times more than expected, and if the development is outsourced, this can even lead to failure to deliver the product.

To combat this issue, I chose to develop the Alkobot in my own spare time and with my own money not knowing whether or not anyone will be interested in the product. I did this specifically to spare you, the backer, the worry of never ending development delays.

The second is massive delays in production which is usually caused by various third party manufacturers, and potential hidden costs that cause the project to fail.

All Alkobots will be produced by me personally on my own CNC mill and hand assembled by me as well in order to keep the cost down and minimize the potential for unexpected delays and hidden costs as well as provide me with the ability to personally inspect 100% of the parts.

This will result in a much slower pace of production, but less chance for any unexpected problems, significantly lower cost as well as consistent quality.


About me

My name is Tibor, I'm 30 years old. My background and experience is in the field of mechanical engineering in which I spent the last eight years working as a production technologist for various medium and large companies. I also deal with electronics as a hobby that complements mechanics.

My dream was always to start up my own little "forge of tech and awesomeness" and become self employed by offering interesting and super hi quality tech gadgets as well as contributing to the world of open source knowledge.

By supporting this project you are helping out "the little guy" and directly contributing to that dream. And in return; getting an awesome product.

So let us work together!

Since
development is 90% done as mentioned above, raw materials and component ordering
will commence as soon as the funds arrive which happens two weeks after the campaign
ends.
Production
will begin as soon as the materials arrive and I manufacture CNC work holding fixtures for series production which will be completed before the end of December. Units will then be produced at the pace of 3 days per
unit. The six early bird units will be produced as the first batch and shipped out
as soon as they are done in order to speed up early bird delivery.All other
units will be produced as a second batch, and shipped in bulk at the end of the production run.Open source
I imagined
Alkobot as an open source project so all design files will be released. Alkobot
is powered by the powerful 96MHz Teensy 3.1, and the code is written in Arduino IDE
with the TeensyDuino plug-in making it 100% Arduino compatible for very easy learning/hacking/modding.
The code
will be released as soon as the campaign ends, while the detailed hardware
drawings will be released three months after the campaign ends.The 100$ perkFor those of you who want to contribute with a bigger donation, but can't quite stretch their wallet for the  main perk, I've prepared a special little something. A RaspberryPi/BeagleBone case!No more sliding around the desk, scratching of the woodwork and shorting of the bottom pins on a random screw rolling around. The case is CNC milled out of aluminum, anodized black, and equipped with stainless steel bolts, plastic PCB stand-offs and anti-slip rubber feet, as well as bolt holes for hard mounting. RaspberryPi board not included!Risks and challenges
As someone
who has spent eight years in large scale industrial production, I can tell you
there is absolutely no limit to the amount of things that can go wrong, and
cause unexpected delays.
Therefore no
project can be 100% problem/delay free. That being said, this project falls in
the category of extremely safe! Most crowdfunding problems come from two
things.
The first
is massive delays due to the fact that development always takes at least two
times more than expected, and if the development is outsourced, this can even lead to failure to deliver the product.To combat this issue, I chose to develop the
Alkobot in my own spare time and with my own money not knowing whether or not
anyone will be interested in the product. I did this specifically to spare you,
the backer, the worry of never ending development delays.
The second
is massive delays in production which is usually caused by various third party
manufacturers, and potential hidden costs that cause the project to fail.All Alkobots will be produced by me personally on my own CNC
mill and hand assembled by me as well in order to
keep the cost down and minimize the potential for unexpected delays and hidden costs as well as
provide me with the ability to personally inspect 100% of the parts.
This will
result in a much slower pace of production, but less chance for any unexpected
problems, significantly lower cost as well as consistent quality.About me
My name is Tibor, I'm 30 years old. My
background and experience is in the field of mechanical engineering in which I
spent the last eight years working as a production technologist for various
medium and large companies. I also deal with electronics as a hobby that
complements mechanics. 
My dream was always to start up my own
little "forge of tech and awesomeness" and become self employed by offering interesting and super hi quality tech gadgets as well as contributing to the world of open source knowledge. By supporting this project you are helping out "the little guy" and directly contributing to that dream. And in return; getting an awesome product.So let us work together!

story:
Short Summary

Since visiting my first Civil War battlefield as a child, I’ve had a life-long passion to study and learn as much about the Civil War as possible. From visiting battlefields, to joining local Civil War reenacting groups, graduating with a degree in History, and working at State and Federal Civil War battlefield parks – I’ve dedicated my life to the study and interpretation of the Civil War. 

Now, I’ve decided to follow my dream and open my own Civil War tour business in the only city I want to live in – New Orleans.

There is no other city in this country like New Orleans, with its history and culture. But, many people don’t know the city has a rich Civil War history as well.  Therefore, it is my goal to create a scholarly, passionate, educational, and fun tour business that will tell the story of New Orleans during the Civil War.

I have risked it all by moving to New Orleans to follow my dreams, and with your help I can open to the public.


What We Need & What You Get

I need $60,000 to pay for a tour vehicle, insurance, and fees. I have already covered start-up fees, supplies, and equipment, but I am still in need of additional funding.  Insurance alone costs nearly $10,000 per year. A tour van will cost close to $50,000, or more.  This funding campaign will also help fund annual expenses like advertising, promotional material, etc.


The Impact

In 2013, 9.3 million tourists visited New Orleans. Of that 9.3 million, 77% of them visited for pleasure and leisure. In 2014, more than 1 million visitors came to New Orleans through the cruise industry alone. New Orleans Convention and Visitors Bureau has predicted these numbers will increase over the next five years. There is no shortage of tour options in New Orleans, and tourism is the top industry in the city. However, none of them promote the history of New Orleans during the Civil War.

American Civil War history is a very popular and divisive topic, even 150 years after its conclusion. Today, close to 500 books are published every year on topics that deal with the Civil War. Families make a point to visit Civil War sites, like Gettysburg, as part of their family vacation every year. There will be a popular interest in Civil War Tours of New Orleans.

When people visit New Orleans, they come to have fun and experience this amazing city. Whether they chose to take a tour of a swamp, take a walking tour of the French Quarter, or a double-decker bus tour, people visit New Orleans because they are interested in learning about this intriguing city. Civil War Tours of New Orleans will offer something brand new – offer visitors the chance to see sites and locations that pertain to this country’s Civil War and hear the stories of how this conflict affected the city of New Orleans.

As for me, the passion that I have for the Civil War and for speaking on the subject will only enhance the success of Civil War Tours of New Orleans. I have more than a decade of working experience as a historical interpreter, tour guide, historian, and museum professional.  Civil War Tours of New Orleans is a decade-long passion to enrich this amazing city and promote the region’s rich Civil War history.


Risks & Challenges 

New Orleans has no shortage of tour options. The biggest challenge will be gaining visitors’ attention and letting them know that this business is here for them. There are a few tour companies in New Orleans that dominate the market, while the small tour business operators are left to fight for a share of the market and pay the costs and fees imposed upon them by the city annually.

However, unlike other tour companies with multiple staff and vehicles, Civil War Tours of New Orleans is a one-man operation, with very little overhead besides the expenses imposed by the city. With your help, if the financial goal of this crowd funding campaign is met or surpassed, it will provide this business with enough first-year, start-up capital to sustain itself while growing the business. Your investment into Civil War Tours of New Orleans will not be in vain.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please help by sharing this campaign with all of your friends and family. Civil War Tours of New Orleans is the culmination of more than 30 years of study and passion for me, and risking it all for the sake of the American dream is what this is all about. I ask that you please help in any way that you can.


Thank you.


Nic Clark

Owner, Civil War Tours of New Orleans, L.L.C.
