story:
Short Summary

Hi, My name is Cody and I've had a goal to create a company that fixes computers at a low cost and at a fast time! I've had this goal since I was 14, but never could do it due to me not being able to get a job or just getting the materials needed for the Company. We use to have a Website for this Company but no longer do due to not being able to pay for it.

  • I live in a small home right now with a 1 year old Husky!
  • The Company will Fix computers the right way Fast!
  • Build Custom Computers to your specifications!
  • Contributors will help get the Business running!

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need two or three Laptops for Fixing/Testing!
  • We need tools/programs to fix the problems or make the Dream Computer you want.
  • The perks that you get are 5 Free Fixes on your Computer/Laptop or Family's!
  • The Fund will still go to the business to help start it off no matter what!

The Impact

  • This Project is Valuable, because it will save people money trying to fix there computer and they won't even have to wait a long time!
  • We also want to help those who can't ship/bring to us by going to them and fixing it at there house.
  • If someone can't go to the store or doesn't want someone to know they are building them a Dream Computer, then we will do it for them at the lowest Price Possible.
  • This company Will Save people money and time.

Risks & Challenges

  • Some Risk we might come along are our computers breaking down, can't find the solution to the problem your computer has, or Can't Build the Computer for some reason.
  • To solve these problems we going to have backup computers/laptops, taking courses on every computer problems course there is to have knowledge in every background of Computers, and we will always build the computer to your specifications even if it's impossible we will find a way.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help :)

  • If you can't donate that is okay! You can still help by Spreading the Word about our Campaign :)
  • Don't forget you can use the Indiegogo share tools!

I see many opportunities for this Company, but I need your help to get it started and running. 

- Thanks, Cody.

story:
This is a Story About Us.

Female executives, business owners and women in leadership around the world are making change like never before. And this is a story about "them", all the girls around the world wanting education, human rights, health and the ability to direct their lives.  But it's really a story about them becoming US.

E The Magazine for Today's Female Executive knows how important it is to share resources, support and education to women around the world. Both in large corporate enviroments to micro business start ups allowing women to support their families.

Each month E Magazine brings business, management, technnology,global issues, women's health, lifestyle and much more to female executives and business owners. 

With your support, we at E Magazine, can launch our social media campaign putting  us in front of millions of women both nationwide and globally. Contribute for as little as $5 it will make a difference. 


This permits us to share critical information on: Education, Women's Rights, Human Rights, Health Issues, Management Tools, Business Resources and Executive Coaching 


By making this information free and available to women around the world, we are empowering them. Many women would never have access to this collection and quality of  information-any other way. 

What We Need & What You Get

E magazine needs increased circulation to accomplish all of the above. 


Your support will help us make that goal.you can start with as little as $5.00 up to a really big number. We have perks for every level. Our perks include:

  • Get Free advertising dollars for your event, new book, speaking engagement etc...
  • Get free advertising dollars (doubled) and social media exposure for your business
  • Get free advertising for your Non profit organiation or perfessional organization which will help them continue to gain membership and support.
  • get the word out about your conference in 2015 become a partner and win double advertising dollars. 
  • More fantastic gifts and rewards.


The Impact

Support E magazine because you believe there should be more women in the boardroom, on the trading floor and on the floor of Congress. Support this campaign because we have wonderful incentives and perks. 

  • Individual perks, 
  • Business perks,
  • organizational perks and 
  • Conference perks.  

For every dollar you give in support we will provide double advertising exposure in the magazine. This is a very powerful tool if your organizarion needs to market all year round-let us help you get there. We can help you offer gifts to your supporters while blasting your information through social media.

story:
You can donate as little as $1, but $10+ would be better :)

WHO ARE WE?

Kevin Stone is a Chartered Surveyor with over 30 years’ experience in property.

He has always focused on helping people, concentrating his professional life over the past ten (10) years on community stakeholders such as schools, aged care, local authorities etc.

During the Australian floods of 2010-2012 he witnessed and was directly involved in disaster relief and damage assessment and was deeply moved by the suffering he saw.

Paul Burtwistle is a Sales & Marketing professional in the IT industry with 20 years experience covering both systems design and sales. Paul also experienced the Australian floods while working alongside Kevin and has been central to encouraging the establishment of FloodPal™ as well as improving its design through several iterations.

The company is a joint venture between Kevin Stone and Paul Burtwistle.

FloodPal™ Pty Ltd trading as (“FloodPal™”) has been incorporated in the State of Queensland, with two Directors.

FloodPal™ has a registered office in Brisbane Queensland and is registered as an Australian business (ACN 165 359 937).

FloodPal™ is registered for GST, and operates on a Cash accounting basis.

It is anticipated that local manufacture and distribution will be established in separate countries, creating local jobs etc.

IT’S PERSONAL

Kevin and Paul through their professional exposure to and involvement in the management of flood after effects witnessed the emotional, practical and financial difficulties that victims of flooding experienced in numerous communities and realised any form of help to those affected would be greatly appreciated.

Flooding does not respect social standing, personal or business interests. It simply wipes away peoples belongings and business tools leading to a long period of suffering and in many situations, limited recovery.

It was clearly evident that recovery of the most basic needs of life such as cooking, furniture, washing etc. were taken away for extended periods. Even if these belongings were insured, it still took months to get replacements due to the increased demand resulting from the flooding.

We want people to be able to return to normal as soon as possible.

While assessing damage in a flood affected town in 2012 a local coffee shop owner said:

“If only I could have opened up the day after the floods cleared, I could have supported the emergency services with free food and drinks. Then I could be back earning a living. As it is, I will not be able to reopen, I am out of work now. How do I support my family?”

WE CAN HELP PEOPLE EVERYWHERE. Even if you can’t contribute, please spread our campaign as far and wide as possible, friends, local papers, TV, councillors, MP’s, Senators etc. be DIRECT, be PERSONAL. Please remember that FloodPal is a product that was designed to help people in circumstances that have proved to be disastrous in the past. 

If you want to help but can’t afford to on your own, why not club together with your friends and support us jointly, $1 each goes a long way.

IT’s A WORLD PROBLEM…..AND YOU CAN HELP

Everyone has seen the devastating effects of flooding to communities on the TV, the internet and many will have firsthand knowledge or know friends and relatives who have been affected.

Flooding is becoming an increasing problem and even in the last few years these events have occurred around the world:

•  2010-12 Australian Floods

•  2011 Mississippi River Floods

•  2012 Japan and the UK experienced flooding

•  2013 Italy, Colorado and China were affected

•  2014 Several Western European countries were inundated

•  2014 New York and Alberta suffered

We have all watched media coverage as children, families and small businesses lost everything, but we never saw what happened afterwards. The months of struggle, living on charity, despair, frustration. Families ‘’camping’’ in their own gardens cooking on gas stoves for months on end. We have literally hundreds of examples of stories like this from flood affected families and businesses.

How would YOU cope if your bed, furniture, fridge etc. was missing for months on end?

In recent floods even those who had insurance waited months as supplies of local replacements ran out and could not be restocked quickly. Insurance companies dragged out agreeing on settlements, causing more suffering and incovienience while families were displaced. Today premiums for flood insurance have skyrocketed which just causes another problem for families in flood prone areas!

FloodPal™ is simple, effective and CAN help everyone at risk of flooding.

WHAT WE NEED

We are asking for assistance in funding the manufacture and testing of four (4) full sized prototypes as the last stage in our development before going to market, and require a minimum of $60,000 AU.

Each individually hand-made prototype will cost approximately $6,000 (commercial manufacturing costs will be substantially lower).

Testing in full-sized tanks with real furniture, white goods etc. will cost around $20,000 excluding any improvements identified.

Additionally, $10,000 will be allocated to the development of the secure protective packaging and user instructions.

Finally, $6,000 will be required to run consumer test scenarios to identify any usability issues.

WHATS IN IT FOR YOU?

So what do you get by helping us?

You get to help 100,000’s of flood victims around the world each year.

Your local community will benefit.

But let’s be more personal….. depending on your level of donation, we offer the following in return:

DONATION

  BENEFIT

$10-50

SUPPORTER

·  Monthly update email.

·  Name publically used as a supporter.

·  Entry into draw to attend a formal launch in Sydney, Australia (5 Places).

$51 -100

BRONZE STATUS

·  Monthly update email.

·  Name publically used as a supporter.

·  Entry into draw to attend a formal launch in Sydney, Australia (5 Places).

·  10% discount off the price of a FloodPal™ – transferable to whoever you want.

$101 -200

SILVER STATUS

·  Monthly update email.

·  Name publically used as a supporter.

·  Entry into draw to attend formal launch in Sydney, Australia (5 Places).

·  15% discount off the price of a FloodPal™ – transferable to whoever you want.

$201 – 500

GOLD STATUS

·  Monthly update email.

·  Name publically used as a supporter.

·  Entry into draw to attend formal launch in Sydney, Australia (5 Places).

·  25% discount off the price of a FloodPal™ – transferable to whoever you want.

$501+

PLATINUM  STATUS

·  Monthly update email.

·  Name publically used as a supporter.

·  Entry into draw to attend formal launch in Sydney, Australia (5 Places).

·  40% discount off the price of a FloodPal™ – transferable to whoever you want

·  Preferential share price should we issue any within the first five (5) years of trading.

If we fail to reach our funding goal, we will endeavour to fill the shortfall directly and negotiate costs down where possible.

Should we fail to secure sufficient funds to progress with the prototype, we will invite ALL donators to vote on a pre-selected list of charities that we should donate the funds to (we will use/take none of your donations).

WHAT DIFFERENCE CAN WE MAKE

2010-12 Australian Floods

Declared a Natural Disaster, and the motivation behind FloodPal, these floods forced the evacuation of thousands of people from towns and cities. At least 70 towns and over 200,000 people were affected.

•  11,900 homes and 2,500 businesses were completely flooded

•  14,700 homes and 2,500 businesses were partially flooded

According to the Insurance Council of Australia, almost 56,200 claims were received by insurers, with an insured cost of $2.55 billion. While some insurers once offered cover for riverine flood, many currently do not, something that many policyholders discover to their cost after the floods.

Flooding cannot be stopped once it has been identified as being imminent.

Thus individuals, families and commercial operators face several possibilities:

•  Remove all belongings and stock to a safe location for the duration of the event if possible.

•  Leave belongings and stock in place, accepting the loss (direct and consequential) and inconvenience.

•  Protect belongings and stock from damage – sandbag property; move to a higher floor etc.

The first option is seldom available, plus it relies on the assumption that the home owner is physically able to remove their belongings and also has a safe place to store them above flood levels.

The second option relies on the availability of insurance cover, which is becoming increasingly difficult to secure at an affordable rate. If and when insurance accepts a claim, supply of replacement goods within a reasonable timescale is generally an issue.

Finally, trying to prevent flood waters entering the property or moving items to a higher level (if available) is not very successful on a small, localised scale. (June 2013 – Hungary had limited success with floodwalls on a large scale in central city areas only).

THE FLOODPAL™ SOLUTION

The basic idea of FloodPal™ was developed to provide protection to personal belongings, white goods and commercial equipment during times of flood. This will assist in limiting the immediate living and financial impact to families/businesses by avoiding the need for replacement of damaged goods. This will also assist in families and businesses quickly returning to normal following a flood event.

The simplest idea was to provide a strong waterproof bag that could be utilised to store goods, but this idea proved difficult to use and was subject to movement due to the force of water currents which places the goods inside at risk of damage. Examples of these basic products already exist but are considered unsatisfactory in comparison with FloodPal™.

After several iterations of design,we now have a system that creates a 'waterproof room' within an existing building, requiring no additional anchoring  and that is simple to set up on your own.

This self-supporting, self-anchoring, pressure regulating waterproof enclosure for residential, commercial and industrial use provides a temporary secure and waterproof area to store goods.

Individuals and businesses that will benefit are:

•  Previously flooded properties.

•  Properties in ‘at risk’ areas as identified by either local authorities or insurance companies

•  Commercial premises in flood prone areas.

•  Government agencies with offices or Infrastructure in flood prone areas.

•  Insurance providers – wishing to mitigate risk exposure and poor public perception.

•  Mining companies with expensive equipment at risk from flooding.

•  Armed services who need to transport equipment over water.

FloodPal will help people worldwide, but initially our focus is within Australia with the intention to expanding to the USA and Europe ASAP. Indeed, we may find partners through Indiegogo who could accelerate this global expansion……

WHY SHOULD YOU SUPPORT US?

This is a completely reasonable question, why donate your hard earned money to such a simple idea?

We want to help people and with your help we can make a difference. You may already live in an area at risk of flooding, or know someone who is.

Remember, we are NOT driven entirely by profit, but the desire to HELP people.

We know that weather patterns are changing and floods are becoming more frequent and destructive. Eventually, sea level rise could lead to coastal and river flooding.

Floods cannot be prevented, but the impact on people can be reduced. We can help people and business return to a more normal life quicker, with less loss and stress.

We cannot protect entire buildings, but historical data shows that in most flood situations, damage to buildings is low/moderate and can be economically repaired. However, belongings and electrical goods are needed immediately after a flood. Electricity is normally reconnected very quickly (the FloodPal™ can protect a generator if required), people can live in and work in buildings waiting for superficial repairs if they have the basics of life.

FloodPal is designed for this scenario

Think of a few ways FloodPal™ could protect you:

•  A school library could protect its books etc.

•  Small business can protect equipment and stock.

•  A medical centre can protect equipment and records.

•  A householder can save their furniture etc.

•  Protecting disaster relief supplies etc.

The list of uses is almost endless.

GET THE WORD OUT AND MAKE SOME NOISE ABOUT US!

If you are unable to contribute, please spread our campaign as far and wide as possible, friends, local papers, TV, councillors, MP’s, Senators etc. Use all social media for us

Use the Indiegogo share tools…….NOW

LET’S GO VIRAL!
story_txt:
You can donate as little as $1, but $10+ would be better :)WHO ARE WE?Kevin Stone is a Chartered Surveyor with over 30 years’
experience in property. 
He has always focused on helping people, concentrating his
professional life over the past ten (10) years on community stakeholders such as
schools, aged care, local authorities etc.
During the Australian floods of 2010-2012 he witnessed and
was directly involved in disaster relief and damage assessment and was deeply
moved by the suffering he saw.
Paul Burtwistle is a Sales & Marketing professional in the IT industry with 20 years experience covering both systems design and sales. Paul also
experienced the Australian floods while working alongside Kevin and has been central to
encouraging the establishment of FloodPal™ as well as improving its design through several iterations.
The company is a joint venture between Kevin Stone and Paul
Burtwistle.
FloodPal™ Pty Ltd trading as (“FloodPal™”) has been incorporated
in the State of Queensland, with two Directors.
FloodPal™ has a registered office in Brisbane Queensland and
is registered as an Australian business (ACN 165 359 937).
FloodPal™ is registered for GST, and operates on a Cash
accounting basis.
It is anticipated that local manufacture and distribution will
be established in separate countries, creating local jobs etc.
IT’S PERSONAL
Kevin and Paul through their professional exposure to and
involvement in the management of flood after effects witnessed the emotional,
practical and financial difficulties that victims of flooding experienced in
numerous communities and realised any form of help to those affected would be
greatly appreciated.
Flooding does not respect social standing, personal or
business interests. It simply wipes away peoples belongings and business tools
leading to a long period of suffering and in many situations, limited recovery.
It was clearly evident that recovery of the most basic needs
of life such as cooking, furniture, washing etc. were taken away for extended
periods. Even if these belongings were insured, it still took months to get
replacements due to the increased demand resulting from the flooding.
We want people to be able to return to normal as soon as
possible.
While assessing damage in a flood affected town in 2012 a local coffee shop
owner said:
“If only I could have opened up the day
after the floods cleared, I could have supported the emergency services with
free food and drinks. Then I could be back earning a living. As it is, I will
not be able to reopen, I am out of work now. How do I support my family?”
WE CAN HELP PEOPLE
EVERYWHERE. Even if you can’t contribute, please spread our campaign as far
and wide as possible, friends, local papers, TV, councillors, MP’s, Senators
etc. be DIRECT, be PERSONAL. Please remember that FloodPal is a product that was designed to help people in circumstances that have proved to be disastrous in the past. If you want to help but can’t afford to on your own, why not
club together with your friends and support us jointly, $1 each goes a long way.
IT’s A WORLD
PROBLEM…..AND YOU CAN HELP
Everyone has seen the devastating effects of flooding to
communities on the TV, the internet and many will have firsthand knowledge or know
friends and relatives who have been affected.
Flooding is becoming an increasing problem and even in the last few years these events have occurred around the
world:
• 
2010-12 Australian Floods
• 
2011 Mississippi River Floods
• 
2012 Japan and the UK experienced flooding
• 
2013 Italy, Colorado and China were affected
• 
2014 Several Western European countries were inundated
• 
2014 New York and Alberta suffered
We have all watched media coverage as children, families and
small businesses lost everything, but we never saw what happened afterwards. The
months of struggle, living on charity, despair, frustration. Families
‘’camping’’ in their own gardens cooking on gas stoves for months on end. We have literally hundreds of examples of stories like this from flood affected families and businesses.
How would YOU cope if your bed, furniture, fridge etc. was
missing for months on end?
In recent floods even those who had insurance waited months as supplies
of local replacements ran out and could not be restocked quickly. Insurance companies
dragged out agreeing on settlements, causing more suffering and incovienience while families were displaced. Today premiums for
flood insurance have skyrocketed which just causes another problem for families in flood prone areas!
FloodPal™ is simple, effective and CAN help everyone at risk
of flooding.
WHAT WE NEED
We are asking for assistance in funding the manufacture and
testing of four (4) full sized prototypes as the last stage in our development
before going to market, and require a minimum of $60,000 AU.
Each individually hand-made prototype will cost
approximately $6,000 (commercial manufacturing costs will be substantially
lower).
Testing in full-sized tanks with real furniture, white goods
etc. will cost around $20,000 excluding any improvements identified.
Additionally, $10,000 will be allocated to the development
of the secure protective packaging and user instructions.
Finally, $6,000 will be required to run consumer test
scenarios to identify any usability issues.
WHATS IN IT FOR YOU?
So what do you get by helping us?
You get to help 100,000’s of flood victims around the world each year.
Your local community will benefit.
But let’s be more personal….. depending on your level of
donation, we offer the following in return:



DONATION 


  BENEFIT




$10-50
SUPPORTER


· 
  Monthly update email.
· 
  Name publically used as a supporter.
· 
  Entry into draw to attend a formal launch in
  Sydney, Australia (5 Places).




$51 -100
BRONZE STATUS


· 
  Monthly update email.
· 
  Name publically used as a supporter.
· 
  Entry into draw to attend a formal launch in
  Sydney, Australia (5 Places).
·  10% discount off the price of a FloodPal™ –
  transferable to whoever you want.




$101 -200
SILVER STATUS


· 
  Monthly update email.
· 
  Name publically used as a supporter.
· 
  Entry into draw to attend formal launch in
  Sydney, Australia (5 Places).
· 
  15% discount off the price of a FloodPal™ –
  transferable to whoever you want.




$201 – 500
GOLD STATUS


· 
  Monthly update email.
· 
  Name publically used as a supporter.
· 
  Entry into draw to attend formal launch in
  Sydney, Australia (5 Places).
·  25% discount off the price of a FloodPal™ –
  transferable to whoever you want.




$501+
PLATINUM  STATUS


· 
  Monthly update email.
· 
  Name publically used as a supporter.
· 
  Entry into draw to attend formal launch in
  Sydney, Australia (5 Places).
·  40% discount off the price of a FloodPal™ –
  transferable to whoever you want
· 
  Preferential share price should we issue any
  within the first five (5) years of trading.


If we fail to reach our funding goal, we will endeavour to
fill the shortfall directly and negotiate costs down where possible.
Should we fail to secure sufficient funds to progress with
the prototype, we will invite ALL donators to vote on a pre-selected list of
charities that we should donate the funds to (we will use/take none of your
donations).
WHAT DIFFERENCE CAN
WE MAKE
2010-12 Australian
Floods 
Declared a Natural Disaster, and the motivation behind FloodPal, these floods forced the
evacuation of thousands of people from towns and cities. At least 70 towns and
over 200,000 people were affected.
•  11,900
homes and 2,500 businesses were completely flooded
•  14,700
homes and 2,500 businesses were partially flooded
According to the Insurance Council of Australia, almost
56,200 claims were received by insurers, with an insured cost of $2.55 billion.
While some insurers once offered cover for riverine flood, many currently do
not, something that many policyholders discover to their cost after the
floods.
Flooding cannot be stopped once it has been identified as
being imminent.
Thus individuals, families and commercial operators face
several possibilities:
•  Remove
all belongings and stock to a safe location for the duration of the event if
possible.
•  Leave
belongings and stock in place, accepting the loss (direct and consequential)
and inconvenience.
•  Protect
belongings and stock from damage – sandbag property; move to a higher floor
etc.
The first option is seldom available, plus it relies on the
assumption that the home owner is physically able to remove their belongings
and also has a safe place to store them above flood levels. 
The second option relies on the availability of insurance
cover, which is becoming increasingly difficult to secure at an affordable
rate. If and when insurance accepts a claim, supply of replacement goods within a reasonable timescale is generally an issue.
Finally, trying to prevent flood waters entering the
property or moving items to a higher level (if available) is not very
successful on a small, localised scale. (June 2013 – Hungary had limited success with floodwalls on a large scale in central city areas only).
THE FLOODPAL™
SOLUTION
The basic idea of FloodPal™ was developed to provide
protection to personal belongings, white goods and commercial equipment during
times of flood. This will assist in limiting the immediate living and financial impact to
families/businesses by avoiding the need for replacement of damaged goods.
This will also assist in families and businesses quickly returning to normal following a flood
event.
The simplest idea was to provide a strong waterproof bag
that could be utilised to store goods, but this idea proved difficult to use
and was subject to movement due to the force of water currents which places the
goods inside at risk of damage. Examples of these basic products already exist but are considered
unsatisfactory in comparison with FloodPal™.
After several iterations of design,we now have a system that creates a 'waterproof room' within an existing building, requiring no additional anchoring  and that is simple to set up on your own.
This self-supporting, self-anchoring, pressure regulating waterproof
enclosure for residential, commercial and industrial use provides a temporary
secure and waterproof area to store goods.
Individuals and businesses that will benefit are:
• 
Previously flooded properties.
• 
Properties in ‘at risk’ areas as identified by either local authorities or insurance companies
• 
Commercial premises in flood prone areas.
• 
Government agencies with offices or
Infrastructure in flood prone areas.
• 
Insurance providers – wishing to mitigate risk
exposure and poor public perception.• 
Mining companies with expensive equipment at risk from flooding.• 
Armed services who need to transport equipment over water.
FloodPal will help people worldwide, but initially our focus is
within Australia with the intention to expanding to the USA and Europe ASAP. Indeed, we may
find partners through Indiegogo who could accelerate this global expansion……
WHY SHOULD YOU
SUPPORT US?
This is a completely reasonable question, why donate your
hard earned money to such a simple idea?
We want to help people and with your help we can make a
difference. You may already live in an area at risk of flooding, or know
someone who is.
Remember, we are NOT
driven entirely by profit, but the desire to HELP
people.
We know that weather patterns are changing and floods are
becoming more frequent and destructive. Eventually, sea level rise could lead
to coastal and river flooding.
Floods cannot be prevented, but the impact on people can be
reduced. We can help people and business return to a more normal life quicker,
with less loss and stress.
We cannot protect entire buildings, but historical data shows that in most flood situations, damage to buildings is low/moderate and can be economically repaired. However, belongings and electrical goods are needed immediately after a
flood. Electricity is normally reconnected very quickly (the FloodPal™ can
protect a generator if required), people can live in and work in buildings waiting
for superficial repairs if they have the basics of life.FloodPal is designed for this scenario
Think of a few ways FloodPal™ could protect you:
• 
A school library could protect its books etc.
• 
Small business can protect equipment and stock.
• 
A medical centre can protect equipment and
records.
• 
A householder can save their furniture etc.
•  Protecting disaster relief supplies etc.
The list of uses is almost endless.
GET THE WORD OUT AND
MAKE SOME NOISE ABOUT US!
If you are unable to contribute, please spread our campaign
as far and wide as possible, friends, local papers, TV, councillors, MP’s,
Senators etc. Use all social media for us
Use the Indiegogo share tools…….NOW
LET’S GO VIRAL!

story:
Who am I?

Hey everyone! My name is Gina Graveline and I'm 28 years old, originally from Bangor Maine, but I've been living in NYC for over ten years. I've been working in the service industry for seven years now and hospitality and food are my passions in life. I love cooking and love even more to share my food with others. I graduated with a bachelors in business administration, concentration in small business and entreprenuership, in order to pursue my dream of owning my own food truck.  I have launched this campaign in order to raise more funds needed to get my food truck started. My menu is small but packs a serious punch when it comes to flavor and originality. I want to bring a Maine flare using fresh lobster to the street fare food of New York, such as lobster sliders and lobster tacos. I am very confident in my endeavor and can guarantee that people will enjoy everything that my truck has to offer. I have been working very hard over the past few years and have been saving as much money as possible, but I have not been able to produce the necessary funds needed to get started. That's where you come in! 

What I Need & What You Get

I am looking to raise $80,000 dollars which will cover the cost of the food truck as well as all of my beginning inventory and marketing costs. As we all know lobster is not a cheap commodity and the price of it fluctuates depending on the season so I have estimated the dollar amount needed in order to get through my first few months. I am looking to purchase a new truck which can range anywhere from $50,000 to $150,000 dollars. The particular truck I am interested in is roughly $68,000. I will also need to make some modifications both appliance wise and aesthetically wise which will be a least another $5,000 dollars. The estimated costs for beginning inventory is $3,000 dollars which will be enough to support the business for a few months. Marketing costs are estimated at $2,500 dollars which includes the cost for website development. 
In order to show my appreciation for the help I recieve there will be a customer loyalty program in which, depending on how much money is donated, will provide many perks such as free food from the truck or even the opportunity to have an item on the menu temporarily named after you! The perks available are listed on the right hand side of the campaign. Even if my goal is not reached all of the funds raised will go towards the purchase of the truck which is the most important aspect of my campaign. 

Your Impact

Not only will this food truck fulfill my dreams but I hope that in the future I will be able to expand, resulting in new jobs for my fellow New Yorkers. The food truck industry is no walk in the park and takes a lot of hard work and dedication, however I would love to share this experience with other people who have the same passions as myself. I also know for a fact that food is an amazing way to allow people to connect. My goal is to bring people together through my food concept while also allowing everyone to get a genuine expeirience of the food that I grew up loving so much. If you are a true foodie such as myself then you understand how important food can be for people. Putting a smile on someone's face because they enjoy my food is something that is defintley priceless.

Low on Cash....Don't Worry! 

Even if you can't donate any money, word of mouth can be more powerful than anything and it would be greatly apppreciated if everyone could spread the word about my campaign and my food truck in general. Please share my campaign with anyone you know that has an appretiation for food and who would be interested in being a part of my journey. If you can post my campaign page link through all the social media outlets that you use it would be an enormous aid. The Indiegogo share tools are super easy and make it possible for everyone to share my campaign with the world. Everyone involved in this project should know that they are involved in something that is very special in my heart and my appreciation for your help is beyond what words can express. Thank you everyone for your help and let's get this started!!

story:
Short Summary.

Today, many Chicago neighborhoods are overrun with violent crime.  As a real estate investment expert and a psychologist, I recognize the effects the physical environment is having on the psychology of generations of kids growing up amid violence and abandoned buildings.  Research shows us the vicious cycle of despair initiated by scarcity.  Scarcity of financial resources, scarcity of opportunity to get ahead or get out, scarcity of feelings of safety, and the scarcity of connection to a strong family or community all perpetuate hopelessness.

I need your help to break this cycle of despair.

Research confirms what you might guess about the beneficial outcomes from promoting a positive identity and community and instilling a sense of belonging and safety to youths.  This can be done by bringing opportunity to my Chicago neighbors most in need. 

Using my real estate network, I identified a 5-acre parcel of private land we will use to establish a first of its kind Urban Farming Institute (UFI).  With your help, we will transform the community through opportunity.

I am counseled by farming experts at the University of Illinois who are helping to develop farming operations to meet the unique challenges of an urban environment and a small site.  Together we'll also design coursework that promotes urban farming as a career path for students and the residents of the neighborhoods that will host farm sites.  UFI will be part classroom and part business venture.

Neighbors will staff the farm.  Opportunities exist for both volunteer and paid positions in operations, sales, administrative and community outreach.  I also propose a profit-sharing within the community as a means of building a cooperative relationship based on mutual benefits as opposed to handouts.

Contributions to UFI will be used to:

  1. Reduce violent crime
  2. Bring financial and educational opportunities to neighborhoods that have been ignored or forgotten,
  3. Increase the type and amount of locally-grown organic produce available for retail purchase and restaurants in Chicago,
  4. Find new ways to promote a sustainable urban existence.

Community Engagement

For UFI, community is key.  Born out of both formal and informal meetings, the idea of an urban farm in Chicago’s greater Engelwood community is something that neighbors embrace.  In response to our recent survey* of 400 residents of greater Englewood:

·  68% support an urban farm in their neighborhood.

·  76% believe an urban farm would have a positive impact on children and residents.

·  61% said that they would consider working at a local an urban farm.

·  65% said that they are likely to participate in free classes or are interested in starting a food based business with the help of an urban farm.

·  Cleaning up vacant land ranked as the second-highest priority of Neighborhood Needs.

UFI has a dedicated team of volunteers committed to community outreach.  Both formal and informal networks provide us the means to have a conversation and accept community input into our planning and operations.  What we found was that there is pent up energy for explosive positive change in many communities.  We believe UFI can be the catalyst for those improvement efforts.

We opened a toll-free community hotline (888-977-2251) that allows neighbors to leave us feedback and their ideas.  Our website (www.urbanfarmchicago) has a chat board and community forum space for all of us to hear and discuss good ideas.  While we can’t be all things to all people, we want the community to help us build an organization that will do the most good for our neighbors.

* Survey conducted by Compass Consulting, LLC, November 12, 2014.  Thanks for the donation!


Crowd-funding.  This is where your money goes...

UFI needs seed funds of $181,818.  That is what our budget calls for down to the last dollar.  This money will be used for site selection and rehabilitation, construction of a greenhouse and classroom, farming tools both manual and automated, administrative things like printers and phones, security features, seeds and plants, operational staff and educators, water bills, permits and legal fees, and marketing materials.

And, we want you to be a part of the ribbon cutting when we are ready to open in Spring of 2015!

If we do not reach our goal, then the money will be used to do as much as we can to reach our objectives.  Smaller site, no greenhouse, etc..

Crowd-solving.  This is where your ideas come in...

We obviously believe in the power of the group.  We are smart enough that we don't know everything, and that's where you come in.  UFI will be unlike any other urban farming project because we want to be the innovation proving grounds for all other urban farming.  If you have good ideas, new technology, an invention you want to test, bring it over.  Once we are set up, we hope to be able to fund research and provide open-source solutions to the urban farming community.

The Impact.

Even the short-term benefits have long term effects.  UFI jobs and educational opportunities provide an immediate benefit to those who join with us as employees and students.  Risk-behavior research I conducted suggests that a paycheck for a day’s work is the best motivator to avoid destructive behaviors.  Developmental psychology tells us that learning new skills builds confidence in one’s abilities.  The opportunities UFI brings to neighborhoods that have not seen much love lately will re-ignite the flame of self-reliance that was dampened by crime, abandoned buildings and hopelessness.  With your help, we can break the cycle of despair that grips many in Chicago’s toughest communities.

The immediate short term environmental impact is great as well.  We will turn abandoned property and land, which harbors crime, and poses significant health risks, into a living breathing sustainable organic farm, capable of feeding hundreds of Chicago families and restaurants.  Gone will be the artifacts of neglect, replaced with literal green shoots of progress and promise for the future of the community.

Long term, transforming communities means transforming the culture as well.  UFI is a first-step in transforming community identity from one of despair to one of prosperity.  Nothing builds success like success because insiders see the change and begin to identify themselves as part of it.  Outsiders in turn want to be part of it and are motivated to change as well.

With the backing of the world-class agricultural program at U of I, we also aim to change the way Americans see the “farm”.  To most city-dwellers, farms are far off places where cows and chickens roam and where trucks pick up food to deliver it to chain grocers.  We want to change that by inventing a way for small farmettes to be sustainable both environmentally and economically.  There is no reason why future community planning should not include open space for urban farming, just like it includes retail and residential space.  Together we will transform city living 3.5 acres at a time.

A Commitment to Organic Farming, Renewables, and Doing Things Right.

As a prototype urban farm, we are committed to getting it right.  Our partners at the U of I are as committed to finding answers to sustainability within the urban setting. Science and technology will be our guides.  We know climate change is happening; we know carbon emissions are a major cause; we know pesticides are harmful; we know people need to eat better; we know that to be successful we need to demonstrate that doing the right thing can be profitable.  That's why we will be testing and inventing the future best practices for urban farming.  We don't want to just do it, we want to do it Better.

A Commitment to the 10X Principle.

We are committed to providing employment opportunities at fair wages.  Our understanding of "fair" means that no one in the organization will ever make more than ten times anyone else.  When the tide rises, it carries all ships, and so will this enterprise.  If there are ever executives at U-Fin, they won't ever make more than ten times what the new guy makes.  We believe in balance, dignity, and respect for all those who contribute to the team.  If one person deserves a raise, then the team deserves a raise.  We understand this seems rEvoultionary and it's not for everyone; but it is for everyone at U-Fin.

Risks & Challenges.

Earning the support of the City of Chicago and U of I gives us quite a leg-up on the project, but challenges still exist.    

Knowing what we know about psychology, business, real estate and farming, we believe the plan is well-founded and leaves room for the necessary tweaks to overcome any obstacles and achieve our objectives.

Other Ways You Can Help.

Volunteers and non-cash donations are welcome!  We can use elbow grease and leg work for all kinds of glamorous and behind the scenes planning and doing.  We also need tools and know-how to get things done.  If you have time, skills, tools, land, equipment, etc. you would like to contribute, please let us know.

We also need bright legal minds willing to provide more than advice.  There will be challenges that need your expertise to overcome.  Zoning changes, contracts, and employment/corporate law are just a few areas that you can make an impact.

If you work at a restaurant or grocery store, we need your help too.  We want to provide your place of business with the finest quality organics, grown locally.  We can help you build differentiation for your business as one that supports sustainable farming and the local community.  We are proud to display and advertise your business along side our brand in a our marketing and community outreach.

Something else you can think of?  We are trying to change the world, and we could use your help.

Sponsors and Partners

So far we have dozens of restaurants and grocery stores interested in buying our produce and products.  Please consider contacting us to have your business added to our Sponsors and Partners list today.

Thank you to our most recent sponsors:

      www.charaoakpark.com

    

    Robbins Food Mart        13844 S Claire Blvd. Robbins, IL


      www.distortiondesign.com


     www.compasscma.com

 

              Blossoming Point Acupuncture


        AMP Photography


      www.toytrainmall.com


        www.zrental.net

priority of Neighborhood Needs.
UFI has a dedicated team of volunteers committed to
community outreach.  Both formal and
informal networks provide us the means to have a conversation and accept community
input into our planning and operations.  What we found was that there is pent up energy for explosive positive change in many communities.  We believe UFI can be the catalyst for those improvement efforts.We opened a toll-free community hotline (888-977-2251) that allows
neighbors to leave us feedback and their ideas.  Our website (www.urbanfarmchicago) has a chat board and community forum space for
all of us to hear and discuss good ideas. 
While we can’t be all things to all people, we want the community to
help us build an organization that will do the most good for our neighbors.

* Survey
conducted by Compass Consulting, LLC, November 12, 2014.  Thanks for the donation!
Crowd-funding.  This is where your money goes...
UFI needs seed funds
of $181,818.  That is what our budget calls for down to the last dollar.  This money will be used for
site selection and rehabilitation, construction of a greenhouse and classroom,
farming tools both manual and automated, administrative things like printers
and phones, security features, seeds and plants, operational staff and
educators, water bills, permits and legal fees, and marketing materials.
And, we want you to be
a part of the ribbon cutting when we are ready to open in Spring of 2015!
If we do not reach our
goal, then the money will be used to do as much as we can to reach our
objectives.  Smaller site, no greenhouse,
etc..
Crowd-solving.  This is where your ideas come in...We obviously believe in the power of the group.  We are smart enough that we don't know everything, and that's where you come in.  UFI will be unlike any other urban farming project because we want to be the innovation proving grounds for all other urban farming.  If you have good ideas, new technology, an invention you want to test, bring it over.  Once we are set up, we hope to be able to fund research and provide open-source solutions to the urban farming community.The Impact.Even the short-term benefits
have long term effects.  UFI jobs and
educational opportunities provide an immediate benefit to those who join with
us as employees and students.  Risk-behavior
research I conducted suggests that a paycheck for a day’s work is the best
motivator to avoid destructive behaviors. 
Developmental psychology tells us that learning new skills builds
confidence in one’s abilities.  The
opportunities UFI brings to neighborhoods that have not seen much love lately
will re-ignite the flame of self-reliance that was dampened by crime, abandoned
buildings and hopelessness.  With your
help, we can break the cycle of despair that grips many in Chicago’s toughest
communities.
The immediate short
term environmental impact is great as well. 
We will turn abandoned property and land, which harbors crime, and poses
significant health risks, into a living breathing sustainable organic farm,
capable of feeding hundreds of Chicago families and restaurants.  Gone will be the artifacts of neglect,
replaced with literal green shoots of progress and promise for the future of
the community.
Long term,
transforming communities means transforming the culture as well.  UFI is a first-step in transforming
community identity from one of despair to one of prosperity.  Nothing builds success like success because
insiders see the change and begin to identify themselves as part of it.  Outsiders in turn want to be part of it and
are motivated to change as well.
With the backing of
the world-class agricultural program at U of I, we also aim to change the way
Americans see the “farm”.  To most
city-dwellers, farms are far off places where cows and chickens roam and where
trucks pick up food to deliver it to chain grocers.  We want to change that by inventing a way for
small farmettes to be sustainable both environmentally and economically.  There is no reason why future community
planning should not include open space for urban farming, just like it includes
retail and residential space.  Together
we will transform city living 3.5 acres at a time.
A Commitment to Organic Farming, Renewables, and Doing Things Right.As a prototype urban farm, we are committed to getting it right.  Our partners at the U of I are as committed to finding answers to sustainability within the urban setting. Science and technology will be our guides.  We know climate change is happening; we know carbon emissions are a major cause; we know pesticides are harmful; we know people need to eat better; we know that to be successful we need to demonstrate that doing the right thing can be profitable.  That's why we will be testing and inventing the future best practices for urban farming.  We don't want to just do it, we want to do it Better.A Commitment to the 10X Principle.We are committed to providing employment opportunities at fair wages.  Our understanding of "fair" means that no one in the organization will ever make more than ten times anyone else.  When the tide rises, it carries all ships, and so will this enterprise.  If there are ever executives at U-Fin, they won't ever make more than ten times what the new guy makes.  We believe in balance, dignity, and respect for all those who contribute to the team.  If one person deserves a raise, then the team deserves a raise.  We understand this seems rEvoultionary and it's not for everyone; but it is for everyone at U-Fin.Risks & Challenges.Earning the support of
the City of Chicago and U of I gives us quite a leg-up on the project, but
challenges still exist.     
Knowing what we know
about psychology, business, real estate and farming, we believe the plan is
well-founded and leaves room for the necessary tweaks to overcome any obstacles
and achieve our objectives.Other Ways You Can Help.
Volunteers and non-cash donations are
welcome!  We can use elbow grease and leg
work for all kinds of glamorous and behind the scenes planning and doing.  We also need tools and know-how to get things done.  If you have time, skills, tools, land, equipment, etc. you would like to
contribute, please let us know. We also need bright legal minds willing to provide more than advice.  There will be challenges that need your expertise to overcome.  Zoning changes, contracts, and employment/corporate law are just a few areas that you can make an impact.If you work at a restaurant or grocery store, we need your help too.  We want to provide your place of business with the finest quality organics, grown locally.  We can help you build differentiation for your business as one that supports sustainable farming and the local community.  We are proud to display and advertise your business along side our brand in a our marketing and community outreach.Something else you can think of?  We are
trying to change the world, and we could use your help.Sponsors and PartnersSo far we have dozens of restaurants and grocery stores interested in buying our produce and products.  Please consider contacting us to have your business added to our Sponsors and Partners list today.Thank you to our most recent sponsors:      www.charaoakpark.com         Robbins Food Mart        13844 S Claire Blvd. Robbins, IL      www.distortiondesign.com
     www.compasscma.com               Blossoming Point Acupuncture
                AMP Photography      www.toytrainmall.com        www.zrental.net

story:
Short Summary

Art can be seen here: http://zulhsado.wix.com/peaceeverlasting

This is a campaign for love. 

The funding from this campaign will be used to finish the repair on my jaw (also known as a 'Grill') that was fractured three years ago when I was mugged. Thankfully, the only things that died were my 3 front teeth, although I did almost lose my soul. In technical terms I am a victim of a violent crime. In my terms I am a victor: I totally won the lottery. As someone who has been following the work of community psychologists who are out to impact life for those with violently acquired spinal chord injuries (VASCI- mainly caused by gun shot wounds) I am SO clear the guys could have used their guns a different way and I would not be so fortunate to be typing this right now.

Strange as it may be, it has been more confronting for me to share about this event than to have lived & grown through it. I have resisted talking about any of this since it first happened. Not only do I avoid attention on me, but I’ve been sick of dealing with other people’s hateful and violent responses towards the strangers' initial act of violence, as well as fielding questions about what part of town this happened in, so that the people asking could make it mean something about that neighborhood or what ethnicity were the two people so they could judge and stereotype that particular ethnic group. It has been just recently that I have been opening up and sharing little by little.  

A typical response I’ve seen is to get pissed off at the guys who did this. I could almost always count on a response wishing more violent acts to be done to the guys. THIS IS NOT WHAT I WANT TO BE SPENDING MY TIME TALKING ABOUT. I want to create, not react with violence in retribution to violence.

This is a campaign for reviving life.

What I Need & What You Get

For three years I have been pre-occupied with juggling my recovery & finances, while amazing opportunities keep knocking on my door. I am ready to move forward & let it rip!

This campaign is for $3,000. I have $7,008 dollars to pay off before I can move on to the final stretch of completing my smile! This is 2k down from “Let Me Z Your Grill” campaign in June!!! (Gracias, Merci, Danka, Speciba, Grazie, THANK YOU).

Broken down (pun intended): 

Anesthesia

$1220

Extraction

$325

Bone Graft

$1775

IV’s

$238

Implant

$2200

Tissue Graft

$750

Oral Surgical Splint

$500

Remaining work includes: 

an Abutment; temp teeth to shape my gums; and 2 crowns (because I'm super fly).

Perks for you: SWAG!
How this works is, you will visit the website that I published displaying all the different brilliant pieces of art that has been donated to sell. 

One of the things I did in designing this campaign was call my ex-boyfriend. Yes, I called my ex and asked him if he'd be interested in contributing by donating his mom's jewelry. This is to say, it not only took forgiving the two guys and their crew, but also reconciling with my ex and what we went through together in dealing with this. He was there with me that night and it was very bitter sweet as I was going through slight amnesia and asked him to tell me what we did that day (I didn't remember anything including why we needed to go to the hospital; I actually have no recollection of this story- this is what he told me had happened.) He then asked if I knew who he was, which happened to be the only thing I was certain of, and responded yeah, you're kevin and I love you. Then a couple years later we broke up, and here we are now. So treat yo'self to something sweet from the Shanny Shop! [When selecting swag from the Shanny Shop please include the item#]

Other options include bling for your walls. I have arranged a striking collection of paintings by two great artists with very different styles, one of whom is my father!

These paintings are breathtaking. Take a look on the website and in your swag selection include the number [painting #]

http://zulhsado.wix.com/peaceeverlasting

The Impact

Here's the scoop: Aside from the physical repair of my jaw, the intention of this campaign is to inspire a resolution of conflicts at different levels in any part of the world. The opportunity this has been for me is to forgive all the violence in my life, especially the stuff that has happened in my own family. This also includes forgiving: Governmental oppression, police brutality, those with opposing opinions and expectations regarding social justice, youths shooting other youths, the church for allowing their leaders to not practice what they preach, the use of war, exploitation, and colonialism. 

I'm talking about forgiveness as a choice- in any moment, for absolutely no reason, and after any consideration. It's absolutely not saying I condone the behavior, or I accept/tolerate/or am willing to put up with it. I'm not, and I'm also not willing to allow myself to remain resentful. That ain't for me. My first and second name mean 'Peace Everlasting' and that's what I'm for. Whatever it takes.

When I first got out of the hospital and continued with my plans to move to Arizona for a graduate program in community counseling, I organized a fundraiser with participation from my friends, co-workers and family and it absolutely ruled. Then earlier this summer my friends put together another collection that got me a reservation for my final consultations and impressions (not the funny kind done by comedians) to start the final stages of completing this work. Now THIS is all that's left!!! My dentist and surgeon are set: wax teeth models are made, bone is ready, aim, fire away...

Risks & Challenges

Part of the importance of completing the work as soon as possible is to maintain the bone & tissue graft that were already placed, to keep the teeth in their current position, and to shape the gums back to a natural convex curve. This will be done with temporary teeth, and although there is risk of the temps cracking I am very well practiced in declining a chicago style hot dog, or passing on corn on the cob (elotes), or even biting into an apple (my biggest weakness). I have SO many recipes to liquify all my meals!

Another challenge is knowing that violence isn't going to go away in its totality. My commitment is to remain firm about creating a possibility of peace, and not merely altering the circumstance and existence of violence, which ultimately will not make the difference. I have an awesome team supporting me and engaging in this creation with me!

Other Ways You Can Help

One major way to support this campaign without contributing money is to share the website with your community and especially anyone interested in art. Have your business buy art, have your grandma buy art, have you neighbor buy art, have your boss lady buy art, have your bar or tavern buy art, have your dentist office buy art. 
Another way to support me is with professional/legal coaching as I appeal the State Attorney General's decision on my Crime Victim's Compensation application.

story:
Hey everybody! 

We are the Purdue Social Justice Coalition, or PSJC for short. We are comprised of students and community members who volunteer our time to make the university and city-wide community more progressive and accountable to social justice issues regionally, nationally and internationally. We work on a grassroots level to create change and we especially welcome creative ideas and methods of collective activism. BUT MOST OF ALL, WE ARE A NETWORK AND A MEANS OF COMMUNICATION FOR ALL PROGRESSIVE GROUPS ON CAMPUS AND IN THE COMMUNITY.

Check out what we our Doing: https://www.facebook.com/purduesocialjusticecoalition

& our Voices: http://the1advocate.wordpress.com/

Why You should fund US!

Because we are standing together to fight against all forms of oppression and bigotry - from racism, homophobia, and sexism, to attacks on the working class. We also stand in solidarity with struggles against oppression internationally (such as the movement for a free Palestine). Oppression is a collective social issue. Recognizing the connections between racial and ethnic identities, gender, sexuality, and social economic status can help us understand how we identify with and combat oppression.

Our Coalition has already been thriving during its short existence having been featured in The Exponent and Fox 59. We have also contributed to our community through several projects we have already successfully pulled off, including open mics, bringing 'Out of Shadows' speakers to campus, confronting police brutality at local forums, and our general engagement in a variety of events highlighted on our social media platform. Though our most significant contribution has been our ability, as a coalition, to work with already established student and community organizations and to bring them together in addressing social justice issues. 

We have designed our coalition to be the glue that binds individuals from all walks of life and organizations into a bond strong enough to put our Words Into Action and bring change to our communities. 

We have worked hard to sustain our efforts by working creatively with those organizations. However, we now ask you to help us to maximize our efforts. 


What We need from YOU & What YOU get!

Here's a breakdown of what I will be using your contributions for:

  • Equipment and/or rentals: Camera, mic & amp, audiovisual cables, mixer, bullhorn, extensions, and storage cases.

  • Promotional materials: Posters, flyers, informational brochures, banner, and paints. 

  • Travel Expenses to local conferences and workshops

Perks!

Those who donate just a bit more will get one of the following perks:

  • You will get a shout out on our Facebook page with a $5 donation.
  • For $10, we thank you for helping us make an impact with a free PSJC button and Facebook shout out.
  • For $25, you will be helping push forward our campaign and you will get a free PSJC t-shirt, PSJC button, and Facebook shout out.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, that doesn’t mean you can’t help! 

Here are other ways:

  • Help us get the word out. Tell your friends and family about our campaign. Word of mouth will help more than you know!
  • Indiegogo has easy sharing tools as well! Don't hesitate to Tweet, Facebook, Youtube or post it on your website!

story:
Hi! I am appealing to you for the funds to get to Africa! More specifically, I am trying to get to Ghana with a group that's going this summer for education and exposure to our roots. 

Who am "I" exactly?  My name is RAHKUA and I am a creative artist living in Los Angeles, who is passionate about music, health, education, social justice, and LIFE! 

What am I doing?  Well, I'm raising funds to go on this Africa trip with Professors James Smalls and Leonard Jefferies….and it's Project Africa: LOS ANGELES because I've also set up a contact in Chicago similarly putting together a group of artists with the same aim for Project Africa: CHICAGO. Think of it almost like the Birthrite Israel program…we want the opportunity to get back to our roots, to experience a cultural immersion and connect with our history. At the same time, we'll be offering our artistic minds and talents…except that we don’t have a group of affluent, socially and culturally conscious millionaires to fund us like Birthrite Israel...So we are extending our appeal to the people! (And hopefully one of those affluent millionaires finds our page haha).

YOUR help is what will make this trip possible. 

Let's talk numbers….and PERKS!

  • I need to raise $5,000.  That may sound like a lot (especially if you don't have it!) BUT it's is SO doable with YOUR help. $3,500 will cover the travel package in Ghana and the other $1,500 will go towards expenses like passports, air fare to the meet location (New York), travel insurance, per diem while in Africa, and the great perks! So that's a minimum of $5,000 as the base goal and of course it'd be AMAZING to raise more to allow for a buffer.
  • There are some pretty awesome PERKS! From speaking to you personally in a 30 min live chat about the trip (and anything else you might want to know) to a DVD of the epic concert we're throwing, to Project Africa merchandise etc, we are rolling out great THANK YOU perks to our donors…LIKE YOU!
  • YOUR GIFTS CAN BE TAX DEDUCTIBLE!  Project Africa is being sponsored by the 501 c3 status non-profit organization, TIFHAP, in line with it's mission to support the arts and education. (Please consult your financial advisor to determine if your gift is deductible).
  • IF the goal isn't met…NO…we're speaking positive energy into this campaign, we WILL make it! (But IF not THIS year, then on next year's voyage) 

The Impact

It's hard for some people to imagine leaving their neighborhood, city, or state….let alone their country and continent! We are embarking on a very ambitious journey that will impact the REST OF OUR LIVES.  It's crazy to think that just a $25 donation from you could impact someone's entire life, but it's SO true. And not only will WE get the benefit of the amazing experience, and YOU get the benefit of great gifts and feelings of gratitude, but also the Ghanaian people will get an amazing concert and we'll hopefully be establishing some lifelong connections and changing lives through interpersonal interaction and CARE.

Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE! RETWEET! LIKE! REPOST! REGRAM! EMAIL! CALL PEOPLE! ETC. ETC.

 

There are SO many ways that you can help. I understand not everyone will be able to give a monetary donation (and that some donors would love to extend their help beyond the funds) so can't stress enough how important non-monetary donations are as well. Because your TIME and FAITH in this cause is just as valuable. 

So please… SPREAD THE WORD! 


IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO BE A SPONSOR please email:

ProjectAfricaLA@gmail.com

So that's a minimum of $5,000 as the base goal and of course it'd be AMAZING to raise more to allow for a buffer. There are some pretty awesome PERKS! From speaking to you personally in a 30 min live chat about the trip (and anything else you might want to know) to a DVD of the epic concert we're throwing, to Project Africa merchandise etc, we are rolling out great THANK YOU perks to our donors…LIKE YOU!

YOUR GIFTS CAN BE TAX DEDUCTIBLE!  Project Africa is being sponsored by the 501 c3 status non-profit organization, TIFHAP, in line with it's mission to support the arts and education. (Please consult your financial advisor to determine if your gift is deductible). IF the goal isn't met…NO…we're speaking positive energy into this campaign, we WILL make it! (But IF not THIS year, then on next year's voyage)     The Impact



 It's hard for some people to imagine leaving their neighborhood, city, or state….let alone their country and continent! We are embarking on a very ambitious journey that will impact the REST OF OUR LIVES.  It's crazy to think that just a $25 donation from you could impact someone's entire life, but it's SO true. And not only will WE get the benefit of the amazing experience, and YOU get the benefit of great gifts and feelings of gratitude, but also the Ghanaian people will get an amazing concert and we'll hopefully be establishing some lifelong connections and changing lives through interpersonal interaction and CARE.

    Other Ways You Can Help SHARE! RETWEET! LIKE! REPOST! REGRAM! EMAIL! CALL PEOPLE! ETC. ETC.

 
There are SO many ways that you can help. I understand not everyone will be able to give a monetary donation (and that some donors would love to extend their help beyond the funds) so can't stress enough how important non-monetary donations are as well. Because your TIME and FAITH in this cause is just as valuable. 
So please… SPREAD THE WORD! 

IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO BE A SPONSOR please email:
ProjectAfricaLA@gmail.com

story:
Since 2010, major investments of more than $20,000 have been made in vine growing, testing, winemaking and research on the North Shore terroir. Innovation and Development Manicouagan has supported our project in 2012 and 2013. In 2014, Ms. Gaelle Dubé provided technical supports regarding the research work and establishment of the vineyard. She is a member of Quebec’s Order of Agronomists, holds a Bachelor degree in Agronomy from Laval University and a certificate in higher agricultural technician (option viticulture and oenology) from Lycée Petrarch in Avignon in France. More than forty species have been tested in the field and others are in progress. The sampling field has more than eight hundred vines. Thousand of hours have been spent ​​in research to find the right varieties for our climate. A good grape maturity with potential alcohol levels of 10 to 13% alc/vol, with good acidity ranging between 3.2 and 3.6 ph, good flavors and good resistance to cold temperature allow us to target the first cultivars. . Further results are expected, from different cultivars, which will ensure to improve the quality of our products years after years. Your investment will directly serve the start, implementation and investment in planting Domaine Côte du Nord. The first important step is the purchase of the lands. After comes the building of a greenhouse and preparation of the land to welcome new vines (land clearing, falsetto, plowing, amendment and lime, planting, installation of poles, lines and support train the vines’ fruiting). It takes at least 3 years before the first modest harvest. The latter is scheduled for autumn 2017 and the plants at full capacity in 2019-2020. The grape found in grocery stores (blue, green and red) will be the basis of the vineyard’s start. These discoveries for transforming our future wines will be introduced in part this year and next year. The first vintage is scheduled for 2019 (white and rosé), Cabernet Severnji Madeleine Sylvaner, Pinot Noir, Baltica.

The terroir

The geographical location of the municipality of Ragueneau is an ideal choice. Along the Outardes river, away from the St-Laurent river and North’s winds, and drained soil properties, the location offers us a proper microclimate. Although our territory is considered as difficult, there are several advantages with which we work. The development of Phase I of the project is estimated at $150 000.


The purpose

In 8 or 10 years, we will have built an exceptional vineyards in North Shore. We will produce high quality table grapes, fresh, fruity and juicy. We will have diversified products, 100% local. White, rosé, red and passerillé  offering quality that will make the pride of the North Shore. The products will be available from Tadoussac, passing by Sacré-Coeur, to Blanc-Sablon. They will closely represent our attachment to our land, so vast and diverse.

Starting such a project will also benefit the North Shore by stimulating the entrepreuneurship and pushing the agricultural development in the area of small fruit and, eventually, the transformation here. Our company is committed to the environment and believes in a diversified agriculture that promotes local and regional economy.

story:
What is Rumah Sanur?

Rumah Sanur is a shared-space that acts as a creative hub and home for social entrepreneurs and creative professionals located in beautiful Sanur, Bali.

Rumah Sanur will offer a workspace and meeting area that is well designed, trendy, comfortable, and inspiring. It will be a venue for design-centric events, seminars, and workshops for the local and international communities. It will have a café that serves locally grown coffee and a concept store where local artists, designers and craftspeople can sell their wares. Most importantly, it will be home to a “creative eco-system”.

This means Rumah Sanur will be a place for creative individuals to be inspired with innovative ideas, expand upon those ideas by actively collaborating with others and bring those ideas to life. 


What We Need & What You Get

While Rumah Sanur has a basic monthly income from renting out space to our partners including Kumpul Coworking. This is not nearly enough to fulfill our vision of a building creative ecosystem and certainly not enough to run the programs that will help local social entrepreneurs jump start their businesses. Here are some the programs we're hoping to build:


Small Business Incubator

The Small Business Incubator will work to improve the skills of knowledge of young entrepreneurs who are beginners in developing a business.


Digital Learning Hub

The Digital Learning Hub (DLH) will assist students, recent graduates and Bali's creative community in acquiring the skills and knowledge needed to grow the digital sector on the island. Existing local businesses will be able support the hub with course material and mentors . Potential programs within the DLH are:

  • DIGITAL ECOSYSTEM FOR BUSINESS
  • MAXIMIZING SOCIAL MEDIA FOR BUSINESS
  • USER EXPERIENCE DESIGN
  • APPS DESIGN

Collaborate to Compete

Local entrepreneurs will collaborate with designers to enhance their products and business models. The program will selectively choose participants by submission and invitation, and will take place in both a classroom and studio workshop environments. The subjects covered will range from capacity building to product development to commercial enterprise.


Where your contributions go:

70% of the total raised will go towards the creating and running of programs we've already mentioned. The remaining 30% will go towards making sure our creative ecosystem has a comfortable place to grow and thrive, in other words, general maintenance, monthly bills and staff salaries. 


The Purpose

The purpose of Rumah Sanur is to act as an accelerator for the local economy and to ignite a connected society through providing a meaningful space that acts as a hub of education, interaction, and collaboration. Our goals are to:

  • Facilitate the growth of creative and social entrepreneurship in Sanur, across Bali, and throughout Indonesia.
  • Work to connect entrepreneurs (and their businesses) with the wider community.
  • Enrich the local economy by providing educational programs, financial assistance, mentoring and networking opportunities to local entrepreneurs.
  • Give local entrepreneurs the tools with which to compete in the global economy.




Risks & Challenges

While we are certainly planning on being fiscally responsible and financially sustainable, we're also looking for institutional partnerships and community engagement to reach our full potential. This can be challenging for organizations like Rumah Sanur that are just getting off the ground. We're already working hard to build these relationships, but as Rumah Sanur gets off the ground, your support will be a vital to fulfilling our potential!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't support us financially that doesn't mean you can't help us build Rumah Sanur. Here are some other ways you can contribute:

  • Join our creative ecosystem! We're working to build a global network of social entrepreneurs and creative individuals so reach out to us with your skills and 
  • Spread the word about Rumah Sanur! Share our campaign, like our Facebook page and follow us on Twitter and Instagram.
  • Stay tuned to this space for more updates!

You're always welcome...

Finally, we at Rumah Sanur want to invite you to visit us any time. Mention that you contributed to our campaign and you are sure to get a warm welcome and be treated to some delicious Indonesian coffee or a cool Bintang!

story:
Short Summary

The Moore Hair Salon LLC is an ADA accessible salon that caters to people with disabilities. The products are ADA approved items such as styling stations, hair dryers, clippers, shampoo bowls. A potential customer is anyone who wants to receive a hair care service, especially seniors and individuals with a disability. The salon has special equipment that will allow for a person in a wheelchair to receive a shampoo service. Moore Hair Salon LLC will  cater to people who have mental and developmental disabilities as well. We want to create a welcoming environment with a positive salon experience for people who are disabled. 

What We Need & What You Get

Moore Hair Salon LLC needs funding to secure the salon location and for the remodel to make it ADA accessible, The first year lease will be $15,000. The donations will also help with the purchase of ADA salon equipment and tools from approved suppliers. Also, for signage and the ADA approved automatic doors for easy access to people in wheelchairs.  Salon Equipment $18,860.

Funding in needed to have a logo designed, to build a website, and business software. Salon Logo and website $3500. 

Employee training, marketing and salon maintenance $10,000.

The Impact

This salon will be open to serve 900,000 plus people classified as being disabled in Missouri. There is also an aging population that is expected to increase by 15% in the next fifteen years. The Moore Hair Salon LLC will be able to increase their independence by providing a place that they can come and receive accommodating hair care services.

This total does not including people who suffer from temporary disability such as a stroke, a broken arm or leg, or to the young girl who has never had a salon experience because she is in a wheelchair.

The salon will cater to individuals with mental and developmental disabilities by providing them a safe and welcoming environment that they can come to receive hair care services.

The stylists are patient and understand that wait time is important. Services are not rushed and appointments are available.

People who suffer from cancer can receive exclusive treatments and privacy in the Moore Hair Salon LLC VIP room.

 A contribution to the Moore Hair Salon LLC will benefit the community by helping people have a better quality of life, by building self-esteem, by changing the face of beauty and how others treat individuals with disability. 


Risks & Challenges

Moore Hair Salon LLC is a new salon concept for the area. There is no precedent to follow. Salon Owner Katrina Moore and her staff have to do extensive hands-on research analysis and training to learn different behaviors that many of them have never had experience with.

A major challenge for the Moore Hair Salon LLC is creating awareness that this service is available because most  individuals with disability tend to keep to themselves and stay home. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Others can help by Liking the Moore Hair Salon LLC page on Facebook and share with friends. 

 Use the Moore Hair Salon LLC page to tell about friends or family members that can benefit from Moore Hair Salon LLC services.

Recommend the Moore Hair Salon LLC Home Hair Care services to individuals who can not get out and have a traditional salon experience. 

 Introduce Katrina Moore to other beauty and healthcare professionals on LinkedIn. 

Call for an appointment 573-424-6533

https://www.facebook.com/moorehairsalons?ref=hl

www.linkedin.com/in/moorekatrina
