story:
It is quite usual to see people eating in streets or at cafes with bare hands and they usually don't have enough time to wash hands later. This is huge hygienic problem. Children at schools, workers on work and almost everyone, its simply very hard to stay clean. As i think, i found an easy fix to that problem. Finger Food. 

I was working at hygienic institution for 2 years, 2 year in ambulance and another 2 years in pharmacy in Georgia. So that means i have vast experience in hygienic sphere. This problem is real and we all know that, but we are so used to it that often we don't even remember about washing our hands. 


11.000 of amount that I am raising will go on inventory and devices for making the product itself. 3000 on raw materials. 1000 on some other stuff needed to do all the work. As I will collect first 8000, work will begin immediately. I will buy only 1 special device and some raw material, witch i will use to make first thousand FingerFood. In case of raising whole amount, I will expand significantly and produce much more. 

I could not think of any other perks than just sending some amount of FingerFood to you. As you see, by donating 25$ you will receive 200 FingerFood and by donating 50$ - 450!  

My product is quite valuable to everyone. As I explained before, it is created to solve one of the biggest hygienic problem. Second, It will actively be used in cafes, restaurants, airplanes and schools. Only in Tbilisi there are more then 400 restaurants, in whole Georgia - more then 2000. In a really bad case, if only 3% of them will wish to buy at least 100 FingerFoods, we will meet revenue. I already was invited in television with my project and many people seems to like it.


The one and only challenge that i actually see, is the thing that people usually tend to fear new things that may become part of the usual life. Using FingerFood everyday may be very uncommon for some people. But when they will understand how comfortable and useful it is, they will use it for sure. 


I would like to ask you to share or tell your friends about this innovation. I am pretty sure they will at least like the idea, this will help me a lot. Thanks!

story:
For the last 6 months we have been working on an online shop that sells dietary supplements, skin care products and homecare products. The shop:





 Apart from the shop it is also a health and wellness website. Helping people be aware of choices that lead to healthy and fulfilling lives. 
We are an independent distributorship, selling products from various manufacturers in 3 different countries and growing fast. 

What We Need & What You Get

Why indiegogo? There are many options to raise money. We could have raised money through investors, venture capitalists, etc. While many businesses have seen much success raising money through those sources, we want ensure that we are in full control  and with that money you lose some control. We also needed a worldwide incubation platform, conduct market research and build some audience at the same time.
We are growing so fast, We need $15500 to fund our working capital  and asset financing
Money being contributed is going to :
Promotion is essential for  sustainability 
Development of the viprolife app
Site improvements
Distribution chain- Cash on Delivery

Perks
We ship to any part of the planet. looking foward to Mars
$350
Our range of herbal alternatives

Mind enhancement complex
-boost your mental activity. think more clearly and sharply
Herbal rest and relax
-calm your nerves, rest.with this natural blend you will be feeling great in no time
Herbal Digestive Complex
-soothes digestive discomfort. Natural blend

-masculine herbal complex a herbal blend natural libido booster

Other Ways You Can Help

You can still help us by sharing this campaign. Share this project on your social media accounts and personally reach out to family, friends, and colleagues..Sharing is caring. 
Thank You

story:
Dear Donors, Family and Friends: This is our second Crowd Funding Campaign for the Indiegogo Public-Private Partnership Campaign -Technical Assistance Center Program. 

Greetings: I am Donald Carroll, founder and President of D C Planning Consultants & Associates, Inc.(DCP). I am a professional urban planner with professional certifications in economic development and environmental science. 

Our campaign is a community development initiative that will formulate, advance and promote alternatives that are prudent, cost effective  and efficient in assisting communities with resilient and sustainable solutions to community problems. 

We are community partners that provide professional services/technical assistance to communities, businesses, non profit organizations and governmental agencies. This assistance is also offered in the capacity as a supplement to government. We provide technical assistance in research, community outreach, strategic planning, educational, workforce and job certification training. In short, our Technical Assistance Center Program is a "Think Tank-Community Training & Research Center". 

Our center and research training programs enable us to empower communities by providing community based solutions and contemporary  workforce training programs.  We provide access to government data and public policies in the areas of economic development, land use planning, community development, research study and socio economic data. We provide training (for OSHA Safety, environmental hazard awareness, environmental risk management and environmental compliance). We provide recommendations and solutions for business enterprises, community development initiatives and community driven-social causes.

Our community partnership is now firmly in place. We have an established community development corporation partner, along with several academic researchers and institutions of higher learning (state colleges as anchor institutions and community partners for teaching and internship opportunities). We also collaborate and work with land use law/municipal/real estate/corporate attorneys, former city planning directors, environmetal scientist, educators, commercial brokers and professional organizations that have agreed to collaborate and work with us in providing our services.   

In addition, we have membership with the Environmental Justice Group (we currently are community partners with the Environmental Protection Agency). We collaborate closely with the Environmetal Protection Agency in educational training and community outreach. We will soon enroll in the National Institute of Health and Environmental Science Small Business Innovative Research/Small Business Technology Transfer Programs (for enhanced research, educational training and job creation opportunities). 

Please visit the NIH web site to gain insight regarding the SBIR/STTR Programs. This is a program that we are currently eligible for enrollment and we will soon enroll and utilize to further promote innovatitve research training and job creation within our program. 

Our Public-Private Program is a prudent and cost effective community development initiative. It is needed for our current economic times (i.e., limited budget and manpower resources). We need your help in order for us effectively help others with technical assistance that provides solutions with meaningful impact. We seek all contributions big or small to this campaign goal. Every contribution is needed and important. This campign is for solutions to help communities thrive and grow and there is no compelling reason to not support this cause. We are data driven. We make recommendation based upon where the facts lead us. We follow and promote within our services best pratices with a passion for innovation and efficency.

We are seeking contributions to complete a series of critical action steps that will enable us to establish the following: a store front presence, hiring of technical support needed in Security Exchange Commission Law, IRS Federal Tax Law, advertising and marketing, purchasing and installation of additional infrastructure and equipment for expansion. Finally, the funds are needed in order to complete the application and registration process for additional working capital needs for our consortium to be able work and expand outside of Texas.

This campaign is important and critical to the execution of our business development intent and the required processes needed to obtain working capitial.  It is needed for sustainablity and self-sufficiency. Donations and community support is sought from family, friends, associates, and those who want and will support a viable program that can help communities and advance meaningful solutions for social causes that at the same time, promote resilient and sustainable communities.

We intend to advance and expand our capacity to serve additional communities in Texas and throughout the Southwest Region of the United States. We have the right team in place. We know our program will work. The math makes sense and it is efficient. It is now being implemented in other communities. Governmental agenicies are coming around and have recently started to embraced this concept. We are asking for support and we are looking to partner with communities businesses and other institutions for added value and win/win outcomes.

We have been successful with small economic development, environmental science and development service projects(pilot projects). DCP with its community partners now  intend to expand our scale and capacity in order to meet the projected demands and needs of our nation. Now your monetary assistance is sought in order to complete this community based business plan for the second phase of program implementation.

We hope to gain your support and to serve you as future clients.  Your support and contributions will help us go further along in this journey of advancinging safe, resilient and sustainable communities. 

All contributors will be formally recognized as the original Technical Assistance Founders. All contributors will recieve an attractive & formal proclamation with a thank you letter from the President of D C Planning Consultants. A distinguished list of the Original Founders will be formulated and proudly displayed for future visitors and guest to see (This founders list will be displayed on our web site, within our business store front (once developed). Our founders will be recognized during all pending banquets and formal ceremonies. Finally, our founders will be properly editorialized and acknowledged in the USA Today, The Houston Chronicle  and the Galveston County Daily News Papers.

Contributors that may be able and desire to donate $2500 and up are eligible to receive discounts of 10% on any professional services offered in the Technical Assistance Center Program (These contributors are our Gold Founder Members).  Our Silver Founder Members  are contributors that donate from $1000 to $2000 and are eligble to receive discounts of 5% on any professional service offered in the TAC program. All other donation amount will enable our contributors to be acknowledged as our original Founder Member. The perks cited will be implemented within 120 to 180 days after this campaign has ended.

What sets us apart from others organizations is our ability to combine land use, economic development and environmental science together for effective solutions. All fundamental building blocks needed for empowering  communities with solutions that will work, work well and have impact in promoting resilient and sustainable communities.

Our Dun and Bradstreet Registration Number is: 969891134.  Please visit our website @ dcplanningassoc.net. for an overview of our professional services and corporate capabilities.

Our point of contact information (email address and telephone number) is:  dcplanning@hotmail.com and 409-771-1741.

Thank you for your support and contributions. Donald Carroll, ESP, CCR, President D C Planning Consultants & Associates, Inc.

story:
Our Goal

To spend one year (minimum) in Hoi An, Vietnam working with Streets International teaching disadvantaged and impoverished youth hospitality skills and purchasing equipment and transport to assist their day to day lives.

No donation is too small! 

About Us
I have been a chef in Australia for 15 years and have worked with some of the worlds best resort and hotel groups including being a head chef with the Accor group and Intercontinental Hotels. I also hold a bachelor of business. My wife has been on the other side of the pass in the food & beverage department for 17 years. We have a lot of experience and knowledge to share.

We have travelled to Vietnam and eaten in the Streets Restaurant in Hoi An. It opened our eyes.... seeing food presentation and waitering at such a high standard ... We rapidly fell for Vietnamese food, the people and the culture. Right away we knew wanted to be a part of it! This is a sustainable business model giving children with next to nothing life skills.

What we give

  • One year (minimum) of our lives, we will not be paid during our time working full time for Streets International in Vietnam
  • We will organise the bicycles, tool kits, uniforms etc for students (see perks)
  • The shipping of all other perks will come from our pockets
  • Our ongoing expenses at home, during our time in Vietnam, will be paid for out of our savings NOT the donations to this project

What we need and where your donations end up

  • Flights from Australia to Vietnam
  • Purchasing of chef tool kits for students including uniforms, knives and books (see perks)
  • Purchasing twenty bicycles for students as transport to and from work (see perks)
  • Secure accommodation for us and our two infants in Vietnam for a minimum of one year 
  • General living expenses for us and two children for one year (our wages will be $0 during this time) (see perks for breakdown)

At the end of one year any remaining funds will be donated directly to Streets International or used to extend our volunteering. If you do not want to contribute to our campaign please consider donating directly to Streets International however we believe with our experience and passion every dollar donated here is worth ten to Streets International.

Perks

Please see our perks! Our aim is to help, work with and support this community in a sustainable way. We also have some donations from friends and business to give! Any expenses and all shipping from these perks is paid from our savings NOT campaign money.

Other stuff

This is our first campaign so any constructive criticism/advice on how it looks or is going would be helpful. We will of course share photos and blog on Facebook about our achievements, we are very proud of what we are doing.

story:
The Story

Hi! My name's Rich, a serial entrepreneur and self-employed dreamer. For the past few years I've split my time between working in the tech industry and pursuing a career in poker. So what brought me to this point in life? Sometime in 2012 I was comfortably working a standard 9-to-5 office gig when I suffered a stomach rupture and was nearly killed when my blood pressure could not be stabilized, resulting in me spending 2 weeks in intensive care. As a further kicker I was later diagnosed with the unpleasant liver disease, PSC. 

I think I could be forgiven if I gave in to a life of part time work and taking it easy at that point. Not so! My brush with mortality has made me determined to pursue my ambitions; and with the help of my partner I think we can achieve that. 

Poker is soaring in popularity right now, you need only look at events such as the Sky UK Poker Championships and as I type this, Poker is the number 10 most watched game on Twitch.tv. Unfortunately there still remains a conspicuous lack of full time card rooms in many counties, including Norfolk. I aim to bring a dedicated full time, player friendly venue to Norfolk and the surrounding areas. 

The Plan

I have already begun with much of the planning stages; and secured a large part of the finances; so the project will proceed with or without this funding - it's just a matter of how quickly! Currently our core team consists of 3 members and myself, all with specific strengths when it comes to day to day operations of the business.

I'm hoping to raise £30,000 to aid towards obtaining the proper licencing and interior fitting on the premises. By raising the funds partially here we are aiming to reduce the amount the business will have to borrow; allowing us to provide a more stable and better experience for members.

In contributing, you are helping to guarantee a dedicated, safe venue that will bring an already popular sport further into the spotlight - as well as create a new entertainment attraction for the surrounding areas.

Risks & Challenges

We may face delays obtaining the necessary licencing- gaming licenses require an application and appeals process. We can overcome this by being flexible on the location; but our primary intention is to offer a convenient venue for all of Norfolk.

Finally, although I have experience running a small business I have not attempted something of this scale before. However I hope to mitigate this risk by relying on the experience of the other team members, 2 of which have multiple years experience running businesses of various types.

Other Ways You Can Help

All donations are appreciated, but if you are looking for another way to help than spread the word. Please share to as many people as you can!

Thank you for taking the time to read this, I would love to hear any feedback or questions you might have.

Richard

story:
The Red Lotus Story

Aloha! My name is Reiko. I’m a sensei, a mom, a martial artist, a fitness enthusiast, a director, a friend… mostly just a girl trying to make the best out of this crazy life. I love keeping people healthy and happy and making a positive contribution to our community in Hawaii.

I own an amazing dojo called Red Lotus Hawaii filled with passionate, dedicated students who inspire me daily. We are the little dojo with the big heart. And my students are my family.



Here at Red Lotus we believe that being a “blackbelt” is a metaphor for personal excellence in all facets of one’s life whether you are 3 years old or 90! We want to motivate you, inspire you, and transform your life.

Motivate. Inspire. Transform.

But recently, we lost our home! Oh no! It was an awful blow.  Thankfully, we have found a new location, and we need your help to make it home. We need new mats, mirrors, bags and safety equipment so that we can keep fighting the good fight and continue making a difference in the lives of our students and our community.

Will you please help us?


Your Impact

Martial arts and fitness is never just a business. And I never measure the worth of my business with dollar signs. I measure our success by the smiles on the faces of students and their pride in their accomplishments. Some students have been training with us since we opened our doors in 2007!

With your help, we can create a space to continue servicing our ohana and community.

We need mats and mirrors and equipment to start doing that. We lost our mats and mirrors when we lost our space. We are trying to raise $8500 to replace them and get some new equipment. We will continue working with what we have, but your contributions will directly impact our success as a business and the success and safety of every student that steps onto the mat.




White Belt Contributor

Contribute $25 and you will receive an invitation to Red Lotus' Grand Re-opening Celebration!


Yellow Belt Contributor

Contribute $50 to receive a Red Lotus Mini-Nunchaku or Mini-Knife key-chain at our Grand Opening Celebration! Not only are each of these key-chains hand crafted, they are also functional kubatons for personal self defense. 

*Please Note: Woods and colors may vary


Green Belt Contributor

Contribute $100 to receive our new Red Lotus T-shirt at the Grand Re-opening Ceremony! Our New Stylish design is perfect for all you fitness and training needs! In addition to the T-shirt, you will also receive a Red Lotus key-chain. 


Blue Belt Contributor

Contribute $250 and receive a 1 month membership with  Red Lotus Hawaii! Work up a sweat in our Kick Boxing and Power and Core Class, learn self defense in our Hapkido classes, and have your kids start their martial arts journey in our keiki classes. In addition to your membership, you will receive a Red Lotus T-Shirt and Key-chain! 

*1 month Membership can be applied to existing membership, to begin a new membership, or may be gifted to a friend.



Purple Belt Contributor

Contribute $500 and receive a coupon for you and a friend to join our Red Lotus Kickboxer's Boot Camp; A six week course of kickboxing, power, and core training as well as nutritional counseling and personal coaching! Contributors will also receive a Red Lotus T-Shirt and key-chain.



Red Belt Contributor

Contribute $1000 to receive receive a coupon for three 1-hour Private Martial Arts of Personal Training sessions with Sensei Reiko! These lessons can be redeemed after the Grand Re-Opening Celebration. Contributors will also receive a Red Lotus T-shirt and key-chain.


Black Belt Level Contributor

Contribute $2500 to be a Black Belt Level Contributor! 
Black Belt Level Contributors will be presented with a customized, hand carved Bokken (wooded training sword) and hand made brocade carrying bag. Our craftsman will consult with you yo create a one of kind weapon that meets your specifications of size, and design. Depending on the detail, your bokken may be awarded after the Grand Re-Opening Celebration to ensure time to create a quality product.
Black Belt Level contributors will also receive a T-Shirt, and Key-Chain.


Note on Perks: All perks (excepting Black Belt Level Bokken) will be awarded at the Grand Re-Opening Celebration (date to be determined), if you are unable to attend we will make arrangements for you to claim your rewards.

Other Ways You Can Help

Our campaign runs through the month of June. Please SHARE, SHARE, SHARE. We would be so grateful for any contribution for our cause.

Mahalo nui loa!

story:
Howdy!

My name is Hannah Becker, and I'm a proud farmer at Willow Springs Farm in Franklin Co., Kansas. Since watching the TV show Bonanza at the young age of four, I've dreamed of becoming a cattle producer. Growing up outside of Washington D.C., my dream of starting a cattle operation seemed next to impossible; however, despite the challenges, I was determined to turn my dream into reality. Graduating with my Bachelor's degree in Animal & Dairy Science, and Master's degree in Business Administration, I headed west to stake my claim on a forgotten piece of land now christened Willow Springs Farm. I've been recognized as a Master Cattle Producer, and completed my Masters of Beef Advocacy and Beef Quality Assurance Certifications. 

At Willow Springs Farm our goal is to provide high quality grass-fed beef products for our community. We need your help to purchase five bred cows needed to start our grass-fed beef herd. These cows will produce annual calves that enter our grass-fed operation, resulting in high quality beef products sold direct to consumer and through regional food markets.

The Mission:

America’s farmers are rapidly disappearing. The average age of a farmer in United States is now over 58 years old. Only 6% of farmers are under the age of 35. While consumer demand for grass-fed and certified organic beef has drastically increased, the number of commercial cattle available continues to decrease, with 2013 alone seeing a 5.2% decline in supply. With America’s farmers disappearing, the questions must be asked, “Who’s going to feed our country in the future?”

This crowdfund campaign gives you and I the ability to answer “We will!” By helping Willow Springs’ campaign succeed, we’ll be doing our part to ensure America has enough farmers to meet our needs for quality food.

The Resources:

Our goal is to provide high quality grass-fed beef products for our community. We need your help to purchase five bred cows necessary to start our grass-fed herd. These cows will produce annual calves that enter our grass-fed operation, resulting in high quality beef products that will be sold directly to consumers and through regional food markets.

Here’s where the money’s going:

  •  Purchase five bred heifers to start our grass-fed beef herd
  • Update pasture with proper catch pen necessary for production
  • Clear and dispose of remaining brush from pasture location

The Future:

As anyone who’s farmed can attest, agriculture operations require a lot of money (or a big inheritance) to get started. Here at Willow Springs, we believe we can create a profitable and sustainable cattle operation with our own two hands. While our farm has been entirely self-funded, we haven’t let lack of financial resources stand in our way of progress. Our goal is to be able to annually produce enough grass-fed beef to provide annual protein needs of 150 Americans by 2020. We believe in working hard and investing in our own future, and want to invite our community to become involved in this crucial need. 

Together, we CAN feed America!

How to Help:

If you would like to be involved in Willow Springs Farm’s future, check out our farm product perks! Posted perk pics in Campaign "Gallery". 

Also, be sure to share the campaign link with your friends and family.  Follow Willow Springs on Facebook & Twitter. 

We appreciate everyone’s support!

story:
The Plan

3 Phases to implementing our dreams:

$20K start up with new website including membership/group classes/private sessions/multiple styles. The old site www.yogalivelink.com will be replaced with a new one to accommodate all the changes for group programs, various schedules, and membership.

$30K includes all of the above and gets the platform built to support instructors start their online studios,  AND YogaLiveLink will provide free classes to underserved population of kids in schools.

$40K will do all of the above and allow us to do a national marketing campaign to assist all the instructors with their online studios and grow the customer base in areas where yoga isn’t readily available or accessible.


The Vision

We are YogaLiveLink, the first interactive online private yoga and yoga therapy service available worldwide. We have been dedicated to providing quality, personal, and completely interactive private yoga sessions. This is not a streaming product or cookie cutter video program. You work one on one with your yoga instructor or therapist to address your specific and unique needs. In response to our fanbase demand, we plan to add a NEW program offering, Group Classes. Their dream is to provide the same great service they are currently receiving to a larger population of yogis worldwide. These class sessions will still be interactive. You will join in with a group and your instructor will be be able to interact with you directly because you can see them and they can see you. Yes, there is an opt-out button! Keep reading to see how together we can make this dream a reality.


The Benefit

The benefits of Yoga are increased body awareness, circulation, flexibility, mindfulness, focus, overall mental and physical strength and health…. YogaLiveLink offers you the same benefits, but you do not have to leave the house or your hotel room to go to a studio. You can stay where you are as long as you have internet, your laptop with a webcam, and your yoga mat.

Forget the stress making it through traffic on time for your class, finding a babysitter to watch your child while you are at the studio, or getting stuck in the dressing room waiting for an available shower.

You will use YogaLiveLink when your work or life schedule make getting to a studio hard, while on vacation or work related travel, anywhere - anytime. Find your favorite instructor or therapist and take them with you wherever you go.  YogaLiveLink is global and gives you the opportunity to practice yoga with others from around the world. How cool is that?


The Voice

"I think everybody knows how vital yoga is for longevity, inner peace, happiness and overall wellness. Now, with YogaLiveLink there are no more excuses. With my busy schedule, I am able to do yoga from the comfort of my home, in total privacy, at the time I choose, with my pets also relaxing around me, at a very convenient price, saving time (no commuting, etc.). I love it and I am able to use YogaLiveLink on a regular basis. Thank you YogaLiveLink! I tell all my friends about YogaLiveLink and many of them have asked if you plan to have group classes. Will you add that service, please?" ~Elena Pezzini, Ph.D


The Demand

1.  To answer a call to action:  New Group Classes - After providing interactive online private sessions for cancer patients for the last 2 years, many of our clients expressed the need for more affordable options. For many, the stress and expense of their treatments make it challenging to pay for private sessions. We are ready to act on the demand of the many fans who seek our specialized service by providing a NEW Group Class format to attract a broader base of yogis throughout the US and beyond.

2. To support others in their business endeavors:  New Opportunities for Yoga Instructors and Yoga Therapists -  YogaLiveLink is also building a platform for yoga instructors and therapists who are interested in establishing their own online yoga studio, under our name, without the brick and mortar expenses. We will provide everything they need online and assist in marketing. This is an incredible opportunity for any yoga instructor or yoga therapist who is looking for more billable hours and building their reputation and clientele.


The Impact

Our NEW class schedule will accommodate our current clientele and open up opportunities to those who do not have access or time to go to a studio. Our fans see the value in our service and feel strongly that YogaLiveLink should provide affordable alternative group programs to serve the masses. In addition, to the present interactive online private sessions, we will implement a membership model and the opportunity to take LIVE group classes. Interactive yoga is far superior to streaming a class because, if you like, the instructor can see you and can accommodate your personal needs, monitor your development, and help you practice yoga safely. And, this is available for people worldwide. Yoga for everyone!


The Need

Give your contribution today and help us bring more yoga to the world!

OR share our campaign on your social media and support our goal.

Can’t wait to get started…. Private sessions are already available.

click here for Private Yoga and Private Yoga Therapy

story:
Short Summary


Harambee Properties was started in order to develop communities that connect and bring residents together in ways that many land development companies do not.  The word Harambee literally means "All pull together".  While many have been fortunate to see empowerment happen individually, we still believe that our communities can do better.  We know that inequity is real.  We believe that we can do better. It's time we refocus how we live. Inequity does not have to be a norm, nor does it mean taking from others.  We must examine the structure, means, and results of how we live, why we do it, and where we can change it.  There is never just one right answer or solution, but rather a set or series of solutions.  Harambee Properties believes our approach to pocket communities is one of the solutions.  We are not just buying land, building a few houses, and letting the cards fall where they may.  We will start with the people, their skills, needs, and desires.  Then we will develop the pocket community based on those strengths and needs, taking steps to ensure the community has the tools to adapt, maintain, and grow.

We chose the city of Ferguson, MO for our initial project because it  has many of the right pieces that will allow our project to thrive.  Ferguson is rich with good people and small businesses.  It is growing in many ways, yet has the character and stability of an established town.  But like anywhere, inequity is very real. 

So, what is a pocket community?  It is a group of neighboring houses gathered around a shared open space that has a clear sense of territory and shared stewardship.  See a clip of Ross Chapin, author of Pocket Neighborhoods: Creating Small Scale Community in a Large Scale World, talking about his concept of pocket neighborhoods while tour one his sites.


 (houses not reflective of those that will be built in this project): 

                    

     

Pocket communities aren't new, they are tried and true all over the world in one form or another.  Harambee recognizes that community is not just a set of houses, but a set of people who are connected to work and live together. It is critical to recruit residents first. Together we develop the community around collective knowledge, skills, needs, and desires. Next we create an economic base so our pocket community can be self-sufficient and perhaps even income generating. That economic base could be a community garden, child development center, artist studio, LEED consultants, etc. depending on the residents needs, skills, and level of revenue generation needed. This component builds skill, creates jobs, as well as provides learning opportunities for residents and neighbors. This is one reason we want to start with one pocket community. It's not like a traditional land development. We are starting with people first, then building. That takes more insight, thoughtfulness, and cooperation.

The objectives of Ferguson's first pocket community are:

1.  Provide economically, culturally, and ecologically sustainable living spaces.

2.  Increase skill-building & entrepreneurial activity within the community.

3. Provide ongoing educational workshops and opportunities to build expertise level

knowledge in specialized community resources (such as LEED Certification, water mitigation, urban agriculture, small business strategies, etc.).

4.  Rebuild sense of a connected community.



What We Need

The estimated project cost for six small/tiny houses (ranging between 130 sqft - 700 sqft) plus one common building is $250,000.  This includes land purchase, construction materials, and land preparation as needed.

This campaign is to help get us started.  Most grants, small business start up loans, and other traditional funding sources prohibit land/real estate purchase. While tiny houses on wheels can be built in any backyard space, we would like to have a "home lot" to develop and plan around.  Of course we would love to be totally funded through this campaign, however we are asking for your help with the first $150,000.

Here's how it breaks down:

  • Purchase a lot(s) up to 1 acre w/ existing structure
  • Build 1 tiny house and retrofit/remodel/repair existing structure
  • Initial administrative costs (i.e. marketing, recruitment, training, local permits, site maintenance, campaign fees, etc.)
  • Site preparation such as installing electric, water, and sewage systems for the additional 6 sites. (remember these are small and tiny homes whose electric usage will likely be less than $600/yr on average.
  • Rewards acquisition & distribution back to you.

Our full intent is to partner with community organizations and businesses to complete this project.  We have already begun speaking with organizations like Youthbuild for remodeling and construction partnerships. We fully intend to seek product sponsorship, training partnerships with local and national educational and professional services.


The Impact

You work hard.  But far too many of us, work hard just to scrape by as the cost of living requires more and more of what we earn.  Just imagine if the bulk of your resources (the money, time, and benefits you earn) were available to you after you've paid all your living expenses!  What would you do?  This is the quintessential "If I was rich or won the lottery" question. Living in or supporting a tiny/small house pocket community allows for a shift in priorities; valuing experience over material, production over consumption.  We all work hard with ultimate goal of ensuring our family's health and safety so that we may enjoy each other and our surroundings.

  • Starting with the small house with the smart design - These homes are designed to not only be ecologically smart and sustainable, but economically smart as well.  We will intentionally design homes that fit well into a maximum 10 year financial package, yet still below traditional housing rates.  This frees up some financial resources now, but eliminates one of our biggest financial constraints in as soon as now (for those who want to pay cash for/sweat equity our smallest home) up to 10 years for those who opt for a bigger home.


  • Additionally, these homes will be designed to be energy and time efficient. Spending significantly less on energy and water consumption, as well as time spent cleaning and maintaining.
  • Shared common space gives our residents prime access to green space, and additional space for various use such as get-togethers, safe outdoor play, hobbies, etc.  The shared common space also fosters cooperation, connectivity, improved security, and a real sense of community. 
  • The economic base, whether it be a community garden, art studio/gallery, LEED or other certification station, etc, allows for income to be generated and cover the cost of routine community maintenance and improvements.  This will lower or replace neighborhood association fees, potentially generate income.
  • The development and operation of the pocket community will utilize local youth and other workers, building a skill base that will be available to our pocket community and the community at large.  The training and education will be incorporated as an ongoing resource.  Community members will gain skills up to expertise level that will allow them to maintain their own community, assist others, as well as consult on other projects if they desire.
  • Like all communities, price points can range from minimal to luxury. We favor mixed income communities because there is inherent benefit to heterogeneous communities. 
  • Harambee chose small & tiny homes due to the existing land, community, and economic demographic structure in Ferguson 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't make a financial contribution at this time, there are still crucial ways in which you can help:

  • Seek out people, organizations, and business that you feel would be good partners or sponsor and share this campaign with them,
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out to your networks!

Thank you for your support.  Let's pledge to:

Do Better. Be Better. Live Better. Live Inspired. 

Harambee!!

story:
Holly, Charlie, myself, and my dad hiking in the Langtang Valley, 2000.


Brief Summary

My memory of Nepal is of dusty streets, the sticky sweet smell combination of incense and garbage, the sounds of people yelling and chanting and laughing, children swarming and giggling, the dark green terraced hillsides, and small tea huts home to incredibly generous people with big pots of dal bhat and warm smiles.

My memories of Nepal are happy ones. They are an eight year old's memories.

However, in the aftermath of the ten year civil war (1996-2006) many children were left orphaned, or with devastatingly impoverished families. Forced from their villages through fear of the war or of the forced conscription, many families fled to Kathmandu and often ended up in states of more poverty and/or corruption. Families in the isolated rural villages were easy prey for child traffickers, who promised their children good education and better lives. But the reality was that the children were deposited in unregistered 'orphanages' where they did not attend school, were malnourished, forced into servitude and often abused. 

Human trafficking is one of the fastest growing criminal activities in the world. 41% of Nepal's population are aged under 16. For a country with a population of approximately 27 million, that's nearly 13 million children, many of whom are potentially at risk.

The Umbrella Foundation was established in 2005 as a direct response to this problem. Umbrella strives to create safe, healthy, happy, and nurturing home environments for these rescued children and youth, with the view of reintegrating them back with their families/communities of origin.

What Am I Doing to Help?

I am in my final term in the University of Victoria's Child and Youth Care Program. During this degree, students are required to work through three practicum placements. I have been given an amazing opportunity to work as a fourth year practicum student with the Umbrella Foundation in one of their childcare homes, in the suburb of Swayambhu, in Kathmandu. 

During my time with Umbrella I will be working directly with the children and communities within the childcare home. Umbrella holds a strong value of education and our role as volunteers is to promote this within the children; from walking them to school, to aiding them in completing assignments. Volunteers live in a separate location to the children and youth; there is a volunteer house within walking distance of all of the three childcare homes.

I am incredibly excited about this opportunity. I believe in what the Umbrella Foundation is doing and I feel blessed to be able to contribute in my own way.

Why Am I Asking For Money?

As a part of the agreement between the Umbrella Foundation and their volunteers, it is required that each individual brings with them a monetary contribution. This money covers the volunteers expenses (roughly $490 for three months) which includes rent for staying in the volunteer house, two meals a day in the children's houses and the running costs of the program. The remaining contribution ALL goes to Umbrella for the direct care of the children!

I hope to raise more money than the requirement of my contract. I believe that this cause is a worthy one and one which directly impacts the demographic at risk. My knowledge of Umbrella is that they operate in a way which is very transparent in regards to their intentions. The money being gathered is used directly to benefit the children's education, health and well being.

Why Am I Doing This?

As I begin the last term of my degree, with four years of theory and law and statistics and research and psychology and development and counseling training behind me...I know two things with absolute clarity;

One, is to always speak from the heart, to be honest and to walk with integrity. In any avenue of life, but specifically when working with people.

Two, is the importance of advocacy. I believe, with every fiber of my being in people’s right to information and education. This, to me, is what advocacy means. This is my drive behind the work that I do currently and the work which I hope to pursue in the future. I want to be an advocate for those who perhaps are unable to be an advocate for themselves due to their circumstances. I believe that it is a great injustice, which exists blatantly ‘invisible’ within our world, that individuals are forced to survive their existence without understanding their rights.

I want to provide a space for advocacy. I want to work to address the dichotomy between those with power of knowledge and those who have been disadvantaged by the systems which limit their access to that same information.

This is my driving force and the piece which I commit to bringing to my work wherever I go.

I see the Umbrella Foundation as a project which encapsulates so many of my own values surrounding human and social development work. I believe in their mission statements, their values, and all of the people within the organization to whom I have spoken have been genuine, helpful, passionate, and gone above and beyond to aid me through this process. To me, this speaks to the caliber of the organization itself. 

Other Ways You Can Help!

I also want to recognize the fact that not everyone is in a position which they are able/comfortable to contribute financially. That's okay! But, if you believe in what I'm doing and would like to help me out in a different way, please send this along to your own friends and family. Whether that creates more money or not isn't the point for me, the point is about awareness and the sharing of a story which I believe to be of value.

My Commitment to You

In return for your financial contributions, I commit to sharing my story, photos, and experiences with you. I will be writing a travel blog during my time in Nepal which I would love to share with you as a way of giving you some insight into how your money is being used.  This blog will be up and running closer to my leaving date (May 15th) and I will email out a link when it is ready.

If you would like some more information regarding human trafficking, specifically in Nepal, I wrote a research paper this year for one of my courses which summarizes some of the information available. I would be delighted to email a copy to anyone who would like to know a little more about this subject.
story_txt:
Holly, Charlie, myself, and my dad hiking in the Langtang Valley, 2000.Brief SummaryMy memory of Nepal is of dusty streets, the sticky sweet smell combination of incense and garbage, the sounds of people yelling and chanting and laughing, children swarming and giggling, the dark green terraced hillsides, and small tea huts home to incredibly generous people with big pots of dal bhat and warm smiles. 
My memories of Nepal are happy ones. They are an eight year old's memories. 
However, in the aftermath of the ten year civil war (1996-2006) many children were left orphaned, or with devastatingly impoverished families. Forced from their villages through fear of the war or of the forced conscription, many families fled to Kathmandu and often ended up in states of more poverty and/or corruption. Families in the isolated rural villages were easy prey for child traffickers, who promised their children good education and better lives. But the reality was that the children were deposited in unregistered 'orphanages' where they did not attend school, were malnourished, forced into servitude and often abused. 
Human trafficking is one of the fastest growing criminal activities in the world. 41% of Nepal's population are aged under 16. For a country with a population of approximately 27 million, that's nearly 13 million children, many of whom are potentially at risk.
The Umbrella Foundation was established in 2005 as a direct response to this problem. Umbrella strives to create safe, healthy, happy, and nurturing home environments for these rescued children and youth, with the view of reintegrating them back with their families/communities of origin. 
What Am I Doing to Help?
I am in my final term in the University of Victoria's Child and Youth Care Program. During this degree, students are required to work through three practicum placements. I have been given an amazing opportunity to work as a fourth year practicum student with the Umbrella Foundation in one of their childcare homes, in the suburb of Swayambhu, in Kathmandu. 
During my time with Umbrella I will be working directly with the children and communities within the childcare home. Umbrella holds a strong value of education and our role as volunteers is to promote this within the children; from walking them to school, to aiding them in completing assignments. Volunteers live in a separate location to the children and youth; there is a volunteer house within walking distance of all of the three childcare homes. 
I am incredibly excited about this opportunity. I believe in what the Umbrella Foundation is doing and I feel blessed to be able to contribute in my own way. 
Why Am I Asking For Money?
As a part of the agreement between the Umbrella Foundation and their volunteers, it is required that each individual brings with them a monetary contribution. This money covers the volunteers expenses (roughly $490 for three months) which includes rent for staying in the volunteer house, two meals a day in the children's houses and the running costs of the program. The remaining contribution ALL goes to Umbrella for the direct care of the children!
I hope to raise more money than the requirement of my contract. I believe that this cause is a worthy one and one which directly impacts the demographic at risk. My knowledge of Umbrella is that they operate in a way which is very transparent in regards to their intentions. The money being gathered is used directly to benefit the children's education, health and well being. 
Why Am I Doing This?
As I begin the last term of my degree, with four years of theory and law and statistics and research and psychology and development and counseling training behind me...I know two things with absolute clarity; 
One, is to always speak from the heart, to be honest and to walk with integrity. In any avenue of life, but specifically when working with people. 
Two, is the importance of advocacy. I believe, with every fiber of my being in
people’s right to information and education. This, to me, is what advocacy
means. This is my drive behind the work that I do currently and the work which
I hope to pursue in the future. I want to be an advocate for those who perhaps
are unable to be an advocate for themselves due to their circumstances. I
believe that it is a great injustice, which exists blatantly ‘invisible’ within
our world, that individuals are forced to survive their existence without
understanding their rights. 


I want to provide a space for advocacy. I want to
work to address the dichotomy between those with power of knowledge and those who
have been disadvantaged by the systems which limit their access to that same
information. 
This is my driving force and the piece which I commit to bringing to my work wherever I go. 
I see the Umbrella Foundation as a project which encapsulates so many of my own values surrounding human and social development work. I believe in their mission statements, their values, and all of the people within the organization to whom I have spoken have been genuine, helpful, passionate, and gone above and beyond to aid me through this process. To me, this speaks to the caliber of the organization itself. 
Other Ways You Can Help!I also want to recognize the fact that not everyone is in a position which they are able/comfortable to contribute financially. That's okay! But, if you believe in what I'm doing and would like to help me out in a different way, please send this along to your own friends and family. Whether that creates more money or not isn't the point for me, the point is about awareness and the sharing of a story which I believe to be of value. 
My Commitment to You
In return for your financial contributions, I commit to sharing my story, photos, and experiences with you. I will be writing a travel blog during my time in Nepal which I would love to share with you as a way of giving you some insight into how your money is being used.  This blog will be up and running closer to my leaving date (May 15th) and I will email out a link when it is ready. story:
Over the past 12-months, our girls have been questioning  the very fabric of our existence as individuals and as a collective.

  • In April, we got the horrifying news that 276 girls were abducted from their Nigerian boarding school, days before they were to take their secondary school examinations, by local Nigerian militia.  Nothing was being said or done to rescue these girls until the story went viral. As the tragic news spread, women around the world began to question the importance of our voices as black girls and women when we could disappear so easily. Fortunately, we continued to be great, and a #BringOurGirlsHome campaign was started to bring awareness to this horrific story.
  • Girls are also being bombarded with images and reality TV shows that romanticize fights and "bad girl" behavior, providing them with a distorted view of how girls and women should engage with each other.  
  • In addition, in 2014 83% of girls reported being bullied either in school or online. 83%. As a result, 1 out of 10  teens drop out of school due to repeated bullying (NoBullying.com). 

Our girls are questioning the very fabric of their existence. 

We have all been confronted with this question in one way or another: how are we able to be great amidst these circumstances?  

For this very reason, the theme for this year’s 8th Annual Sista-2-Sista Youth Summit is BE GREAT. We will explore what it will take to BE GREAT in social media outlets, in our relationships with others, and with our relationship to ourselves.

Being Great requires us to be exceptional, to challenge the status quo, to stand out, to speak up, and to do that which we have been called to do. Being Great requires courage.

We are building an army of courageous leaders.

Thank you for supporting us.

********************

About the Founder, Akua Soadwa

"When you make an observation, you have an obligation" - M.K. Asante Jr.

I boldly assert that YOU have made profound observations about your life and about the world around you. I believe that we have an obligation and responsibility to do something about these observations. I believe it is not OK for us to play small and ignore the things that we've observed. By virtue of you being on this page, I am clear that YOU are doing something about your observations and for that I thank you. Thank you so much for taking the time out to find out about what we are doing.

I started the Summit because there was moment in my life where I didn't feel empowered to just be me. I felt like I had to hide a part of myself to fit in. So the idea of creating a safe space for high school girls to really explore their greatness came as a result of what I felt like I needed. I created the Summit because I felt a void within myself. I needed a space where I felt free to just be. Over the course of my 8 years of creating the Summit, I have found that what has made this Summit so transformative for everyone that experiences it, is that I bring whatever I am dealing with personally, into the content of the Summit. It ensures that not only the participants leave with tremendous value, but that I too get to continue to grow and expand as a woman.

History of the Summit

For the past seven years, the Gye Nyame Empowerment Project (GNEP) has worked with community leaders and partners to empower over 700 Pan-African youth and women from the mid-Atlantic region, supporting participants to love themselves, demand the best, and embrace their full potential.

GNEP programs address real-time challenges in the Pan-African community, focusing on social and emotional health and combating growing youth violence in New York City and around the country. The success of our programs led to significant expansion in 2013 and we hosted our summit for girls in Kingston, Jamaica, and our first summit focused on Pan-African boys was hosted in Brooklyn.

We look forward to hosting the Sista-2-Sista Youth Summit in Ghana, West Africa in 2016.

We have gathered some of today's most influential and respected thought leaders and young professionals to facilitate workshops, perform and speak at our Summit. These allies and advocates include Susan L. Taylor, Founder of National CARES Mentoring Movement, Ava Duvernay, Filmmaker and Founder of AFFRM, Queen Afua, Author and Wellness Expert, Image Activist Michaela Angela Davis, Chrisette Michele, Recording Artist, Beverly Bond of Black Girls Rock!, and Misty Copeland, American Ballet Theater Soloist.

This work has been possible because of generous supporters, family and friends. To date, GNEP has produced our programs - often described by participants as transformative and life-altering - without grant or corporate support. While we continue to develop these funding streams, we are clear: we must not wait to address community needs because we are waiting on one big check. WE ARE THE ONES to make a difference. WE ARE THE ONES to change the course of what's possible for the next generation. And so, we are requesting your financial support to continue making this work possible.

Check out more images from Sista-2-Sista Youth Summit in the GALLERY.

BE GREAT is the theme for the 8th Annual Sista-2-Sista Youth Summit, kicking off on Friday, March 20th with the full-day program on Saturday, March 21, 2015 in Brooklyn, NY.

****************************************************

Summit Overview

The Sista-2-Sista Youth Summit (S2S) is a two-day empowerment summit connecting 200 high school girls of Pan-African descent from underserved areas across the mid-Atlantic with women making a difference in the areas of media, health and wellness, entertainment, education, and personal growth. Participants engage in workshops, live entertainment, and reflective activities. Utilizing a three step-process of self-awareness, self-appreciation, and self-actualization, the summit equips participants with fundamental tools to make well-informed decisions today and in the future. S2S is held every March during Women’s History Month.

Woman-2-Woman Conference (W2W) is a series of workshops specifically for adult-female parents, guardians, and chaperones of Sista-2-Sista participants and runs concurrently to S2S. The workshops address the same issues as those discussed with the girls and they serve as training for parents, guardians and chaperones to continue the dialogue with the young women beyond S2S.

Know a Teenager who Should Attend?

Have them register HERE. We encourage young women to complete the registration form on their own, but invite you to support them as necessary. WHY? Because SHE is GREAT.

If you are a woman who would like to attend the Woman-2-Woman Conference, registration here.

Why We Need Your Support and How We Use Your Donation:

Campaign funds will provide and cover:

Venue Fee; Event Insurance; Marketing Materials (Posters, S&R, etc.); Videographer and Photographer Expenses; 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know everyone isn't able to provide financial donations, but that doesn't mean you can't help

  • In-kind donations: We provide breakfast, lunch and snacks for 250 girls, chaperones, workshop leaders and honorees.  Is your group, organization or company interested in creating S2S bagged lunches, or snacks? If so, please email us at S2S@empowermegnep.org)
  • Become a S2S Volunteer Ambassador: Support us before, during, or after the summit with logistics and programming. 
  • Share, Share, Share this campaign with others in your network; 
  • Follow us on  Twitter @EmpowerMeGNEP and Retweet
  • Like us on Facebook 
Connect us with matched giving opportunities with your employer

Ask a corporation or business you know to be a Sponsoring Organization by making a generous financial contribution, providing them with a platform to connect and engage with the girls and attendees.

story:
Our Mission

The mission of the Abundance Co-operative Academy is to create an economically productive organic farm, which resembles an ecosystem in its promotion of biological diversity, while producing healthy and affordable food for communities in Nova Scotia. Food security is the foundation for our ultimate goal; developing a self-sufficient community, comprised of sustainable infrastructure, and driven by renewable energy.

Why is Our Project Important?

There exists a growing population of Nova Scotians who are interested in, but do not have access to affordable, locally grown, organic food. Our Farm will provide organic vegetables to communities across NS, specifically within the Halifax and South Shore areas.

We hope to provide a blueprint of sustainability to the youth of the present and future. Our success will be an example that they too can create an environmentally responsible living space for themselves and their communities.

Techniques & Strategies

Our strategies for becoming a highly productive farm include the integration of techniques and strategies used by the some of the best polyculture and permaculture farmers. Our farm will use many techniques innovated by Jean-Martin Fortier and Stefan Sobkowiak from Quebec, who have proven their techniques with great success. Jean-Martin has created a high-efficiency polyculture farm on an acre and a half and produces over $150 000 of gross income with a 40% profit margin!

One technique, for example, is companion planting. When symbiotic plants are cultivated correctly, it results in increased resilience to climactic extremes, pest and disease resistance, increased nutrient and mineral density and promotion of soil fertility.

A common example of this is corn, beans and squash, known as “The Three Sisters”. The cornstalks form a trellis for the beans to climb. The beans, in turn, draw nitrogen from the air, and via symbiotic bacteria convert the nitrogen to plant-available form. The broad leaves of the squash form a dense ground cover, inhibiting weeds and keeping the soil cool and moist! Stefan Sobkowiak successfully uses this technique in his orchard.

Sobkowiak also focuses on promoting biological diversity by creating habitats for many species of birds and bees. Encouraging biological allies increases the health of the ecosystem, which is fundamental to obtaining a high yield. Birds are the most effective way to control malicious insects that destroy crops. Bees pollinate plants, which is an essential stage of a plant's life cycle. Also, the amount of pollination is proportional to the plants' yield, so the more bees, the higher the production. We will be using these techniques as well as cultivating worms and mycelium. Worms create tunnels that allow oxygen and water to penetrate deep into the soil. A high worm population in the soil increases the rate of decomposition of organic matter, which ensures essential nutrients are available to the plants at every stage of growth. Mycorrhiza mycelium is a type of fungus that attaches to the roots of plants. The mycelium exchanges nutrients and acts as a signalling system for the plants. If one plant is under attack, it can use the mycelium connection to communicate to the other plants to protect themselves! Propagating these four biological allies will drastically increase the potential yield on the farm.

We will dig a pond near the barn so we can use the rainwater that falls on the roof to irrigate the crops. The water will then be pumped up to the drip lines in the field. The drip irrigation is an efficient way of irrigating the crops because minimal water is lost to evaporation. We will also need to construct a fence that will keep out deer and other animals that feed on crops. As our farm becomes established, we will be investing in additional water retention features, such as ponds and swales, as well as fruit and nut trees, with the goal of creating a more self-regulating perennial ecosystem.

By reducing labour inputs through the use of appropriate technologies, increasing planting density, diligent crop planning, and focusing on building soil fertility, it is possible to run an economically viable farm with minimal start-up costs. Additionally, all revenue from our produce will be used to further develop the farm and expand our production so that we can serve a larger portion of the community. Once our farm is an established producer of organic food, we will focus on the transition to a totally sustainable community. This plan includes generating clean energy, which will support sustainable infrastructure, providing a healthy and environmentally responsible living space.

Innovation

Beyond the techniques described above, what sets us apart from other growers is our innovative distribution and pricing system.

We will be offering subscriptions to an online store that will indicate which vegetables are ready to harvest along with an approximate market value for each. Subscribers will be able to choose the quantity and variety of vegetables in their order based on each week’s harvest, as well as how much they want to pay for the order.

This pay-what-you-want pricing strategy has been utilized by community-oriented businesses to establish strong relationships and loyal customer bases. This innovative business model will revolutionize the way people access locally grown organic food by providing a customizable online ordering platform, as well as a flexible range of payment options.

What We Need

The funds from this campaign will be going towards purchasing tools, supplies, seeds and infrastructure. Here is an estimation of the major starting costs of our project:

Garden Supplies & Tools:

Black tarps - $400

Wheel barrows & hand tools (shovels, rakes and hoes) - $800

Two-wheel tractor - $5800

Seeders - $300

Broad fork - $200

Harvest tools & baskets - $100

Seeds & Transplants:

Various vegetable seeds and transplants - $1000

Tree seeds -$200

Pond & Irrigation:

Excavator Fee - $3000

Pond plants - $100

Irrigation piping - $3000

Infrastructure:

Storage refrigerator - $4000

Polytunnel greenhouse - $5000

Fencing - $4000

Total Expenses - $27900

Risks & Challenges

There are many risks associated with farming because there is so much to learn and the climate is always changing. This project is driven by a volunteer labour force with the common desire of developing a sustainable community. There is a financial risk that comes with this pursuit, since we are sacrificing personal incomes to bring this collective vision into reality.

The reason we are willing to take such a risk is because we are passionate about this project. Our passion will give us the tenacity to overcome the challenges we will face. We understand that mistakes and failures are a part of learning. We appreciate that learning from our mistakes and failures give us strength and wisdom. We are determined to make this project successful.

Thank you for your support, it is greatly appreciated. If you would like to show your support for our project, please share this campaign on social media.

If you would like to discover more about our project, check out these links:

Facebook.com/AbundanceCooperativeAcademy

abundancecooperativeacademy.ca

plants' yield, so the more bees, the higher the production. We will be using
these techniques as well as cultivating worms and mycelium. Worms create
tunnels that allow oxygen and water to penetrate deep into the soil. A high
worm population in the soil increases the rate of decomposition of organic
matter, which ensures essential nutrients are available to the plants at every
stage of growth. Mycorrhiza mycelium is a type of fungus that attaches to the
roots of plants. The mycelium exchanges nutrients and acts as a signalling
system for the plants. If one plant is under attack, it can use the mycelium
connection to communicate to the other plants to protect themselves!
Propagating these four biological allies will drastically increase the
potential yield on the farm.
We will dig a pond near the barn so we can use the
rainwater that falls on the roof to irrigate the crops. The water will then be
pumped up to the drip lines in the field. The drip irrigation is an efficient
way of irrigating the crops because minimal water is lost to evaporation. We
will also need to construct a fence that will keep out deer and other animals
that feed on crops. As our farm becomes established, we will be investing in
additional water retention features, such as ponds and swales, as well as fruit
and nut trees, with the goal of creating a more self-regulating perennial
ecosystem.
By reducing labour inputs through the use of appropriate
technologies, increasing planting density, diligent crop planning, and focusing
on building soil fertility, it is possible to run an economically viable farm
with minimal start-up costs. Additionally,
all revenue from our produce will be used to further develop the farm and
expand our production so that we can serve a larger portion of the community. Once our farm is an established producer of organic food,
we will focus on the transition to a totally sustainable community. This plan
includes generating clean energy, which will support sustainable
infrastructure, providing a healthy and environmentally responsible living
space.
Innovation

Beyond the techniques described above, what sets us apart
from other growers is our innovative distribution and pricing system. 
We will be offering subscriptions to an online store that
will indicate which vegetables are ready to harvest along with an approximate
market value for each. Subscribers will be able to choose the quantity and
variety of vegetables in their order based on each week’s harvest, as well as
how much they want to pay for the order. 
This pay-what-you-want pricing strategy has been utilized
by community-oriented businesses to establish strong relationships and loyal
customer bases. This innovative business model will revolutionize the way
people access locally grown organic food by providing a customizable online
ordering platform, as well as a flexible range of payment options.
What
We Need 
The funds from this campaign will be going towards
purchasing tools, supplies, seeds and infrastructure. Here is an estimation of
the major starting costs of our project: 
Garden
Supplies & Tools: 
Black tarps - $400 
Wheel barrows & hand tools (shovels, rakes and hoes)
- $800 
Two-wheel tractor - $5800 
Seeders - $300 
Broad fork - $200
Harvest tools & baskets - $100 

Seeds
& Transplants: 
Various vegetable seeds and transplants - $1000 
Tree seeds -$200 

Pond
& Irrigation: 
Excavator Fee - $3000 
Pond plants - $100 
Irrigation piping - $3000 

Infrastructure:

Storage refrigerator - $4000 
Polytunnel greenhouse - $5000 
Fencing - $4000
Total
Expenses - $27900 
Risks
& Challenges
There are many risks associated with farming because
there is so much to learn and the climate is always changing. This project is
driven by a volunteer labour force with the common desire of developing a
sustainable community. There is a financial risk that comes with this pursuit,
since we are sacrificing personal incomes to bring this collective vision into
reality.
The reason we are willing to take such a risk is because
we are passionate about this project. Our passion will give us the tenacity to
overcome the challenges we will face. We understand that mistakes and failures
are a part of learning. We appreciate that learning from our mistakes and
failures give us strength and wisdom. We are determined to make this project
successful.
Thank you for your support, it is greatly appreciated. If
you would like to show your support for our project, please share this campaign
on social media.
If you would like to discover more about our project,
check out these links: 
Facebook.com/AbundanceCooperativeAcademy
abundancecooperativeacademy.ca

story:
SUB100 - Shackleton's Unfinished Business
Exactly 100 years on, a small band of people selected from thousands of applicants will take 100 days to tackle the formidable Antarctic goal that beat Sir Ernest Shackleton. But first they must pass a gruelling process of remote endurance tests in sub zero conditions.

Now it’s time to finish what Shackleton started.

Be part of it
Whether you want to follow in Shackleton’s footsteps, get your hands on some exclusive SUB100 gear, or simply want to get behind the team as they tackle this incredible journey there are plenty of ways to get involved.

You can donate to the expedition by clicking on the ‘Contribute Now’ button on the right side of the screen. Whether it’s £1 or £100, every penny counts in the race to be the first team to complete Shackleton’s ‘Unfinished Business’.

You can also get your hands on exclusive SUB100 gear by selecting ‘perks’; including limited edition SUB100 enamel mugs, hip flasks and fleeces.

Be part of this unique crowd-funded expedition and mark your name in history!

The adventure of a lifetime
Shackleton's original goal was so ambitious that today, one century later, it has not yet been successfully achieved. A land crossing of Antarctica  from the Weddell sea  via the Geographic South Pole finishing on the Ross Iceshelf – a terrifying trek covering more than 1800 miles of deadly dangerous, totally unmapped, ever-changing icy terrain filled with yawning crevasses that can open up under an explorer’s feet at any moment. 

Little wonder it has never been done - SUB100 sets out to put that right.

Are you tough enough?
Antarctica is a formidable, unforgiving environment worthy of only the very best - are you tough enough to take on this challenge of a lifetime? SUB100 want to hear from you!

Whether you're a seasoned polar explorer or looking to push your mind and body to the limit, SUB100 is accepting applications from members of the public to be part of the specialist team that will set out for the Antarctic later this year.

Every step of your incredible journey will be documented by a professional film crew for a televised documentary which will follow the successful completion of the mission, recording your place in history forever.

Applications are being accepted for the one-off administration fee of £10. 

Once all applications have been reviewed you may be required to attend a training and selection event in the United Kingdom where the final member of the team will be chosen.

The final member of team will have ALL his or her training, equipment, insurance and costs will be paid for. You will receive specialist training and preparation to make sure you're in peak condition for this once in a lifetime adventure.

Simply follow the links on this page and make your payment. On receipt of the £10 administration fee, we will contact you with details on how to make your application.

So what are you waiting for? Get involved and step up the adventure of a lifetime!

story:
Summary

Deephentai is a community that loves dolls.  

Deephentai's love towards dolls goes beyond human imagination that other people would call it a fetish.  The community has habits of re-structuring dolls in order to be penetrable.  You know what that means right?  I'm going to keep it PG-13 here.  I can't post the exact website link here due to community guideline for indiegogo, but this campaign is created to get fund to support such a site.  Not only dolls, but animes, figures, and typical japanese geek/otaku stuff.  If you are into stuff like that, than this is for you!  Especially if you are ecchi/perverted.

What We Need 

$20,000 - The community is trying to earn money to get a dedicated server, which runs about $300 dollars a month.  The community had been active for over 2 years on a basic cheap hosting.  However, this hosting has reached its limits and have been crashing too much recently.  (Host gators cheapest hosting package has many limits on its resources) so we're shooting for 3 years worth dedicated server fund to fix this issue.  The site (which you would have to research yourself to find *only for 18+*), will be getting a boost in performance from this.  Faster videos, images, chat, forums, and more.  There won't be as much as downtime and crashes!

If we somehow get more fund, we will do the following


$50,000 - hire artists and web programmers to create professionally designed websites and optimized forums.  

$100,000 - Open website  e-shop/online shop.  We will have enough fund to opena  shop to sell products with this amount.

$250,000 - Manufacture our own onaholes and dollfie bodies.  We will be able to create onahole that will fit dolls of all kind and manufacture them for cheap price.  We will sell customized orders through our websites.

$750,000 - Make our own dolls that are fully created for sex.  A pure sex doll.  What can be a better toy than this? 

$1,500,000 - get in contracts with japanese amateur artists to create a doujinshi database, ecchi light novel/visual novel database, and hentai database.  Of course we will try to publish the art for you all to see and not just the information.

Risks & Challenges

There are many people out there who thinks this is a weird fetish.  But this is actually a popular fetish that you probably wouldn't have expected.  I'd like the community to hold its place on the web and continue to share and grow.

For any questions, please email us at-

deephentailover@gmail.com
