story:
Who We Are

Boulder Baked is an award-winning family owned and operated dessert café and bakery that has become a Boulder institution as a favorite late night stop, or call, for Buffs, locals and visitors. We are open from 4pm to midnight for dine-in and delivery. We also provide our desserts for many weddings, parties and meetings.

Kirsten and Kevin Comstock are the sister and brother team now in their 12th year running the nightly operation. Kirsten works her magic in the kitchen, Kevin runs the front of the house, while our parents, Jim and Katie work behind the scenes. Like many families, we lost jobs and savings in the recession of 2008 and the faltering economy since. Luckily we had a thriving business and with Jim's talents and years of business experience we were able to expand the business, hire more people and provide for our entire family.

What We Need, Where & Why

We are raising $75,000 to help open our exciting new location in Denver. We found a great spot in the historic Baker district, right in the middle of the hip-strip on South Broadway. The building was originally a bakery starting in the 1920’s and we’re hoping to bring this awesome structure back to its glory days.  Unfortunately, we’ve discovered “historic” is a code word for unexpected expenses that have stretched our budget beyond our original $75,000 investment. Your contributions will go towards building improvements including re-wiring to bring up to code (we use a lot of “juice” to make all our wonderful offerings), kitchen plumbing, ADA restrooms and new floors.

What Do You Get

This is a unique opportunity to be a part of Boulder Baked Denver and start our nationwide chain. Perks include signature items, gift cards, discounts and free items and can be redeemed at either of our locations. The Founders Wall, Chair and Table plaques are in our Denver location only.  The picture for the Founders wall should be a head shot with a minimum size of 960x960 pixels. You will need to give us name, address and phone number so that we can set up your Founders accounts or so you can convert your current customer account to a Founders account.
Spins use a wheel like this to determine free item:

Why This Will Work

We know Boulder Baked is a winning business model because we built it from scratch. Despite economic slowdowns, we have a proven track record of growth and customer loyalty. Just last year we grew 14%. We've won multiple awards including Colorado Daily Best Desserts 2008 and 2014 and Best Bakery 2014. With the help of a great crew, we have successfully carved our niche in Boulder and are now ready and excited to open in the much larger Denver market.

We grew up in Denver and would love y'all to be a part of this because without our customers' dedication to Boulder Baked over the years, we wouldn't be here now, rocking out Boulder and ready to make our mark in our hometown.

How You Can Help

Your contributions, of any size, will be much appreciated. We are eager to move forward and open our new location, so even if you don't contribute please tell and forward this campaign to all your friends.

Please also stop in to either of our locations. We'd love to see you.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Dominic McMahon. I was born and raised in Belfast, Northern Ireland, but I've been a chef and pub owner for more than 20 years here in the U.S. Of all the restaurants and bars I've experienced here, the one thing I've missed the most is an authentic Northern Irish pub. Oh, there are plenty of Irish pubs around, especially if you like leprechauns and four-leaf clovers. But a Northern Irish pub is a whole different thing than a southern Irish pub, because Northern Ireland is a whole different place. Northern Ireland is as once beautiful and haunting, heartbreaking and inspiring, with culture, cuisine, history, music and traditions all its own. I want to share that with you in my first authentic Northern Irish pub, The Glensman.

What's different about The Glensman? In one word: everything.  The menu features traditional Northern Irish dishes like mackerel and prawns sourced and brought in fresh direct from Northern Irish waters. Northern Irish beers and whiskeys will take center stage, like Bushmills, Dunville, and Tennent's lager, with monthly beer and whiskey club meetings to taste new offerings.  

But the heart and soul of The Glensman is our culture. Northern Ireland has seen brutal periods in our history. I grew up during some of the worst of The Troubles in the 1970s. The effects of those terrible times show in our music and our art, which you'll experience in The Glensman. You'll hear the likes of Stiff Little Fingers, The Undertones, and of course, my fellow Belfast man, Van Morrison, while you have the chance to learn more about why Northern Ireland is the way it is through art, photos and stories throughout the pub. 

Donating to The Glensman pub project means a lot more than helping to open a restaurant. Sharing our Northern Irish history and culture helps us all better understand why Northern Irish people share solidarity and a commitment to community. Our commitment to community in The Glensman's culture is demonstrated in our partnership with non-profits that build families and communities up, like the Ars Bellum Foundation, which helps veterans with PTSD using art therapy. For us, a great pub experience means a great community experience, and we want to be part of the fabric of our neighborhoods. You can help make that happen.

We're in the home stretch

We've already started the project. We've taken a broken down, empty restaurant shell on Grand Avenue in St. Paul, and we're bringing it back to life. My partner, Kevin Naughton, and I have put $140,000 into The Glensman already, and the building's owner has contributed significant investments in upgrading its infrastructure. As unique as we are as a Northern Irish Pub, we decided, 'why stop there?' Let's do something extraordinary, and invite our friends into the spirit of community that defines us and our unique culture. We have a great team of management, staff and promoters, and we know that a strong opening vastly improves our likelihood of long-term success. We want you to be a part of The Glensman Clan.

So, that's great and all, you say, but what's in it for me? Great perks, of course! Whether you live nearby or not, we've got some cool stuff you'll like: pint and whiskey glasses, collectible t-shirts, tix to our upcoming shows, memberships to our whiskey and beer clubs. We've even got a beer and food pairing guide written by our bar manager, Sean Cook. So whether you live down the street or halfway around the world, you can be part of The Glensman's world.

All of the money we raise goes to the final costs of finishing the buildout, training the staff and opening The Glensman to the public. Our goal is to make this first location as strong as possible, and then look for additional locations in the next 2-3 years. 

Just how hard is the restaurant biz?

It's hard, there's no doubt about it. Competition is everywhere, and people are careful with how they spend their money. Food quality and great service are the baseline benchmarks, of course, but location is key, and knowing and reaching your customer base is critical.  St. Paul has the third-highest concentration of people of Irish descent in the country, and after nine successful ventures, we know how to reach our customer base and keep them coming back for more. We have the best bands with the biggest fan bases, our menu is a mix of featured originals and tested favorites, our staff and ambience is second to none, and our connections to the community have built lasting relationships that are essential to small business success.

You are part of that success!

Of course we'd love for you to contribute financially, but whether you can donate or not, you can spread the word about The Glensman. Word of mouth is a powerful marketing tool for most restaurants, and this is no exception. Be a part of a new vision for Irish pubs. Visit our Facebook page for updates and use the Indiegogo tools to share this with everyone you know. Thank you for your support!!

story:
A Bit About The Truck

When I first saw a fashion truck I said "This is what I need to be doing." So I did it! I bought a 14' box truck and have started outfitting it to become the fashion truck of my dreams. Think of your dream walk in closet- then put it on wheels! The Chic Stop will be stocked with beautifully curated clothing, accessories and goods for women. The exciting product mix of clothing, accessories, and goods will include:
-Creators: I will be selling goods made by local women. By supporting me you are supporting them as I aim to be a 'vehicle' to showcase their talents. This is what I am most excited about and I have already made connections with many local brands. Merchandise will include handbags, jewelry, scarves, candles, photographs and original prints.  (30% of business)

-New: I will be acquiring inventory from wholesalers. Current fashions that are curated- I will be hand picking all of the clothing I sell, a large focus will be on dresses. (60% of business)

-Resale: I will purchase high-quality clothing from my customers for resale. This will give my customers even more variety and the ability to earn some extra cash or buy new fashions on the truck! (10% of business)

I will be focusing on private parties and events for the first six months of business, as well as, opportunity to set up at open-air markets, festivals and fairs. Additionally, I already have my online counterpart set up- The Chic Stop.

With the help of my family and friends, I have had a great head start but, need a little bit more to ensure I open on time and with a great foundation for success. This is where YOU come in!

The Chic Stop is an entirely self-funded small business. I have been told countless times that I need to open my own store (or was it that I have enough clothes to open my own store...), however, opening a brick and mortar location comes with a large initial investment that I was not prepared to make. A fashion truck still needs most things you see in a regular store but, on a smaller scale. Choosing to open The Chic Stop as a fashion truck means pursuing my dream in a REALISTIC way.  

The Chic Stop Needs 2 Things To Get Rolling!

-GRAPHICS

The box must have high-quality exciting graphics to entice shoppers and have them wondering what's inside. This is a design idea I have for the graphics. Find out how to get your name on the truck by checking out the PERKS!


-GENERATOR

The Chic Stop needs a Honda eu2000i  Generator. The generator will run the lights, space heater or fan and register equipment.  I am striving to purchase a new one to ensure it will be in good working condition because my business depends on it. There also be a 3 year warranty with a new generator. This specific generator is quiet, compact, and highly recommended. 

Any additional funds will go towards the continued maintenance of the truck. 

"People who don't take risks work for people who do"

Of course starting a new business is a big risk but, I think not taking one is even riskier! I was unhappy working for a large retail chain and letting other people decide my future. I have always worked hard to achieve my goals and there is no limit to the possibilities available with The Chic Stop!

A Bit About Me

The Chic Stop is also an opportunity to put my degree and experience to work. I have a degree in Corporate Communication with a focus on Public Relations from Bridgewater State University. I was inducted into Lambda Pi Eta, the national honor society for communication studies. I have 8 years of retail experience from a big off-price retailer which has given me skills in management, cash counting, merchandising, analyzing business reports and customer service. I will continue working part time in customer service for the footwear company OOFOS, LLC. I also have a style blog, Weekend Style Book, that showcases how-to style current trends and be fashionable on a real-girl's budget- a principle I have integrated into my vision for The Chic Stop.

Other Ways You Can Help

A simple share means a lot! I appreciate any like, share, tweet, pin or advice you can give to help support The Chic Stop! I am currently looking for opportunities to park at small business in southern MA, if you are interested in having me or if there are any other collboration ideas you have please email me at shopchicstop@gmail.com.

Thank you! 

Camille Serrecchia
story_txt:
A Bit About The Truck
When I first saw a fashion truck I said "This is what I need to be doing." So I did it! I bought a 14' box truck and have started outfitting it to become the fashion truck of my dreams. Think of your dream walk in closet- then put it on wheels! The Chic Stop will be stocked with beautifully curated clothing, accessories and goods for women. The exciting product mix of clothing, accessories, and goods will include:


-Creators: I will be selling goods made by local women. By supporting me you are supporting them as I aim to be a 'vehicle' to showcase their talents. This is what I am most excited about and I have already made connections with many local brands. Merchandise will include handbags, jewelry, scarves, candles, photographs and original prints.  (30% of business)


-New: I will be acquiring inventory from wholesalers. Current fashions that are curated- I will be hand picking all of the clothing I sell, a large focus will be on dresses. (60% of business)
-Resale: I will purchase high-quality clothing from my customers for resale. This will give my customers even more variety and the ability to earn some extra cash or buy new fashions on the truck! (10% of business)
I will be focusing on private parties and events for the first six months of business, as well as, opportunity to set up at open-air markets, festivals and fairs. Additionally, I already have my online counterpart set up- The Chic Stop.


With the help of my family and friends, I have had a great head start but, need a little bit more to ensure I open on time and with a great foundation for success. This is where YOU come in! Thank you! 
Camille Serrecchia

story:
We are David and Cheryl Fanelli. We have opened the first legal cannabis cafe in America. We have lived here 27 years and were one of the first dispensaries in Colorado, until we were out priced for a license. It took us 15 months to get all the approvals we needed to be legal. We talked to everyone, including law enforcement so they would understand and endorse us. We even changed state law! In the end, many people and even a church stood up for us. We have been featured in Forbes and been on many TV stations, including Deutsche Welles and BBC. We have gotten worldwide attention for being the first! This is history!

We used our entire retirement fund to meet all the standards and pay the costs during the 15 months we couldn't open. We ran out of money at the kitchen and being able to buy merchandise such as t shirts and hats. With your help, we can get back on our feet, construct the kitchen and keep this historic place open. This is the first legal place after prohibition and it took a lot of blood, sweat and tears to get it open. Your contributions will make it possible to keep this groundbreaking club open and moving forward, so we can do more good things for people and cannabis.

At this point, we have had over 900 visitors from 9 different countries and all 50 states. They plan their vacations and travel around us. We are a destination.  Our club is a very classy, homey experience. We have first timers, all ages, all races, everyone is treated as family here and there are no barriers. You may come in not knowing anyone, but you will leave with friends. Our guest book is filled with love letters! People really appreciate being able to sit down with other people in a nice cafe setting and to enjoy their cannabis and conversation.
We need $30,000 to install our kitchen, get the various permits, cut a hole in the roof for the hood, have an architectural print done and procure the equipment we need. If we have a kitchen, people can eat good food right here, instead of sending them away. A kitchen is what we need to better serve the people who come here to relax and enjoy.
When you donate, we will give you a big thank you. Incentives include stickers, TShirts, lifetime memberships and lots of other cool stuff! We appreciate your help and want to give you a memento for your kindness. 
This campaign is about freedom. Cannabis is a nontoxic, helpful plant. By showing the world a good example, that smokers are everyone and quite normal, it is taking the stigma away from the people who choose this healthy alternative to alcohol, tobacco or pharmaceuticals. We are finally ending prohibition and we are the first shining example of this new freedom. No one should be a criminal for enjoying cannabis and we are working hard to get the message out in a real way that this is safe and should be available to anyone who wants it.

There are no real obstacles to setting up the kitchen except capital. It's just a process. We get the drawing, we get the equipment and install it correctly, we get approval from the health dept and a license. And another permit to cut through the roof and an engineer to plan that for the hood we will need. We have a kitchen room that has already passed inspection for plumbing and electric, so that is good to go. We just do whatever it is we have to do to make things right.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help by getting the word out! Passing this along to all your friends. Make some noise and let the world know! Indiegogo has very easy share tools you can use. Just click and help us return cannabis to the valued and revered plant it once was.
Not only could you be helping us in this endeavor, but it will get the word out about us as well. Thank you for any and all help you can give to this historic project. This Mom & Pop appreciate your kindness and good energy.

story:
In Summary 

We are a student driven service project that is geared towards creating a youth friendly Santa Fe community. We are currently working towards goals that include:

Teen Events: The main focus is to plan, schedule, and attend the events the group of active teens have envisioned.

Changing Stereotypes: This group is focused on changing the negative stereotypes that are applied to the youth and teens in the Santa Fe area.

A Poetree Art Installation: By creating a series of tree like sculptures for people to display poems and other verbal works of art on “leaves” ( which will be made of different colored light filters), this group is developing a creative outlet and interactive art exhibit for the people of our community.

AMPED Productions: AMPED  was founded on the notion that everyone and every teen in Santa Fe deserves the chance to express themselves  through performance, music, and visual arts. This group of young people is currently working on producing new music.

A Graffiti Wall Art Installation: This art installation would feature a permanent graffiti mural on one side of a wall. The other side of the wall will serve as a blank canvas for young graffiti artists to practice their art legally and without damaging property.


 What We Need:

We need money to pay for events, publicity, art supplies, and other miscellaneous expenses. We would also accept donations of supplies for art installations and events. The Poetree and Graffiti Wall groups need paint and building supplies to create their produts. 

 Impact:

Through creative place making, we are promoting an active and engaged youth culture in the Santa Fe Community.  We are also adding to the vibrant local art culture as a whole in Santa Fe. 

Challenges: 

One of our challenges is reaching the youth community in Santa Fe.  There are lots of interesting things going on in Santa Fe that no one knows about. Teens can't participate in events when they do not know about them. 
Another obstacle to our goals is that Santa Fe seems to have an economic and recreational environment that is geared to an older generation and tourists. This can lead to issues getting support for our youth oriented projects.

How You Can Help:

You can help make our impact stronger by donating the following: 
  • money for all sorts of miscellaneous expenditures
  • supplies for events including: foam dodge balls, glow paint, kickballs, volleyballs, other sporting equipment, and water coolers.
  • music production equipment
  • paint and other art supplies including: canvases, spray paint, scissors, glue, markers, tape, acrylic paints, paper, and glitter.
  • building supplies including: wood, hinges, screwdrivers, nails,screws, wood glue, hammers, palates, plywood, rope, clamps, etc. 
  • more money
  • your time and energy working alongside empowered youth
  • Help with advertising campaigns and promotion
If you are unable to contribute in any of those we would also appreciate it if you could spread the word about our project by liking us on Facebook or other forms of social media.
you can also help by offering your support, skills, political connections etc. to help us get our projects completed.

story:
Happy Hippy

https://www.facebook.com/HappyHippy2?ref=tn_tnmn

        

      


The NEED, Our Vision and Our Impact

Philadelphia is surrounded by farms, yet it is considered to be one of the largest food deserts in the United States. The first neighborhood grocery store was only made available to local Temple students and residents in 2010. Additionally, there is only one vegan food establishment out of approximately thirty on or near campus. A fruit truck and farmers market also frequent Temple's campus, but do not serve as a consistent option for students to purchase prepared, fresh meals.This means that there is one establishment that offers prepared plant based meals consistently.

 We see that the food truck culture at Temple University is growing increasingly strong with the Crepe truck, various taco trucks, insomnia cookie truck, Halal carts, smoothie trucks, and that there is a simultaneous rising interest in health awareness as well as sustainability. The Temple new co-op in Ritter Hall, 'The Radish' and the farmers market on Thursdays are perfect examples of this. We believe that the food truck culture will give us the vehicle to offer affordable fresh options to an eager community. Vegans, vegetarian, and health conscious eaters have expressed great interest and support for this idea. We believe that there is a great need for our food, as well as a population that will be receptive to sustainability practices, and fitness culture! 

We promise to empower students, community, and faculty members by serving nutritious food at an affordable price, becoming a platform for fitness, reducing our impact on the environment, and inspiring others to live spontaneously.

Some of our future goals include:

  • Sponsoring: FREE running, meditation, and yoga classes to encourage a culture of physical fitness for all levels at Temple University ...oh and you may find yourself in the midst of a dance party with us if you get lucky. 
  • Encouraging: An eco-friendly mindset by modeling sustainable business practices. This includes growing our herbs, some veggies, and spices on the top and sides of our truck! 
  • Fostering: Nutritional awareness through continual research. We will work with a nutritionist to design truck signage that provides customers with nutritional information about menu items. This will be presented in easily understandable percentages, rather than metric measurements or calorie counts. Percentages will encourage customers from 'veteran vegans' to 'veg curious' to monitor their sugar, fat, salt, protein, fiber, and carbohydrate intake in a clear, simple, cumulative way.  
  • Supporting: Local farmers by meeting with and establishing personal relationships with local farms. Fruits and vegetables available for recipes will also shift according to growing season, environmental impact, and availability. Happy Hippy will stay loyal to local farmers by expanding and being flexible with their product purchasing options to provide a steady source of income to local farmers
  • Our truck will be FUN and approachable. You will always be able to find us IN the truck following our passions for cooking, fitness, and a life filled with fun. We want to hear about your dreams, encourage you along your journey, swap stories, create lasting relationships, and build a supportive communal network. A Happy Hippy dances, sings, and follows their dreams.

Belltower at Temple University - Where we hope to hold our yoga classes! 

Where will the funds go?

  • The Truck! (approximately $15,000)
  • Appliances: juicer, refrigerator, grill, etc.
  • Licenses, permits, and insurance                         
  • Solar panels (let's get sustainable!!)
  • Install vertical gardens on the sides of our truck!
  • Install garden beds on the top of our truck!
  • Purchase compost bins for eco-friendly waste management
  • Credit/Debit card processing system
  • Truck signage with nutrition percentages
  • Paint the truck! 
What we have accomplished so far:
  • Created LLC to make company legal
  • Hired graphic designer to create Happy Hippy Logo.
  • Designed a sample menu.
  • Made a cash flow proforma to reflect realistic expectations and help us see our potential.
  • Printed business cards
  • Partnering with the Humane League for monthly Philly Vegan Drinks event at the Tattooed Mom to raise awareness about a plant based diet. 
  • Justine has resigned from her job three days before our IndieGoGo launch to work on growing our business full time

Our Food

"Life expectancy would grow by leaps and bounds if green vegetables tasted like bacon." -Doug Larson

Ok...think back to the last time that you ate multiple delicious slices of pizza and a soda for lunch. How did you feel? Admit it....we've all been there...most likely sluggish and foggy. Sometimes we call this food situation a 'food coma.' At Happy Hippy we still believe in dazzling your taste buds and your senses but WITHOUT weighing your body down. Food is fuel for our bodies and minds to move!! Plant based food is easily broken down, used, and expelled from the body, leaving you fueled and feeling fresh to take on your busy day! 

Nicole loves to travel and experiment with food. When she was living in Thailand she learned to cook  without using any words! The language barrier between her and her host aunt resulted in Nicole learning to cook delicious Thai dishes through hand gestures, motions, and using her sense of smell, taste, and touch! She has adopted this strategy into her cooking and hardly ever uses recipes.  She enjoys the freedom and the challenge that cooking with your senses creates. Happy Hippy original dishes will be crafted in this spirit. Our challenge is to make these dishes as wholesome as possible to keep you feeling fueled yet light throughout your day! Our menu items will be packed with all the necessary components of a well balanced meal-- carbs, fiber, protein, fiber, protein, healthy fats, essential vitamins, and of course...LOTS of flavor! 

Did you know.....??

  • Quinoa, Hemp seeds, Chick peas, avocado, chia seeds, almonds, and edamame are ALL protein powerhouses! 
  • Beans, kale, oats, bananas, sweet potatoes all contain complex carbohydrates! 
  • Fruits and vegestables are all high in fiber, which helps to keep you fuller longer 
  • AND BONUS--all of these plant based ingredients house essential vitamins and minerals essential to a healthy functioning body


Our Story

Fit. Fun. Fresh. Fuel. 

Nicole and Justine


  • Our names are Justine and Nicole, and we met six months ago at the beginning of a 200 hour yoga teacher training. 
  • Prior to teacher training, Justine did a three day fruit fast as part of a 40 day wellness workshop held by HotBox Yoga Studio in Manayunk. After the fast she experimented with giving up meat while continuing to train for a marathon. She completed that marathon in November on a plant based diet and felt light and energized.
  • Nicole grew up in rural Lancaster County where fresh, organic food was both affordable and abundant. When she left for college at Temple University these options were no longer available to her and she became interested in the relationship between food and well being of the physical body. Over the past several years she has visited Jamaica, lived in Thailand, traveled the US Midwest, paid Canada a visit, and embarked on a two and a half week tour of Europe with her two college roommates. Her travels showed her that people around the world generally eat much less and more fresh produce. Nicole believes that no matter the diet subscription, plant based foods are especially exceptional at naturally healing, balancing, and maintaining biochemical responses in our bodies to prevent disease, leading to a happier, healthier life. 
  • Nearing the end of our training, we began to realize that we both wanted to be of service to our communities and that our current jobs were not manifesting this purpose. On February 7, 2015, in a tiny coffee shop in Manayunk, the Happy Hippy Food Truck was born, and it is scheduled to open August of 2015 on Temple University's Campus. 

What will you get?

We are reaching out to our community to help make this dream a reality and bring fresh food to a community who so desperately needs it.
We wanted to make donating fun by offering cool perks for our supporters! 
The Breakdown:
  • $15: Social media shout-out and one free meal at Happy Hippy!
  • $25: All of the above AND: Eco-friendly Happy Hippy mason jar.
  • $50: All of the above AND: Vegan baked good and a Happy Hippy t-shirt. 
  • $75: All of the above AND: Yoga class with friends.
  • $100: All of the above AND: Special tasting invite for you and three friends to finalize our menu.
  • $250: All of the above AND: Invite to our opening Launch party.
  • $500: All of the above AND: Catered dinner for you and a group of friends with "adult" beverages.
  • $1,000: All of the above AND: Permanent menu item named after you!
  • $5,000: All of the above AND: Be a part of Happy Hippy forever and paint your name on our truck at our opening Launch Party!
 Other Ways You Can Help

This idea is possible because of the immense support we have received from family, friends, and the community. Here are some ways that you can support us!

  • Spread the word and make some noise about our campaign by liking our Facebook page and sharing on your wall! 
  • Share our IndieGoGo Campaign! 
  • Come to see us at events! 
  • Send us your favorite recipes and what you would like to see on the truck! 
  • We need your thoughts, questions, or suggestions! This is a group effort to bring change! Email us at: HappyHippyFoodTruck@gmail.com

Created LLC to make company legal
Hired graphic designer to create Happy Hippy Logo.
Designed a sample menu.
Made a cash flow proforma to reflect realistic expectations and help us see our potential.
Printed business cards
Partnering with the Humane League for monthly Philly Vegan Drinks event at the Tattooed Mom to raise awareness about a plant based diet. 
Justine has resigned from her job three days before our IndieGoGo launch to work on growing our business full time



Our Food
"Life expectancy would grow by leaps and bounds if green vegetables tasted like bacon." -Doug Larson
Ok...think back to the last time that you ate multiple delicious slices of pizza and a soda for lunch. How did you feel? Admit it....we've all been there...most likely sluggish and foggy. Sometimes we call this food situation a 'food coma.' At Happy Hippy we still believe in dazzling your taste buds and your senses but WITHOUT weighing your body down. Food is fuel for our bodies and minds to move!! Plant based food is easily broken down, used, and expelled from the body, leaving you fueled and feeling fresh to take on your busy day! 
Nicole loves to travel and experiment with food. When she was living in Thailand she learned to cook  without using any words! The language barrier between her and her host aunt resulted in Nicole learning to cook delicious Thai dishes through hand gestures, motions, and using her sense of smell, taste, and touch! She has adopted this strategy into her cooking and hardly ever uses recipes.  She enjoys the freedom and the challenge that cooking with your senses creates. Happy Hippy original dishes will be crafted in this spirit. Our challenge is to make these dishes as wholesome as possible to keep you feeling fueled yet light throughout your day! Our menu items will be packed with all the necessary components of a well balanced meal-- carbs, fiber, protein, fiber, protein, healthy fats, essential vitamins, and of course...LOTS of flavor! 
Did you know.....??


Quinoa, Hemp seeds, Chick peas, avocado, chia seeds, almonds, and edamame are ALL protein powerhouses! 
Beans, kale, oats, bananas, sweet potatoes all contain complex carbohydrates! 
Fruits and vegestables are all high in fiber, which helps to keep you fuller longer 

AND BONUS--all of these plant based ingredients house essential vitamins and minerals essential to a healthy functioning body








Our Story
Fit. Fun. Fresh. Fuel. 


Nicole and Justine

Our names are Justine and Nicole, and we met six months ago at the beginning of a 200 hour yoga teacher training. 
Prior to teacher training, Justine did a three day fruit fast as part of a 40 day wellness workshop held by HotBox Yoga Studio in Manayunk. After the fast she experimented with giving up meat while continuing to train for a marathon. She completed that marathon in November on a plant based diet and felt light and energized.
Nicole grew up in rural Lancaster County where fresh, organic food was both affordable and abundant. When she left for college at Temple University these options were no longer available to her and she became interested in the relationship between food and well being of the physical body. Over the past several years she has visited Jamaica, lived in Thailand, traveled the US Midwest, paid Canada a visit, and embarked on a two and a half week tour of Europe with her two college roommates. Her travels showed her that people around the world generally eat much less and more fresh produce. Nicole believes that no matter the diet subscription, plant based foods are especially exceptional at naturally healing, balancing, and maintaining biochemical responses in our bodies to prevent disease, leading to a happier, healthier life. 

Nearing the end of our training, we began to realize that we both wanted to be of service to our communities and that our current jobs were not manifesting this purpose. On February 7, 2015, in a tiny coffee shop in Manayunk, the Happy Hippy Food Truck was born, and it is scheduled to open August of 2015 on Temple University's Campus. 




What will you get?
We are reaching out to our community to help make this dream a reality and bring fresh food to a community who so desperately needs it.
We wanted to make donating fun by offering cool perks for our supporters! 
The Breakdown:


$15: Social media shout-out and one free meal at Happy Hippy!
$25: All of the above AND: Eco-friendly Happy Hippy mason jar.
$50: All of the above AND: Vegan baked good and a Happy Hippy t-shirt. 
$75: All of the above AND: Yoga class with friends.
$100: All of the above AND: Special tasting invite for you and three friends to finalize our menu.
$250: All of the above AND: Invite to our opening Launch party.
$500: All of the above AND: Catered dinner for you and a group of friends with "adult" beverages.
$1,000: All of the above AND: Permanent menu item named after you!
$5,000: All of the above AND: Be a part of Happy Hippy forever and paint your name on our truck at our opening Launch Party!


 Other Ways You Can Help
 This idea is possible because of the immense support we have received from family, friends, and the community. Here are some ways that you can support us!  Spread the word and make some noise about our campaign by liking our Facebook page and sharing on your wall!  Share our IndieGoGo Campaign! 
Come to see us at events! 
Send us your favorite recipes and what you would like to see on the truck! 
We need your thoughts, questions, or suggestions! This is a group effort to bring change! Email us at: HappyHippyFoodTruck@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

Hi. We are Cowtown Restaurant (Aroun (Ronnie) and Mike Allmond)

We've been making the best burgers and breakfasts in town for the past 3 years at Cowtown Farmers Market. In 2014 we were named one of the best place to have breakfast in South Jersey by The New Jersey Journal.  We’ve loved every minute of that time, but we're ready to take our restaurant concept to the general public on the main road!! We're raising funds to open the next great restaurant: an incredible: American,Thai and Southeast Asian fusion.  It’s about time we have a restaurant to satisfy the ever changing, growing and adventurous favors pallet of this community.  

Don’t worry WE ARE NOT LEAVING COWTOWN FARMER MARKET. We will still be open for market days and the rodeo season Saturdays night. As long as the Wonderful Awesome Harris family will still have us. WE LOVE THEM!!! We have big plans for our little business, but to get there we need your help. We don't want to finance our new restaurant conventionally, through banks or investors, because if we go to investors, we risk losing our autonomy, and if we go to the banks... we don't involve or give back to our community. We’re not asking for a handout! We’re offering the community a way of participating in this new restaurant by paying it forward.  Fund us to feed you!

We're already invested and ready to make this happen!  All we need is some additional funding.  We want to do this our way...with you! With this Indiegogo campaign, our first goal is to raise $15,000 to improve and update our kitchen at Cowtown.  Our true dream is our secondary goal of raising $50,000 to help open a second location on the main road. We want to stay here and grow with this community!!

What We Need & What You Get

For the past year our restaurant model has been in development. We are going to keep doing what we are best at, which is offering a personable, quick service showcasing seasonal fresh recipes from cuisines across the world. In addition to our AWESOME HAND MADE BURGERS, we will offer innovative Thai cuisine. Our restaurant will be a happy relaxed spot for everyone. Grab a quick bite alone, have a romantic dinner or lunch with your girlfriends.
Here are some comments about our food:

Nicole Hastings-Warner — 5 star Love this little gem of a restaurant!! Best Thai food around! Loved everything we had!!! Even better that they are local!

Christina Vasquez — 5 star Love the friendly feeling from everyone and the great food! =)

Melissa Lippincott — 5 star What a pleasant surprise!! The Thai food was delicious! We are looking forward to trying some of the other Thai dishes & the kids enjoyed the classic, hot dogs & cheese fries!! A great find & reasonable prices.

Richard Bongiovanni — 5 star Best burger ever! Open 5 days now, try this place you won't be disappointed!

Lora Lowery — 5 star Good homemade food! Thai is excellent, burgers are great too. Glad to support a local, family restaurant.

Evan Kooker — 5 star Yummy stuff at good prices! And next door to the rodeo to boot! Dinner before the Rodeo! Then dessert after the Rodeo! Makes for a great Saturday night! And the staff are Very Friendly and Helpful!

The Impact

Our current location is very well known for market days but we do not have road frontage to attract our potential customers. There is a great opportunity for us to grab the brass ring and fill one of this community's culinary voids.

Where will this money go? We will use our Indiegogo funds to build the kitchen, permits and signage. We already have everything else ready to go.  We have dining room furnishings, menus done and decors.  

Risks & Challenges

In the restaurant business 1 in 4 restaurants close or change ownership in their first year. 60% fail in 2 years or less. We have survived for 3 years now, beating the odds.

Our price controls and seasonal menus have contributed to our success and we will continue this in any larger scale business model. Our low overhead has also helped, and the lessons learned in food thriftiness will help us shape our restaurant business.

Our restaurant will be beautifully designed with personable and individualized service, a modularly scaled employee model, and innovative seasonal dishes that speak to the diversity of our city. Our research and experience in food service has given us valuable insight into how we can be the best. Our employees will taste everything and be encouraged to give feedback and cross-train with multiple duties within the restaurant.

As soon as investment is acquired we will immediately permit our plans with the city, consult engineers, form a construction crew and begin our renovation. Our goal is to bring fresh homemade deliciously exotic food to people in this city and to create another culinary institution.

Relying on our friends for strength, our peers for advice and on our families for support has been very important to us and we are grateful for all of them. We want to give back to the city, to our loyal customers and to everyone we depend on. To do so we will continue to be open to change and take hardships as they come. Starting this new evolution in our business will not be easy but we believe it will be worth it.

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!
